Ms. Mamou Dembele will use her loan to buy a bale of used clothes at the Segou general market. Retail sales are for cash or credit through home delivery, as itinerant vendors or at the Medine Market, to both men and women customers. 

Ms. Mamou Dembele hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA to be reinvested in the business and to take care of her children's schooling.

loans.use: Buy used clothes

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, de 35 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su madre, su hijo pequeño y su pareja, juntos buscan progresar cada día. 

Desde hace tres años, este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la producción de prendas de vestir (como polos, pantalones cortos y otros de tela) en el taller que administra  al lado de su pareja; ahí trabaja su conyugue al lado de un ayudante. Esta muy satisfecho pues el negocio es muy productivo ya que la producción en prendas de vestir aumentó en los últimos tiempos; pero lo único que lo ha detenido en su negocio es que no tiene un local de material noble donde desempeñarse con tranquilidad  y con frecuencia debió trasladarse de un lugar a otro. Como es un hombre emprendedor tiene planeado en el futuro ampliar su taller y comprar mas maquinas de coser para contratar mas personas, con el objetivo de comercializar en mayor cantidad y obtener mejores ganancias.

José tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales de construcción que le hacen falta para terminar el taller que con mucho esfuerzo esta acabando de edificar. 

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
35-year old José lives in his own home with his mother, young son, and his wife. Together they work hard to make progress on a daily basis. For the last three years, this enterprising man has earned a living making clothing such as polo shirts, shorts etc. in the workshop he and his wife run with the help of an assistant.

José is very content as his business is doing well and production increased in the last few months. The only thing holding him back is that he doesn’t own even a simple stall where he can do his job in peace and quiet so he has to move frequently from place to place.

As José is an enterprising person, he is making plans for the future. He wants to expand his workshop and buy more sewing machines so that he can employ more people, sell more products, and earn more money. He is planning to use the loan to buy the construction materials he needs to complete the workshop he is working hard to build.

loans.use: construction material

loans.name: Marlene Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Marlene, tiene 57 años de edad, es originaria de Telpaneca  municipio  de l departamento de Nueva Segovia, pero actualmente vive en centro del departamento de  Estelí, es casada, tiene2 hijas, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida y alquiler de cuarto. Inicio este negocio en el año 1998 para cuando sucedió el huracán Mitch en ese entonces ella tenia 45 años, sus primeros clientes fuero unos extranjeros que pertenecen a una iglesia mormona . A la edad de 17 años  comenzó a trabajar en el negocio de sastrería, sus padres la ayudaron para que estudiara un curso de sastrería esta actividad la ejerció  hasta 1998 que fue cuando inicio con su  negocio propio.  
Para  administrar su negocio cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor, también recibe apoyo de un hermano que vive en los Estados Unidos.
El alquiler de cuarto lo comenzó motivada por unos extranjeros que tocaron su puerta preguntando por alquiler de cuartos. 
El crédito lo solicita para comprar una ventana de aluminio, vidrio,  cerámica, pintura, remodelar cuartos de su negocio. Con el préstamo podrá mejorar el servicio a sus clientes para que tengan  un buen confort  y mejorar la presentación de su vivienda, ya que al mejorar la infraestructura delas habitaciones  podrá atraer mas clientes y expandir su negocio.  
Tiene como plan futuro construir más habitaciones, ponerle garaje a su negocio. Como metas principales  terminar de pagar los estudios universitarios a su hija menor quien actualmente esta cursando tercer año de administración de empresas y poner un  negocio de fritanga  a fuera de su casa.
texts.en:
Marlene is 57 years old and she is originally from the municipality of Telpaneca of the department of Nueva Segovia. But she currently lives in the central region of the department of Esteli. She is married and she has 2 daughters. She is a merchant and she sells prepared foods and she rents out a bedroom. She started this business in 1998, when hurricane Mitch happened, at which time she was 45 years old. Her first clients were foreigners that belonged to a Mormon church. She started to work at the age of 17, working at a tailoring shop. Her parents helped her to attend a course in tailoring.  This was her business until 1998 when she started her own business.

Her eldest daughter helps her to manage the business and she also receives some support from one of her brothers who lives in the United States.

She started renting out a bedroom because she was motivated by some foreigners that knocked at her door inquiring about lodging.

The loan that she requests will be used to purchase a window, glass, ceramic tiling, and paint to remodel the rooms she uses for her business.  With the help of this loan she will be able to improve the service she provides to her clients in order to improve their comfort and to improve the presentation. Improving the infrastructure of the bedrooms will attract more clients and she will be able to expand her business.

Her plan for the future is to build more bedrooms and to put a garage in for her business. Her primary goal is to finish paying her youngest daughter's university tuition fees. She is currently in third year of business administration. She also plans on setting up a fast food business in her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to remodel bedrooms used fpr lodging

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es:
Don Salomón , tiene  53 años de edad, es casado, tiene  7 hijos , es originario de la comunidad llamada Ocotolillo, en Estelí , de oficio agricultor ,lleva 20 años de edad, debido a su condición humilde  solo llego cuarto grado de primaria para poder llegar al colegio tenia que caminar 2 horas . Aprendió la agricultura  con su papa que se dedicaba a la caficultura y el trabajo jornal , a la edad de 6 años  ayudaba a arriar bueyes para siembra de granos básicos.  A los  23 años se caso . Con 10 metros de tierra que su padre le dejo comenzó a trabajar, se independizo y asi  ha ido aumentando a 5 metros  mas de tierra.
Solicito el crédito para darle mantenimiento de la finca del café y aumentar el área de siembra. Con esto espera que su producción de quintales de café aumente, mejorar sus ventas, incrementar su capital de trabajo. Dentro de sus planes esta tener una finca productiva en un 80%  de granos de café mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
Tiene como meta preparar a todos sus hijos para que puedan ir a la universidad y sean personas de bien y útiles a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Mr. Salomón is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. He is originally from a community called Ocotolillo, in Estelí department. He has been a farmer since he was 20 years old. Due to his humble means, he only reached the fourth grade of primary school. He would have had to walk two hours to reach the high school.

He learned farming from his father, who worked as a coffee farmer and day laborer. When he was just six years old, Salomón helped drive oxen for planting basic grains. He married when he was 23 years old. He became independent when his father left him ten meters of land that he began to work, and since then, he has expanded his land by another five meters.

Salomón is requesting this loan to perform maintenance on his coffee farm and to increase the area that he will plant. He hopes that this will increase the amount of coffee he produces, thereby improving his sales and boosting his working capital. His plans include having a farm that produces 80% coffee beans, and improving the infrastructure of his house.

His goal is to prepare all of his children so that they can attend university and become good people who are useful to society.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee farm and to increase the area that he will plant

loans.name: Miler

texts.es: Miler tiene 41 años; convive desde hace 18 años con Eva. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Huanchan. El carisma que irradia es producto de su trabajo. Su vida se centra en el cuidado de sus cultivos de papa y arveja, los cuales siembra desde hace 11 años. Lo que más de gusta de su trabajo es poder invertir el dinero ganado en el bienestar de los suyos. El trabajo constante, es su principal característica. Ya que también se dedica a la ganadería; con las 6 vacas lecheras realiza queso; los cuales vende a los intermediarios que comercializan en el producto lácteo a los diferentes mercados de abastos. Aparte de ello en épocas de campaña agrícola, trabaja en el trasporte de papaya a la ciudad de Pucallpa, donde le pagan por el traslado de la fruta.  Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo pues necesita un soporte económico para los gastos familiares. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Unión huanchan”, y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollado, pues encuentra una oportunidad de lograr sus objetivos. Miler, invertirá el crédito en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, asimismo de varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Miler is 41 years old and has lived with his partner, Eva, for 18 years.  They have three minor children who live with them in their own home in the Huanchan rural area.  His charisma is a result of his work since his life has centered on caring for his potato and pea crops.  He has been growing brops since he was 11 years old.  What he likes best about his work is being able to spend the money he earns on his loved ones.   His main characteristic is that he is constantly working and also raises livestock.  He has 6 dairy cows and makes cheese which he sells to merchants who sell dairy products to the many wholesale markets.

Apart from this, during harvest season he also transports papaya fruit to the city of Pucallpa where he is paid for the transportation.  His main difficulty is the lack of working capital since he has to cover household expenses.

He belongs to the "Unión Huanchan" communal bank and this is his fourth loan through MFP, where he feels he has been able to develop and have the opportunity to reach his goals.  Miler plans to use the loan to buy bags of pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds and sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed belongs to the Fazal colony which is a small housing colony located in a small city called Arifwala. Arifwala is located in Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. 

She married M. A. and has four children. Two of them are studying and the others stay at home. Khursheed herself sews clothes for her neighborhood clients to bear the financial burden with her husband. She operates her business from her home. 

Her husband is a fruit vendor. He put fruit on his cart and visits different streets of the city to sell the fruit. Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy a new cart because his current cart has become rough and needs replacement.  On the new cart, he will be able to put more fruit which will enable him to operate his business better. 

Khursheed is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and will help him make his business more profitable.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khursheed.

loans.use: To buy a new cart for fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo V. de 49 años vive en el municipio de Malambo, donde tiene un criadero de pollos y cerdos; él desde hace más de 12 años, aprendió esta actividad,  gracias a que acompañó siempre a su padre cuando  transportaba alimentos para una empresa de cría y comercialización pollos. Así fue que junto a él y sus hermanos, iniciaron con 10 galpones en el patio de su casa y 100 pollos;  cuando este negocio fue creciendo obtuvo logros comerciales como el de inscribirse como proveedor de una empresa del estado y con estos alcances también aparecieron grandes desafíos, pues en el lugar de instalación de sus galpones se  presentaron problemas de luz y de agua y  algunas  pérdidas; fue así como Alfredo decidió trasladar su negocio hace tres años con la ayuda de un familiar,  para una vereda que reunia todas las condiciones requeridas para una cría adecuada;  esto le ha facilitado su trabajo y ahora está mas tranquilo y entusiasmado, en mejorar la productividad de su negocio y se ha vinculado al Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje,SENA, donde participa en un proyecto comunitario de asesoría técnica para la  cría y levante. Su financiamiento con Kiva, es el primero con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo requiere para comprar 500 pollos, 9 bultos de concentrado, 65 gallinas ponedoras de huevos y 10 cerdos, asi incrementaría su capital de trabajo y aumentaría a 1000 pollos su cobertura comercial para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Alfredo V. is 49 years old. He lives in the municipality of Malambo, where he raises chickens and pigs. He learned this business more than 12 years ago, thanks to the fact that he always accompanied his father when he was transporting feed for a business that raised and sold chickens. Thus, together with his brothers, he began with 10 poultry sheds in the yard of his house and 100 chickens. As the business grew, he achieved commercial successes such as becoming registered as a supplier for a state enterprise. However, with these achievements also came great challenges: for instance, there were problems with electricity and water in his poultry sheds and he suffered some losses. Because of this, three years ago Alfredo decided to move his business with the help of a family member, relocating it to a lane with all of the necessary conditions to raise animals appropriately. This made his work easier, and now he is more at ease and enthusiastic about increasing the productivity of his business. He has joined with the National Learning Service, SENA, where he participates in a community project providing technical consulting for raising and fattening animals. His loan with Kiva is the first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and he needs it to buy 500 chickens, 9 packages of concentrated feed, 65 laying hens, and 10 pigs. This will allow him to increase his working capital and expand his commercial coverage to 1000 chickens, in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy 500 chickens, 9 packages of concentrated feed, 65 laying hens and 10 pigs.

loans.name: Marieme

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Marieme works hard to support her family.  She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending and selling coconut wine. 

Marieme has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.  She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Wolale  Marakasso 1 Group

texts.fr:
WOLALE MARAKASSO 1 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent  exclusivement du sésame.  Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans  et sont à leur deuxième  prêt de campagne. KADIA, la première assise à droite avec une écharpe noire, compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, de la semence de sésame, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, la récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de SAN, de DAH et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 29000 à 30000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
Wolale Marakasso 1 is a group of married women from the village of Cinzara in the San prefecture of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 38 years old with at least five children.

They grow exclusively sesame. To make their crop-farming profitable, group members decided two years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. Having successfully repaid previous loans, they are now on their second agricultural loan cycle.

Kadia, first sitting on the right with a black scarf, wants to use her portion of the loan to buy sesame seeds, small farming equipment and agricultural inputs at the general market in San.

After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while so that they can gain value before being resold at the general market in San, Dah and in surrounding markets, retail (often in bulk) against cash mainly to customers coming from large towns.

After selling their agricultural products each member of the group hopes to achieve profits between 29,000 and 30,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay loan interests and cover ongoing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and operating as a wholesale seller in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, beans, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, beans, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Patricidra

texts.en:
Patricidra, a 53-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, has been planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living for over 30 years, earning approximately Php 8,000 a month. She is requesting a new loan of Php 16,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds for her farm.

In the future, Patricidra plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Remigia

texts.es:
La sociaLa socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “ROSALES D. SAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Saylla, Provincia D. Cusco, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Remigia; la socia tiene 49 años; la socia es soltera;  La socia tiene 4 hijas D. las cuales dos D. ellas son independientes y y aún apoya a las otras dos; la socia desea que sus hijas prosperen y ayudarlas en sus estudios, una D. ellas viajo a Estados Unidos por unos meses, la socia tiene una chicharronería restaurante ubicado en el distrito D. Saylla, la socia venD. ricos chicharrones, trucha frita con papas doradas, caldos D. gallina, chayro, entre otros platos; la socia desea invertir el prestamo en esta ocasión en la chicharronería, la socia está ampliando el baño público y desea invertir en la compra D. materiales, para ampliar el baño y accesorios para el mismo, la socia también invertira una parte en la compra D. carne D. cerdo y D. papas por arroba. La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra D. carne, papas y comprar accesorios para la implementación del baño público D. sus restaurante chicharronería.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Remigia, 49, is a member of the “Rosales D. Saylla” communal bank which belongs to Saylla District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is single and has four children, two of them independent and two still dependent.  She wants her children to progress and she wants to help with their schooling.  One of them traveled to the United States for a few months. 

Remigia has a ‘chicharronería,’ a restaurant in Saylla district where she sells delicious fried pork, fried trout with fried potatoes, chicken soup, and ‘chairo’ (traditional soup from Peruvian highlands), among other dishes.  She wants to invest the loan in the chicharronería.  She is expanding the public rest room and wants to buy materials to enlarge the bathroom and furnishings for it.  She will also use part of the loan to buy pork and potatoes by the sacksful.  She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of meat, potatoes and to buy furnishings  for the chicharronería restaurant’s public bathroom.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the restaurant.

loans.name: Sabentee Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Sabentee” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to invest into their own businesses. 

Salamatu is the leader of this group. Salamatu is 48 years old and married with 3 children – 1 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Salamatu sells soaps and has been a businesswoman for 18 years now. With the help of this loan, Salamatu will invest in her business by buying soap making materials like palm oil, caustic soda, etc. in order to produce a large quantity of soaps for sale.

loans.use: to buy soap making materials such as palm oil, caustic soda, etc. in order to produce a large quantity of soaps for sale

loans.name: 58 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Thúy is the leader of the four-member group, the 58 Điện Biên Solidarity Group. She is 52 years old and is married with two children. Thúy lives with her family in Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall where she sells meat. Thúy’s main business challenge is the lack of capital. She joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has successfully repaid one previous loan.  

Thúy is requesting a loan to purchase meat to sell. With the profit from her loan, Thúy hopes to buy a motorbike and more land. She also hopes that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Desde joven Leonardo ha sido emprendedor y ha considerado que trabajar independiente le permite generar ingresos para su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida, desde hace algún tiempo, Leonardo tiene una tienda donde vende diferentes productos de la canasta familiar, así mismo cuenta con un criadero de cerdos que le permite obtener mayores ingresos. 

Actualmente Leonardo necesita de un préstamo para comprar un refrigerador y así ofrecer otro tipo de productos a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas, así mismo realizará algunas adecuaciones locativas.
texts.en:
Leonardo has been an entrepreneur from a very young age and has considered that working independently allows him to generate income for his family and to improve his quality of life for some time.  Leonardo has a store where he sells a variety of products needed for basic family consumption.  He also raises pigs that produce additional income.

At present, Leonardo needs a loan to buy a refrigerator in order to be able to offer other types of products to his customers and improve sales; he will also do some remodeling in his store.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and to do some remodeling.

loans.name: Victor Raul

texts.es: El Señor Víctor es casado y tiene 02 hijos que están en etapa escolar, él señor se dedica al servicio de transporte (TAXI) desde hace 02 años, comenzó alquilando el carro a su hermano y con el tiempo se compró su auto propio que tiene en la actualidad, el crédito solicitado es para comprar algunos accesorios a su auto (4 llantas), arreglar su motor y hacer una reparación general para que esté en perfectas condiciones para su labor diaria y así poder brindar un buen servicio. El Sueño del Señor Víctor y de su familia es el tener la casa propia, y además el tener una empresa de servicio de transporte (TAXI) para así poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida. El Señor Víctor está muy agradecido por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor is married and has two children who are of school age. He has been providing taxi services for two years. Victor started out by renting a car from his brother and over time was able to buy his own vehicle which he now uses. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a few accessories for his taxi (four tires). He will also pay to have the motor fixed as well as for general repairs so that his vehicle will be in perfect condition for his daily work. This will enable him to provide good service.

Sr. Victor dreams of owning a house with his family. In addition, he wants to start a taxi company so that he can generate more income and have a better quality of life. Sr. Victor is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to purchase four tires and pay for repairs to keep his taxi in good condition.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a 57-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 18 years old.

Apolinaria has been engaged in farming for 30 years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. 

Apolinaria hopes for her business to grow. She also desires to see all her children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Etoiles Plus Group

texts.en:
Gérard is the chairman of the group “Etoiles Plus,” which is made up of 20 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE DRC in order to develop their businesses.
Gérard has been running a general store since 2005. He has good relationships with his customers. He likes his business and he is working hard to achieve his goal of someday being a general good provider in his environment. 
Gérard is happy to be one of HOPE’s clients. He intends to use his next loan to buy two boxes of soaps and one sack of sugar to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. Each day, his business brings in a profit of $30. 
Gérard is 51 years old, single and the father of three children aged between 6 and 18. All of them are pupils.

loans.use: to purchase two boxes of soaps and one sack of sugar for resale.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William, administra un taller de mecánica automotriz, vive con la esposa y dos hijos de 4 y 3 años de edad. William aprendió el oficio de mecánico como empleado de un taller, hace 8 años, actualmente atiende a los clientes de 8:00am a 7:00pm, realiza reparaciones en vehículos.
Actualmente necesita comprar un Jack, dos micas hidráulicas y otras herramientas manuales, con esta compra estarán en mejor condición para reparar los trabajos que los clientes le lleven, dando un buen servicio.
Su aspiración es tener casa propia, ya que actualmente no posee, espera que después de mucho trabajo tenga la facilidad económica para poderla comprar o construir.
texts.en:
William manages an auto repair workshop. He lives with his wife and 2 children who are 3 and 4 years old. William trained as a car mechanic at a workshop for 8 years. Currently he attends to customers from 6:00am until 7:00pm. He repairs cars. He currently needs to buy a jack, 2 hydraulic lift bottle jacks and other hand tools. With this purchase, they will be better able to repair the work the customers bring them, offering them a good service.

His ambition is to have his own house as he currently doesn't own one. He hopes that after much hard work he will have the economic ability to buy one or build one.

loans.use: to buy a jack, 2 hydraulic lift bottle jacks and other hand tools.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida de 26 años, es una mujer soltera, con 2 hijos de 9 y 1 año.  Después de la separación con el padre de sus hijos, sólo vive con sus dos hijos en una casa propia. A pesar de ello, no se amilana y trabaja la tierra, por que es lo que le gusta hacer y lo que sabe hacer muy bien. A su corta edad, ésta madre joven siembra plátanos, café, paltas, yuca, etc. Lida muestra seguridad cuando se trata de comandar sus cultivos. Ante ello Lida menciona: “anteriormente lo que nos dificultaba era el personal, no tenía el apoyo de amigos ni familia, pero tenía que recurrir a préstamos para contratar personas”. Además menciona que la mala yerba había destruido gran parte de sus sembríos, situación que ha sabido manejar con esfuerzo. Cuando sus 2 hijos crezcan, Lida espera tener el dinero suficiente para tener una bodega bien surtida y equipada, del mismo modo trabajar la tierra paralelamente. Con éste serían 6 los préstamos que obtendría de MFP, por esa razón ella necesita de mucha ayuda para conseguir lo que se trazó como meta. A Lida le encanta trabajar con su banco comunal por que son personas que están siempre alrededor suyo y comparten los mismos ideales. Con el dinero Lida podrá comprar abono para los cultivos de café y plátano, cuyo precio asciende a 120 soles la bolsa.
texts.en:
Lida, 26, is a single mother with two children, ages 9 and 1. After separating from her children's father, she lives alone with her kids in their own home. In spite of that, she isn't discouraged, and works as a farmer because that is what she likes to do and what she knows how to do well. This young mother plants plantains, coffee, avocados, yucca, etc. Lida shows confidence when it comes to taking care of her crops. She says "before our biggest difficulty was staff, not having the support of friends or family, but I had to take out loans to hire laborers." She also mentions that weeds destroyed a lot of her plantings, a situation that she has learned to manage through hard work.

When her two children grow up, she hopes to have enough money for a well-stocked store and to also continue farming. This will be her 6th loan with MFP. She needs a lot of help to achieve her goals. Lida loves to work with her village bank because they are people who are always around her and share the same ideals. With the loan money, Lida will be able to buy manure for her coffee and plantain crops, which costs 120 soles per bag.

loans.use: to buy sacks of compost.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta, age 44, is married with three children.  She lives in the Philippines.

Marietta is a farmer and she also raises pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for eight years.  Marietta requests a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase coconut fruit. 

Marietta has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Marietta hopes that profits from her business will help her provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase coconut fruit.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin runs a rice-farming business that has an area of 1.2 hectares. He has been managing it for almost 21 years. He is 43 years old, is married, and blessed with four children. Among his four children, one has settled in marriage, and has a separate house; two are still studying, and the other one is still single.

He and his wife are doing some field activities to minimize their labor expenses. However, they still need to hire laborers to be able to keep the expected date of sowing and transplanting, but his capital is not sufficient. So, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy certified seeds of rice, fertilizers, herbicides, and to pay for the labor costs of rice farming. He is hoping that he can improve the farm land and provide all the materials needed to care for his rice crop. Through his patience in cultivating and improving his rice fields, he can earn greater profit to make a living. In addition, he can support his two children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as certified seeds of rice, fertilizers, herbicides, and to pay for the labor cost of his farming business.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie is 27 years old, single and from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Freddie provides transportation services to local community member to earn a living.  He has been in business for three years and earn 7,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Freddie joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Freddie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to pay the cost to maintenance and repair his motorcycle. 

Freddie hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay the cost to maintenance and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Yual

texts.en:
Yual is a 25-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business of selling beer in Bor, South Sudan for the past two years.

Yual requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
This is Narcisa.  She is 56 years old and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Efren, a construction worker, and they have a child. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.

Narcisa is a mineral water distributor. What she does is buy mineral water from wholesalers and resells it to her customers in five gallon containers for a profit. She also earns additional income by selling snacks in their area. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of mineral water. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Narcisa dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She also hopes to have a mini store someday. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business.

loans.name: Hector Homero

texts.en:
With experience from the El Paso Chamber of Commerce and seven years of teaching Hispanic entrepreneurship, 72-year-old H. Homero is titled the El Paso Business Coach. This is a name his son titled him with to bring in more business. H. Homero said he has witnessed small businesses struggle, stay small, and sometimes, flop. This encouraged him to begin The Ascend: Entrepreneurial Growth. The company is almost three years old now. H. Homero noticed a need to build a stronger economy and stop the cost of business. “We won’t build our economy if we don’t build ourselves,” he stated. The Ascend: Entrepreneurial Growth assists in coaching small businesses on maturity, building infrastructure and creating a system to ensure a business works as an organization.

Through his business, H. Homero offers a workshop at no cost to local business owners entitled: “Blueprint for Business Growth.” He, as well, has others that he charges for. H. Homero’s main advantage is the offered one-on-one coaching of his clients and reasonable price compared to major franchise groups. Since he offers the one-on-one coaching, H. Homero’s assistance is client-limited. Because of this, he works with anywhere from a dozen to 20 clients annually. 

The current hindrance for H. Homero’s business is his marketing presence. H. Homero stressed the complications of working with minor businesses. He said, “The trick is to bring (his coaching) to those who can’t afford it.” H. Homero expressed that he would love to decrease his prices for those who want and need his help, but at the moment, he cannot afford to do so. H. Homero requested the loan to purchase office equipment and market his business. His primary goal for The Ascend: Entrepreneurial Growth has not been as dramatically accomplished as he expected, he said, however the loan from ACCION Texas has helped. A returning client, H. Homero said one of things that happens as a small business is that projects and advancements such as purchasing software or other supplies are put off until capital is earned, which in turn, holds the business process. “The loan helps me grow the business now,” he said.

H. Homero’s work involves educating other entrepreneurs. He said the company is trying to break ground and bring people to his office. As he noticed, other businesses are using their profit to pay franchised business coaches to teach them rudimentary skills they really do not need to pay for. He added: 89 percent of small business owners are sole proprietors leaving that one person to cover every expense and find solutions to every problem, something he is familiar with. H. Homero is also a sole proprietor of his business who sometimes collaborates with other successful business owners. He, too, has learned about small business and entrepreneurship by conducting first-hand interviews with now household names of different industries. 
To find out more about H. Homero and his business, visit his website at: http://www.ascendeg.com. To view his interviews with major corporation heads, visit heho.utep.edu.

loans.use: To pay for software and office supplies.

loans.name: La Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
La señora HAYDEE MARILUZ  de 49 años de edad de estado civil viuda, con 03 hijos menores de edad. Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “La Sagrada Familia”.
Actualmente se dedica a la Venta de Comidas en el mercadillo de su localidad, vende menú almuerzo y cena, etc. El préstamo solicito para invertir en la remodelación e implementación de su puesto de venta, dándose la oportunidad para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Desea en el futuro comprar su tener su propio restaurantes, ella está ubicada la primera persona lado derecha viste con una un polo color negro está sentada en una silla.
texts.en:
Haydee Mariluz, is 49 years old and widowed, with three young children. She is a member of the comunal bank "La Sagrada Familia".

Currently, she sells food at her local market, she sells lunch and dinner menus etc.

She is asking for the loan to invest in the remodelling and implementation of her sales post, giving her the opportunity to improve her economic income.

In the future she wants to buy her own restaurants. In the picture she is the first person on the right wearing a black polo shirt and sat in a chair.

loans.use: to sell foods at the market.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a married father of 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is a serious farmer who sees the need of expanding his project to animal rearing.  

Kenneth thanks Kiva for the loan given to him that allowed him to purchase eucalyptus seedlings for planting.  He is sure this long term project will help him in the future. 

Kenneth's other business is a motorcycle transport business where he transports people from one place to another at a cost.  On realizing that he does not have the qualifications for formal employment, he decided to employ himself by selling a piece of his land to earn income to buy a motorcycle.  

Kenneth did not stop here, he also started farming to supplement his income.  As this is not enough income, he would love to reduce his milk buying expenditures, and has requested a loan to buy a cow for milk production.  He is challenged by unpredictable weather changes, just like other farmers. Kenneth took a photo with a motorcycle which is one of the businesses he does.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production.

loans.name: Lenko

texts.en: Lenko S. lives in the village of Djerovo, Kardjali district. He is 56 years old, divorced and has a son. Lenko S. starts his sartorial business in 1995. Before that he has been a taylor in a state company for 9 years. He opens an own workshop in his own building in Momchilgrad and has worked in it until 2001 when he hires a small factory and sets his business there. Now Lenko produces clothes which he exports mainly to Turkey. He has 4 employees in his factory. Lenko S. wants to buy two more sewing machines. One of them costs approximately $ 1000, so he needs a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: to buy two more sewing machines

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: H. H. is 38 years old. He is married and has two kids – an elder son and a younger daughter. H. has had his own agricultural business for five years. Before that he was in Germany for six years where he had several jobs. Now H. tills 30 hectares of land on which he grows Lucerne, savory, balm and other herbs. H. H. needs a $1200 loan for seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: For seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks of used shoes for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Keeping busy with two different businesses, Gloria has still found time to consider expansion.  Monday through Friday she runs a copy center and offers her services as a typist.  Her store is located in front of a university and receives most of her business from the students.  For the past four years since she began her business, she has experienced steady growth and recognizes the potential to expand the scale of her business.  She would like to convert her copy center into an internet café.  With her prime location for the university students, she feels it would be easy to quickly make the profit necessary to pay back her loan.  By combining the services of internet, copying and any necessary dictation, Gloria's copy center could turn into the one-stop shop for all the students' technological needs.

loans.use: Convert her copy center into an internet cafe.

loans.name: Rouwaida

texts.en:
Rouwayda is a 38-year-old woman, mother of five children, living in the village of Aytate in the rural area of the Chouf. Rouwayda has been a tailor since the age of 18 and is well known in her village for her embroidery work. Rouwayda has been a client of Majmoua for the past 3 years. As with her previous loan, she needs the money to buy fabrics and accessories that she will use in her work.

Rouwayda is part of a group with other women. The group consists of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. Group lending is based on incremental increase of the loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaborative approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards the economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: Buy fabrics for embroidery work

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
CHRISTINA, age 29, named her shop after her 6-year-old daughter, and only child, Michelle. “Michelle’s Cosmetics,” which sells wigs, creams, soaps, and other cosmetics, has now been open for 3 months. Before starting this business, Christina sold Chinese imported clothing but found that the competition was too steep in her locality. Making little to no profit, she decided to move on to selling cosmetics, which she heard had a better market.

Now with cosmetics, she can earn a profit of around $10 a day. While hiring a helper and paying about $45 a month for her shop’s rent, she hopes to use some of the remaining profit in conjunction with a loan to increase her inventory. Hearing of a demand from her customers, she plans to begin selling sodas and phone card vouchers in her shop. She also hopes to increase her stock of cosmetics.

Christina belongs to the group Ruaha (the name for a river in Tanzania), which consists of 19 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Leang

texts.en: Mrs. C. Leang (age 30) and her family live in a small village off of National Road 2, about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. Leang and her husband (age 37) have been married for 12 years and have four children, three of whom study in school in their village.  The fourth is still too young to attend.  Her husband (not pictured) has been driving a motorbike taxi in Phnom Penh for about ten years.  Prior to that, he was a “cyclo,” or bicycle taxi, driver.  They are requesting this, their fourth loan from Maxima, to buy a secondhand motorbike.  Motorbike taxis are by far the most common form of transportation in Phnom Penh.  Leang’s husband leaves their house at 4:00 A.M. and returns around 6:00 P.M.  In a typical day he makes about 15,000 Riel (US $3.75).

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Mrs. Blessing U., is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City. Since 1999, she has been selling baby clothes and other merchandise for babies to people living in her community. Blessing is requesting a loan of $450 to increase her stock so she can meet the needs of more customers. She is a LAPO client who works very hard. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy baby merchandise stock for her business

loans.name: Tully

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Tully M. is 28 years old. She is not married but has three children, who are ages 4,7 and 10. In 2003, Tully established a local restaurant business. Tully has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requests a new loan in order to buy more kitchen utensil and food to sell. 

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen utensils and food to sell

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun L., age 28, is married with four little children and lives at SiemReap province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Moa Thea, works as a welder. He welds iron windows and doors and sells these products to brokers for a profit. Her husband handles all his family’s expense, while his wife, Mrs. Chhun L., works at home cooking food and looking after her four little children. Chhun L. has recently requested a loan to buy her husband a blowtorch, a metal cutting machine and other welding tools. Not only will these make his work easier, but they will also make him faster and more effective.

loans.use: To buy her husband a blowtorch and metal cutting machine, and other welding tools

loans.name: Sijali's Kujishughulisha Group

texts.en:
Sijali is married woman with 1 child, aged 5 years old. Sijali sells decorations at her business that she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Elizabeth, who has business dealing in hair dressing.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida, a 20 years old single mother of one child, belongs to the Bonanza Communal Bank. She sells groceries at home, in Pantipampa, two hours away from the city of Ayacucho. She also cultivates potatoes in her land, which she then sells at the markets in the city of Lima. Finally, she breeds animals.

She needs a loan for 3000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, candies, sodas and beer.

Zenaida’s dreams are to buy a house in Ayacucho, improve her business and provide her daughter with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Zenaida, madre soltera de 20 años, con una hija, es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza. Ella vende abarrotes en su casa, ubicada en Pantipampa, a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además, Zenaida siembra papa en sus terrenos, que posteriormente vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Lima. También se dedica a la crianza de animales.

Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, gaseosa y cerveza.

Los sueños de Zenaida son comprar una casa en Ayacucho, mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a su hija.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil, candies, sodas and beer.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria M. L. is a native of the municipality of San Rafael del Sur and owns a small grocery store, which she runs from her humble home to support her three small children, whom she has to maintain being that they are still minors.

Her dreams since she started the grocery store have been to improve her social status and project her business to the community, and for this reason she has been investing through the years in improving her locale. Today, as her inventory diminishes, she looks for support in Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will enable the purchase of merchandise to stock her shelves and sell them in her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Gloria M. L. es originaria del municipio de San Rafael del Sur y se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en su humilde casa de habitación en apoyo de sus tres pequeños hijos los cuales ella tiene la obligación de mantener por ser menores de edad.

Sus sueños desde que inició el negocio de la pulpería han sido mejorar su status social y proyectar su negocio a la comunidad, es por ello que a través de los años ha venido invirtiendo para mejorar su local. Hoy en día al estar agotándose su inventario busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de la mercadería para surtir sus estantes y así comercializarlos en su negocio de pulpería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina is 43 years old. She was unable to get an education, speaks only Aymara (indigenous language) and is married. She has three children that are studying, lives in the Caluyo sector in Santa Rosa Village, Yunguyo District

Paulina is dedicated to sell cows, sheep, and pigs and activity that she started at a young age. She sells them at the Chacacha and Yunguyo fairs. She belongs to the "Tupac Amaru" Communal Bank where she obtained an initial loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency). She used it to be three sheep. With this new loan of S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency), which she will pay back in 4 months, Paulina will buy 4 pigs and 3 sheep that she will sell after they are fatten. Being a member of the communal bank, Paulina learned to be responsible with her payments. Her greatest wish is to be able to support her children and be able to see them as professionals with a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Paulina tiene 43 años D. edad, no logro estudiar, habla solo el idioma aymará, es casada y tiene tres hijos que están estudiando, vive en el sector Caluyo , en Villa Santa Rosa del distrito D. Yunguyo. Paulina se dedica a la venta D. vacas, ovejas y chanchos, que los venD. en las ferias D. Chacachaca y Yunguyo, actividad a la que se dedica desD. muy joven. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru” donD. tuvo un crédito inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra D. tres ovejas. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, compró 4 chanchos y 3 ovejas que serán vendidas después del engorD.. Siendo socia del banco comunal aprendió a ser solidaria y responsable en sus pagos. El gran anhelo que ella tiene, es apoyar a sus hijos a que sean profesionales y que tengan un buen trabajo.

loans.use: Buying cattle (pigs and sheep)

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng C., 28, lives with her husband, Nov Virak, and their four children in Dangkao. She works as a tailor and makes about US$ 5 each day, while her husband transports passengers in his tuk-tuk (a motorbike with an attached passenger cart). She has asked for a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband's business. His bike is frequently in need of repair and the family believes that it can save them money to purchase a new one.

They are seeking out ways to support their large family and are faced with the same difficult economic environment as many other Cambodians. Inflation has been very high and soaring food and gas prices have made it difficult for many Cambodians to improve their situation.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorbike for business

loans.name: Rebecca Namyeso's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is a leader of a five-member group. She is a 51-year-old married woman with twelve children aged between seven and 30 years: nine of her children go to school, and the rest are working. She owns and resides in a three-room house in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala, living with eight people where she constructed a poultry house. There is no electricity or water, and Rebecca also takes care of three orphans.

The family gets three meals a day. She sells chicken (broilers) to all kinds of people both wholesale and retail, selling to an average of 50 people per day. She buys her feed from Mengo-Kisenyi, a suburb of Kampalahome. Rebecca has been in this business for only six months; she first dealt in second-hand clothes but she found the job so tiresome, spending the whole day just walking looking for customers

Rebecca works seven days a week. Rebecca has been with MCDT for over seven years working with the same group who are now seeking their eighteenth loan. Her major challenges include theft, limited markets for chickens, infections like chicken pox and gumboro, and the increasing price of chicken feed. Rebecca is seeking this loan to provide water and electricity for her poultry farm. .

loans.use: To install water and electricity for poultry farm

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet D. is 37 years old, married and has 3 children.  She has a home-based business selling provisions and foodstuffs. 

Violet requires a loan of $350 to buy more products to sell.  She says thank you to all who make this loan possible. 


.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama D., 39 ans, mariée avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Aidara depuis 2 ans. Elle travaille avec son mari. Ils ont ouvert une boutique au marché Central. Elle veut  un prêt pour acheter des thioubs (tissus teintés) et des wax à  revendre pour renforcer leur commerce de vêtements. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Adama D., 39, married and raising two children, has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Aidara for two years. She works with her husband. They have opened a shop at the Central Market. She wants a loan to buy thioubs (hand-dyed cloth) and lengths of wax-style cloth for re-sale to boost their clothing business. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of thioubs and wax-style cloth for their shop

loans.name: Marilin

texts.es: La señora Marilin a sus 34 años de edad, es madre 2 hijos que estudian y son su razón de salir adelante, vive junto a su conviviente quien también la apoya mucho. Es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de productos de belleza como: perfumes, joyas, talcos, lápiz labiales, cremas, y otras variedades por catálogo. Le es rentable, porque gracias a su carisma y jovialidad al vender, se ha ganado una gran gama de clientes. Estos productos los lleva a vender por las zonas más alejadas de Yarinacocha, los deja al crédito o al contado. Trabaja todo el día y se siente bien con su labor, ya que conoce a mucha gente. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado se implementará con más productos de belleza, además de comprar un mostrador para la exhibición y seguridad de sus cosméticos.
texts.en:
Marilin is 34 years old and she is the mother of 2 kids who study, and who are her reason for moving forward. She lives together with her partner who also supports her a lot. She is a very active woman who desires to overcome, and for 2 years she has been selling beauty products like: perfumes, jewelery, talcum powder, lipstick, cremes and other things from the catalog. It is profitable as, thanks to her kind and jolly manner of selling, she has won a large range if clients. She takes these products with her to sell them in the furthest zones of Yarinacocha, and she sells them on credit or I.O.U. She works all day and she is happy with her work as she gets to know many people. This is her first loan with MFP. With the solicited money she will buy many beauty products, as well as buying a counter to show off and for the security of her cosmetics.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a counter and more beauty products/Compra de un mostrador y mayor cantidad de productos de belleza

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty est une femme qui vend des produits artisanaux (collier, ceinture , bracelets etc). Son commerce est en plein centre ville. En cette période de saison touristique, elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter ses bénéfices. Avec cette actiovité elle arrive à subvenir à ses besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Maty is a woman who sells hand-crafted goods (necklaces, belts, bracelets, etc.) Her business is in the centre of town. During this current tourist season, she is asking for this loan to increase her sales. With this business, she is able to meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell hand-crafted items

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina H. is 47 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two wonderful children. Her husband is a farmer and does not earn enough to support the family. So she has been running a grocery store for the past 13 years. The food inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and variety. Sakina is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again. Sakina is seeking to keep her business strong and has requested a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her dreams is that her children progress by means of their studies. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Sakina reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: increase inventory by purchasing more goods

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Alejandrina tiene una bodega en su casa, en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos en su tiempo libre. Además tiene maquinas de tragamonedas.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son progresar mas en su negocio y construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Banco Comunal Obreras community bank. She is 47, married and has 3 children. Alejandrina has a shop in her house, where she sells groceries, fruit and drinks. Her children help out in their spare time. She also has gaming machines.

Alejandrina needs a loan of 800 sol to buy rice and sugar.

Her ambition is to expand her business and build a second floor on her house.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Emilia es soltera, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, Emilia venD. quesos que adquiere en L. comunidad D. Sachabamba que se ubica a 2 horas D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, sus ventas los realiza por mayor en los mercados. Además compra animales que venD. vivo en el camal D. L. ciudad.
Emilia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. quesos.
Emilia sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Emilia is an associate of the Communal Bank Llapanchik, and which means "All" in Quechua. Emilia is single and 48 years old with one son. Emilia sells cheeses that she acquires in the community of Sachabamba, located two hours from the city of Ayacucho. Her sales are carried out wholesale in the markets. Furthermore, she buys animals that she sells to the city slaughterhouse. Emilia needs a loan of 1000 suns that will be invested in the purchase of cheeses. Emilia dreams of buying land to build a house and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to buy cheese.

loans.name: Wosani

texts.en: Wosani H.  is married and has three children. Her husband works as a commercial driver, while Wosani operates her own groceries business. She sells a variety of food items at her own store, which she has owned since 1994. Wosani is requesting a loan in order to stock items such as milk, Milo, and other canned products to provide to her customers. She plans to reinvest her profits in order to expand her business and maximize her outreach to potential clientele.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and provide new food items

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
A. Khurshed is a 28-year-old potato farmer. He works hard to increase the size of his crop and support his wife and two children. Khurshed has managed his farm for the last five years. It allows him to feed his family today, but he also hopes that it will allow him to send his children to college so that they can find better jobs for their families in the future. Khurshed is asking for a loan of $2,500 to buy seeds and fertilizer. He will use the loan to increase his yield and better support his family. Let’s help this hard-working and talented young man achieve his dreams!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have solid business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer to increase the output of his farm

loans.name: Loeb

texts.en: Mrs. Loeb K., 56, has been a local cultivator for more than two years. She plants potatoes and then sells them to a buyer every three months. She is widowed and has three children. One of her children is married and lives away from the family home. The other two are single and are working in different jobs. Her two single children also assists her in the business of growing crops when they are not working elsewhere. The potato crop is the main source of income for the family. The family is lacking in capital to invest in their business so Mrs. K. has decided to seek a $600 loan to pay for plowing the potatoes. (Mrs. K.'s daughters are pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: To pay for plowing potato crop.

loans.name: Pathani Ghulam Shabbier Group

texts.en:
My name is Pathani and I have been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan for the last 14 years. Multan city is famous for its handmade items and for its shrines. My husband's name is G. S. and he is a loader by profession. He loads the items on his donkey cart and delivers to the assigned place. He has five years of experience in this business. I operate an embroidery business. I prepare embroidered dresses on order which I collect from the cloth market and earns income. I save my income in a committee and plan to renovate my house with the committee amount. I am applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart because the old cart became rough and rotted.

I am the group leader of four other women from my locality. Khamiran mai baji and Parveen mai baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Iqbal mai baji wants a loan to buy bed sheets to sell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Myrho

texts.es: Myrho es una joven luchadora y persistente en sus metas, tiene 27 años y vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a sus 2 hijos; Brigith de 7 y Alex de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Sus días son largos y agotadores, camina por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca distribuyendo cajas de licores a las diversas tiendas y bodegas, pero también lleva su mercadería hasta otros distintos del departamento de Puno. Para Myrho, la actividad que realiza es muy beneficiosa, ya que aprovecha muy bien sus ratos libres para atender los deberes de su hogar, lleva 5 años en este negocio y lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar tanto, ya que esto disminuye sus fuerzas y evita que venda su mercadería con muchas más ganas, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo para salir adelante. Para un futuro cercano espera tener un negocio propio en un local estable, tal vez una tienda de abarrotes, todavía no se decide por el rubro. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada, por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados aumentará la mercadería que distribuye, para poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Myrho is a young fighter who perseveres in order to reach her goals. She is 27 years old and lives in a rented room with her two children: Brigith who is seven and Alex who is three. Her children are what motivate her to do all she does. Myrho’s days are long and arduous. She walks the streets of Julilaca distributing boxes of liquor to various stores and warehouses. She also brings her merchandise to districts outside of Puno. This business is beneficial for Myrho and she takes advantage of her free moments to take care of her household chores. She has been doing this for five years and what she likes least is having to walk so much because it makes her weak and too tired to sell with much gusto. But she knows she has to do this to get ahead. In the near future, she would like to have her own business in an established place – possibly a grocery store. She hasn’t decided exactly what it will be yet. This is her third loan with MFP and she expects to be able to make her payments on time so she doesn’t cause any problems for the other members of her communal bank. She is well respected because she is so responsible. She will increase the merchandise she sells with the 1, 500 she has requested in order to improver her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita O. is from the city of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old, single, and has one school-aged child. Merlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her child and as supplemental income for the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Flor Naciente Jovenes Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “Juan Pablo” existe un grupo de jóvenes muy dinámicos y se hacen llamar “Flor naciente Jóvenes” están juntos casi dos años liderizados por su presidenta  Paula T.,  todos tienen sus propios negocios pequeños como la venta de muebles, abarrotes, gorras y arreglo de equipos electrónicos, necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería, es decir, comprar muebles, arroz, fideo, azúcar y gorras y comprar herramientas de trabajo para reparar radios.
texts.en:
In the Main Center “Juan Pablo” exists a group of very dynamic young people who call themselves “Flor Naciente Jóvenes” [“Rising Young Flower”]; they have been together for almost two years and are lead by their president Paula T.. They all have their own small businesses in the sale of furniture, groceries, caps, and fixing electronic equipment. They need a loan to purchase merchandise, that is to say, to purchase furniture, rice, noodles, sugar, caps, and work tools to repair radios.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and work tools.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her children and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Yaa is a trader. She sells second-hand textiles, such as bed sheets. She hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community and also sells in her local market. Yaa also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy second-hand textiles in bulk to make more profit. She aspires to give all her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy second hand textiles

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie D. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 31 years old. Rosemarie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a "sari-sari" or general store selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Belén inicia su noveno ciclo con 11 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. ropa, verduras, carnes, panes, bebidas, cereales, ferretería y crianza D. animales.
	
Como es el Caso D. Carmen que es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 6 hijos, Carmen venD. tripas D. animales, producto que adquiere en el camal D. la ciudad y lo comercializa D. manera ambulatoria.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles, haciendo un total D. 5,400 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. verduras variadas, panes, bebidas y cereales

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Para la compra de verduras variadas, panes, bebidas y cereales

loans.name: El Abed R

texts.fr: El Abed R D. est une femme de 47ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de vaisselle et de tissu. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
El Abed R. D. is a 47 year-old woman, she is married and she is the mother of 3 children. She sells kitchen utensils as well as linen. This loan will improve her business and in consequence the living conditions of her family will also be improved.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Ma. Elena M. is from Brgy. Taloc, Bago City. She is 35 years old and married with two school age children. Her husband, Porperio, is employed as a family driver while Mrs. M. was staying at home to raise the children. However, the salary of her husband could not sustain the needs of the whole family, so she decided to join the project and obtain her first loan of PHP 3,000. She used the loan to buy assorted goods, such as thread, candles, sponges, and other household necessities to display in the local marketplace during the town's market day. Subsequently, she became aware of the income potential if she traveled from town to town at each town's market day. The business now earns her an average monthly profit of PHP 25,000.

Her last loan of PHP 10,000 was fully paid after paying each weekly installment on time. Now she is borrowing PHP 10,000 on her 14th cycle loan to continue having sufficient capital for inventory to sustain her traveling store.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for inventory

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta enjoys farming. She is happy to share that her rice crops are growing well. According to her, her farm needs good care to produce a quality harvest. At 52, she has two children with her husband, Bonifacio. Her eldest child is 18 years old. 

Violeta is a member of CEVI, a Kiva partner. She is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to acquire the farm supplies that she needs for her farm.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Can Wange Pe Dima Caroline Group

texts.en: D. Caroline is representing her group. She is a business lady, 22 years old and married with three children. Two of her children go to school. She sells used clothes, which she has been doing for over three years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock of used clothes, especially for the Christmas season because the profits are going to be so high. She hopes to increase her capital. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes

loans.name: Ramón

texts.en:
