Ramón N. is 43 years old and lives in the village of J. Augusto Saldivar, a few miles from Asuncion.

Ramón has two trucks, one of which he uses for the transportation of fruit and vegetables to sell at farmer’s markets, supermarkets, meat markets, and shops in the neighborhoods of Asunción and surrounding areas. He has been delivering fruit and vegetables for more than 15 years. With the other truck, Ramón moves freight and make other large deliveries. He has been in that business for over 4 years.

Ramón started his business with a horse-drawn cart in a busy neighborhood. After working hard for many years, he saved the money necessary to replace his horse and cart with a truck. Ramón also has 33 hectares of land, which he received as an inheritance from his parents. There, Ramón plants vegetables, which he also then harvests and sells from his truck. 

Ramón needs a loan so that he can repair his truck, an indispensable part of his business.

loans.use: To repair his delivery truck.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús G. de 63 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Paz. Ella tiene  un solo hijo el cual cuenta con su propia familia. La señora Teresa posee una venta de ropa para niños y adultos, su negocio esta ubicado frente a la Alcaldía Municipal de La Paz, lo cual es una ventaja ya que es un lugar muy transitado. Teresa solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más ropa, ya que a pesar que ella es una persona considerada de la tercera edad, es una mujer muy llena de energía la cual trabaja arduamente para llevar el alimento a su mesa.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús G. of 63 years of age, resides in the town of La Paz. She has one son who has his own family. Mrs. Teresa sells clothing for children and adults, and her business is located opposite of the La Paz City Hall, which is an advantage since it is a very busy place. Teresa is requesting a loan through so that she can buy more clothes. Although she is an elderly person, she is a very energetic woman who works hard to bring food to her table.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new clothes for sale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes C. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Lourdes is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lourdes has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn T. is from the village of Clarin, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Marilyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: We Are Not Alone Group

texts.en: Mark's business is selling an array of general goods such as cigarettes, soap, mosquito coils, hard cane juice and palm wine. He sells from a table in Jacobs Town, which is near the Red Light market area. Red Light is Liberia's largest market, about 5 miles from the capital, Monrovia. It is a bustling area full of shops, stalls, and vendor tables. He says his success in business will "depend on the capital I have." Mark plans to use the 6,000 Liberian dollars he will get as a part of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to expand the inventory he offers at his shop. Mark is a high school graduate and is currently attending the University of Liberia as a second-year economics major. If he can afford to continue to pay tuition and other expenses, he hopes to graduate from university in two years' time. Mark says when he finished school he wants to get a job with the Liberian government, the United Nations or a private firm. Mark is 35 years old and single. He has two daughters with his ex-girlfriend and he helps to support them. His three-year-old daughter lives with his ex-girlfriend in Monrovia and his seven-year-old daughter lives and works on his parent's farm in rural Lofa County. We Are Not Alone is a group of five borrowers led by Mark L. that live and work near Red Light, Paynesville. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mark is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a general store, such as cigarettes, soap, mosquito coils, hard cane juice and palm wine

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet M. is a 32-year-old businesswoman who is married with six children living and who operates a business selling maize in Bukirima, Busia District.

Before venturing into her maize business, Linet used to engage herself in subsistence farming but that was not generating any income for her.

Linet buys her stock twice a week from a nearby Miyanga market. She would like to expand her business to be able to achieve her future plan of better education for her children. It is for this reason she would like a loan of Ksh 20,000.

loans.use: To increase her stock of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a moto-taxi

loans.name: Benedict Mwania

texts.en:
Benedict is married to Gladys and they have two children, Julietta and Tabitha. He describes himself as humble and hardworking. Benedict has been in the milk distribution business for six years. He distributes milk in the place where he lives and in other estates, and his customers are retailers.
Benedict joined Kiva partner, KADET, through existing clients. He intends to use the loan for which he has applied as working capital to increase sales. He will invest in his milk business in order to buy more milk to supply to other retailers. Benedict hopes to buy a car or motorbike to help in distributing supplies instead of using a bicycle.

loans.use: As working capital to increase sales

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty K. is 32 years old and married to Stephen Kiprop. They live in Kabarnet town and have four children, Cynthia, Elsi Chebet, Elly and Cathy, who are aged between 10 years and 4 years old.

Betty operates a salon in Kabarnet town and the resident of this town are her clients. She started the salon eight years ago and she gets a monthly profit of Kshs 35,000 from this business. Betty also owns a household utensils shop from which she gets a profit of Kshs 28,000 per month.

This is the only MFI from which she has borrowed funds after a friend introduced her to Kadet Ltd. Betty has borrowed a loan of Kshs 80,000 which she will use to purchase stock for the salon business, with things like shampoo, hair weaves, hair oils and others. If this loan boosts her business, she will plough back the profit into it so that it will expand.

Betty dreams of having a big business and a stable source of income. She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the business

loans.name: Kanaf

texts.en:
Kanaf I. sells cereals such as beans, millet, soya beans and groundnuts (peanuts) at Jukwa market. She is without any educational background but is able to care for herself.

Kanaf is a widow and has been selling cereals and the like for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy other types of cereals which she doesn’t currently sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to complete a building her husband left behind for her.

loans.use: To buy other types of cereals which she doesn't currently sell

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is married to a builder and they have four children. All the children are going to school. Maureen takes care of additional family members. She rents and lives in a two-room house where she stays with the family. Maureen deals in African attire and batiks, a business she is proud of. She sells all types of bitenge (African attire) and sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. Besides this clothing business, she also sells local ghee.  She has been doing these businesses for many years. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation of clothes from shops. She sells by moving door to door. Maureen wants to use this loan to buy more African attire and ghee.  She aspires to see her business grow bigger, to start going to the Democratic Republic of Congo and to own a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more African attire and local ghee

loans.name: Raji's Group

texts.en:
Raji baji is a wife of L. A. and lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small two roomed house and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years. 
She is a very caring lady. She has given birth to four children: two boys and two girls. None of the children are school-going age yet. But she wishes to send all of them to school so that they get an education and make their future bright. She stays at home, does household chores and cooks food for them. 
Her husband operates his own grocery shop in the community and generates an income for the family. He spends 10 hours in the shop. He opens his shop in the morning at 9 o’clock and closes at 7 o’clock in the evening. 
Raji is applying for a loan from Asasah for her husband so he may purchas the groceries in bulk for his grocery shop and increase the income.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdado is from the village of Brgy.Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.  He is 58 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Diosdado provides transportation services, by using a motorcycle. He has been in business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Diosdado joined ASKI to access financial services to improve his living situation and to engage in business activities.  He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI to purchase tires and other accessories.  Diosdado is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to repair his motorcycle. This loan will be his seventh from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of his family. 

-----------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Repair motorcycle.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, tiene 35 años, está felizmente casada con Edwin de 47 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos y viven en una casa alquilada, muy cómoda y bien situada para la actividad que desempeña y que no le permitirían realizar en el centro de la ciudad. Buscando el bienestar de sus hijos,  Rita junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos, en un taller que queda al frente de su domicilio. De manera independiente, tiene un taller de elaboración de productos pirotécnicos que tienen mucha demanda en las fiestas patronales que se realizan en su ciudad. Por otro lado su pareja practica el oficio de músico, que también le resulta rentable y hasta le permite ahorrar ya que su fin es poder comprarse su casa propia y acondicionar un lugar para instalar un restaurante. Lleva 15 años dedicada a estas labores y asegura que gracias a esta actividad a sus hijos nunca les faltó que comer. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes son personas muy solidarias, acogedoras y responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales para elaborar más juegos pirotécnicos.
texts.en:
Rita is 35 years old and happily married to Edwin, 47 years old. Together they have five children and live in a very comfortable rented home and well situated for the work that she does and that she would not be allowed to do in the center of the city. For the wellbeing of their children, Rita and her husband make bricks in a workshop that is in front of their residence. Independantly, she has a workshop for making fireworks, which are in high demand for the patron saint festivals that occur in her city. On the other hand, her spouse is a musician. This is also profitable and even allows her to save, since her goal is to buy her own house and to set up a restaurant. She has done all of this work for 15 years and it is thanks to these activities that her children never went hungry. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is happy to continue working with the members of her communal group, who are very supportive, warm, and responsible. With the loan that she requests, she will buy materials to make more fireworks.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make fireworks

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Faith” group from Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are women with small businesses who have come to SMT/Kiva in order to seek a loan of SLL 3,000,000 for the entire group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve on their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Isatu J.. She was born in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown. She is thirty-seven years of age and is a divorcee with three children.

For more than ten years now, Isatu has managed a “cigarettes box” where she sells cigarettes, matches, batteries, pens, pencils, etc., as well as provisions – milk, sugar, cocoa, mayonnaise, butter, bread, etc.

With the help of this loan, Isatu will buy more batteries, books, pens, pencils, cocoa, sugar, etc., to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy batteries, books, pens, pencils, cocoa, sugar, etc., to add to her stock

loans.name: Muroki

texts.en:
Muroki K. is 48 and married and with four children.  He is a member of the Faulu Kenya under Overcomers New Beginning group.  He joined this group as an entrepreneur who does dairy farming.  He has been engaged in this business for ten years.  He also grows coffee on a small scale.  He learned coffee farming because he was previously employed in a coffee plantation.  

He has been guaranteed a loan of 50,000 KES by his group members.  This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow so as to increase production.  He hopes to venture into the real estate business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe BENKADI 6  sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 39ans  en moyenne 4  enfants et qui vivent dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage et  sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents.
Les  spéculations cultivées par le groupe  sont : le pois sucré et le riz. 
DJENEBA D. compte utiliser son prêt,pour  acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et payer les frais de main d’oeuvre pour entretenir : 1hectare . 
La production est vendue au marché de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes après la récolte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000FCFA en fin de campagne, qui sera utilisé pour payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Benkadi 6 group are married women who average 39 years of age and have an average of four children each; they live in polygamous families in Comorow, one of the villages in the municipality of Loulouni, which lies in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to manage successfully their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their fourth loan from the institution, having repaid the three previous loans correctly. The crops cultivated by the group are sugar peas and rice. Djeneba D. is planning to use her loan to buy agricultural intrants and small equipment, as well as recruiting workers to maintain her hectare of land. The harvested crop is sold to a customer base made up of men and women. She is planning to make an average profit of 60,000 FCFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to reimburse her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to cultivate a larger area of land and make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of labor, grains, weedkillers, hoeing and small farming materials

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu F. is from the village of Rizal. She is 22 years old, married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Marichu owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Marichu joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marichu from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. AAbout ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fanuafou

texts.en:
Fanuafou V. is 28, married, and has two children aged six and eight. She owns a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. Fanuafou has two years' experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
Fanuafou joined Kiva partner, SPBD, in 2009, and this is her second loan. SPBD's loans are Fanuafou's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean L. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Jean is widowed and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Jean owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jean has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Richard  Pole

texts.en:
Richard has been farming for commercial purposes in Naivasha town since the year 2003.  He is 42 years old, married to Somia N. and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan well and on time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

Richard would also like to own his own farming equipment in future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, es un hombre seguro de si mismo, tiene 48 años y vive con Nidia, de 37 años, ambos tienen a Henry, su único hijo, de 18 años; pero ellos viven solos en la comunidad rural de Santa Clara (sierra del Perú). Hace algunos años, que su hijo ingreso a la universidad de Ica (costa del Perú), y, según Carlos, en ese momento cambiaron sus deseos y aspiraciones. Cuando tenia 17 años se dedicó a la agricultura, en ese entonces trabajaba con ahínco para que su producción de papa, arveja y habas; sean rentables y generen muchas ganancias, con el tiempo, consolidó una familia y desde ahí pudo adquirir mayores ganancias y con el dinero ahorrado pudo comprar más terrenos agrícolas. Ahora Carlos vende papa en grandes cantidades, “con mi producción pude educar a mi hijo”, afirma. Sin embargo, él, planea comprar una pequeña casa en la ciudad de Ica, ya que quiere estar en compañía de su hijo, ahí piensa abrir una pequeña bodega de comestibles. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y agradece el apoyo obtenido en todo este tiempo, donde asegura, pudo conseguir muchos éxitos y alegrías. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono, con ello quiere asegurar su sembrío de papa el cual cosechará en estos meses.
texts.en: Carlos is a self-confident person. He is 48 years old and he lives with Nidia, 37 years old, and  they have one son together, Henry who is 18 years old. But they live on their own in the rural community of Santa Clara (in the Peruvian mountain range). Some years ago their son started University at Ica (in the coastal regions of Peru) and according to Carlos, it was then when their dreams and aspirations changed.  When he was 17 years old he started work in agriculture and in those days he worked with great zeal on his plantations of potatoes, peas, and fava beans. His plantations were successful and generated great earnings. In time he started a family and since then he has seen an improvement in his earnings. With the funds he saved he managed to purchase more farmland. Today Carlos is able to sell potatoes in very large quantities. He states "with these harvests I was able to send my son to school".  He plans on buying a small house in the city of Ica to be closer to their son. There they plan on opening a small grocery store.  This is his fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is grateful for the support he has received through all this time. With these loans he was able to find many successes and much happiness. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer to secure a good harvest in the coming months.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to secure his harvest.

loans.name: Turganbubu

texts.en:
Turganbubu K. is 49, married, and has three grown children. In 1990, in order to support her family, she began her business in cattle breeding.   Currently, she has a barn and three cows, twenty sheep and one goat at her farm. In summer, she pastures her livestock in mountainous areas with natural grasses, which leads to reduced expenses.  With the revenue from this activity,  Turganbubu managed to give a good education to her children.  Now, Turganbubu plans to use this loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase three bull calves.  Using the revenue, she plans to give a dowry to her daughter. 

In future, Turganbubu plans to build a house for her family.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Afi Mawussé

texts.fr: Mawussé est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a 40 ans. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait le commerce de bijoux. Elle est née à kpalimé mais habite à adidogomé à Lomé et cumule dans ses activités près de 4 ans.  Elle s’approvisionne à Cotonou au Benin  et revend à adidogomé. Pour satisfaire plus de clients, elle sollicite au près de WAGES un prêt.
texts.en: Mawussé is married and the mother of three children. She is 40 years old. In order to contribute to her household expenses, she has a jewelry business - altogether, she has been in this business for almost four years. She was born in Kpalimé, but she now lives in Adidogomé in Lomé. She purchases her supplies in Cotonou in Benin and resells the goods in Adidogomé. In order to satisfy more clients, she is requesting a loan from the microfinance organization WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for re-sale

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 40-year-old married man and father of three kids, who has been working as a car painter for 20 years. Amer is an expert in his field; he is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary products for his business. 

Amer seeks perfection in his work and perfection in his family members whether in raising his kids or in teaching them. He hopes to provide them with good talent and a secure living. Amer’s clients believe that he’s a man of honor, who respects his word. Amer dreams of opening a big garage in the future

loans.use: To buy necessary products for his business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy B. is from the village of Bocboc, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old and widowed with five adult children. To make a living, Nancy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and beverages in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Nancy joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI that she used to purchase inventory and use as working capital. Nancy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like junk foods and biscuits. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Nancy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
 
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products like junk foods and biscuits

loans.name: Dzigbodi Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mme Akossiwa  a 4 enfants et est mariée à un agent de douane. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait  la vente de charbons de bois. Elle a commencé en  1990 cette activité et s’approvisionne à Anié. Elle revend ensuite les charbons à la devanture de sa maison. Elle est dans son troisième cycle de prêt. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 25 nouveaux sacs de charbons.
texts.en: Mrs Akossiwa has four children and is married to a customs officer. To contribute towards household expenses, she sells charcoal. She began this activity in 1990 and gets her supplies in Anié. Then she resells the charcoal in front of her home. This is her third loan cycle. She applies for this loan to buy 25 new sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is currently in a business of selling mixed goods.  She is 30 years old and married to a seller of mixed goods.  She has 4 children, 3 of whom go to school.  She requested for a loan to stock more mixed goods.   Gladys hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more mixed goods.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ar:
فاطمة في عمر 38 سنة متزوجة ولها 2 ولدان وعلى عاتقها زوجها ايضا حيث انه لا يعمل بل يساعدها في عملها لها في عملها في بيع 
الخبز والمناقيش حوالي 20 سنة تحب عائلتها وهي المعيل الوحيد لهم تريدهم دائما من العاملين والمنتجين في المجتمع حيث انها
استطاعت ان تؤسس عملها بنفسها تتميز بالجد والنشاط في العمل ولها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة كانت تتلقى دائما الدعم
تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى زيادة فرصة عمل جديدة لها من خلال شراء كارت تعبئة للهواتف النقالة وايضا اكسسوارات
للهواتف النقالة
texts.en: Fatima is 38 years old, married with 2 children and she also shoulders the responsibility for her husband who does not work but rather helps her in her bakery. She has 20 years experience. She loves her family very much and is the sole breadwinner. She constantly wants them to be contributors in the community, and she has established her business independently. She is determined and motivated. She has good credit history with Al-Majmoua and has their support. With this loan she wants to create new business opportunities by purchasing mobile phone top-up cards and phone accessories.

loans.use: To start a new business selling mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is a 45-year-old man. He is married to Lea and has been blessed with 4 children: Marlin, 23 years old and married; Randy, 20 years old and disabled due to an accident and unable to complete his high school education; Dewi, graduated from senior high school but currently unemployed; Juan, 10 years old and in 4th grade. Danny and his family live in their simple house located in Kolhua Village. 

To generate daily income, Danny runs a small kiosk. Using the small amount of money that he has, Danny purchases various daily basic needs such as soap, toothpaste, snacks, cigarettes, etc. Danny relies on the profit from his kiosk to meet his family's needs. 

Danny's kiosk is located about 20 meters from the main road and is quite difficult for his customers to reach. This poor location has greatly affected his income. Danny serves just a few customers and can only generate a small income, which he spends to replace his business stock, buy food and pay for electricity and other expenses. Danny feels that his income is very small. As head of the family, he keeps thinking about how to improve his business and generate more income. He believes the solution lies in enlarging his kiosk and finding a strategic location but Danny doesn't have enough capital to do so. 

Danny has tried to find a loan to help him improve his business. Fortunately, he met TLM’s Field Officer who introduced him to TLM’s lending program. Danny is interested in joining the individual program and is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000. Danny is hoping to get the loan so he can implement his plan.

loans.use: to move his business and to add more inventory

loans.name: Segakuca

texts.fr: Segakuca M. est éleveur des bovins et poules, il est né au Congo. Il a 50 ans et est marié, il 9 enfants entre 30 et 4 ans, 7 de ses enfants vont  à l’école. Il a un diplôme d’A0 en Agronomie. Il est client d’ACB depuis 2010. Il a besoin d’un prêt pour acheter une vache et des poules pour augmenter son élevage, ses ambitions sont de travailler à la hâte pour augmenter sa capacité financière, et la production des ses bêtes, sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaires et d’augmenter le terrain à cultiver car il fait aussi l’agriculture des légumineuses et graminées, enfin il veut rehabiliter sa maison.
texts.en: Segakuca M. raises  cattle and poultry. He is born in Congo. He is 50 years old and married. He has nine children between 30 and four years of age. Seven of his children are in school. He has an “A0” level diploma [roughly corresponding to junior college] in agronomy. He is a client of ACB since 1010. He needs a loan in order to purchase one cow and some chickens in order to increase his business. His goal is to work hard to increase his financial capacity and raise more livestock. His strategy is to increase also his field as he is also a farmer and grows vegetables and grasses. Finally, he wants to renovate his home.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow and chickens

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad, es empleado desde hace 7 años, trabajando como vendedor en un comercial del centro de El Transito.
El actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta, ya que este medio le dará mayor rapidez para llegar del trabajo a la casa y viceversa, esperando con esto satisfacer las necesidades básicas y alcanzar sus objetivos y metas por el buen desempeño en su trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old and lives in El Transito, in Usulután department, with his wife and two children aged 3 and 5.  José has been working for a company for 7 years.  He is a salesman in a store in the center of El Transito.

José is currently requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle as this will enable him to get home from work, and vice versa, more quickly.  He hopes this will help him to cover his basic needs and reach his goal to do well at work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Josué Gamabiel

texts.es:
Josué tiene 27 años de edad, reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, está soltero, vive con su padre, se dedica a la carpintería desde hace un año y medio, aprendió el oficio en otro taller donde inicio como trabajador, el horario que posee es de 7:00 a 5:00pm, su manera de trabajar es por pedidos.
Actualmente necesita invertir en madera de diferentes clases, para poder fabricar los muebles encargados, este crédito le ayudara a tener en su inventario el material necesario y atender la demanda.
Su Objetivo es superarse poco a poco, tener un taller más amplio y mejorar su trabajo, para satisfacer a los clientes.
texts.en:
Josué is 27 years old, single, and lives in Osicala, located in the Department of Morazán, with his father. He has worked as a carpenter for a year and a half and he learned the trade in another shop where he started as a worker. He works from 7am to 5pm and works by request.

He currently needs to invest in different types of wood in order to be able to make the furniture requested. This loan will help him to have the necessary material in his inventory and meet the demand.

His goal is to get ahead in life little by little, to have a larger workshop, and to improve his work in order to satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to buy different types of wood.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 57 years old and married with 11 children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sardines, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Melinda has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 30 years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

Melinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jerlito

texts.en:
Jerlito is a single farmer from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Jerlito spends hours tilling his land and preparing it for planting rice crops. When not busy farming, Jerlito drives his tricycle to transport people around his community. He works hard to save money and help his family.

Jerlito is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and repair his tricycle. In the future, Jerlito hopes that his business ventures prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and repair his tricycle

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ESTRELLA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la señora María.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, venta de batidos, venta de golosinas, ayudante de confección de colchones, venta de salchipapas, tejido de mantas, tienda, inicio de negocio.

La señora María nos indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer, en el centro de Senkata, pero por traslado de casa ahora es parte del centro de Collpani. Ella cuenta con un negocio de tejido de mantas desde hace un año, el que aprendió de sus amigas.

El préstamo que solicita en esta ocasión es para comprar lana y equipo (que utilizará en la elaboración de sus productos) estos materiales llos comprara de la feria 16 de julio y los venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro
texts.en:
The communal bank "NUEVA ESTRELLA" is beginning its first term in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Social Center.  It is comprised of eight members and its board of directors is chaired by Mrs. Maria.  The business activities of the members vary and include: blanket weaving, milkshake sales, sweets sales, mattress making assistant, salchipapas sales, general store operation, and business establishment.

Mrs. Maria says she has been working with Pro Mujer for a year in the Senkata center, but since she recently moved is now in the Collpani center.  For a year she has been earning an income as a blanket weaver, a skill she learned from her friends.

The loan she is requesting is to buy wool and equipment (to make her products).  She will buy the goods at the July 16th fair and then sell her products on an order basis.  Her work allows her to generate an income to help out with family expenses.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she liked most about Pro Mujer, she replied that it was the savings involved.

loans.use: To buy machines and wool.

loans.name: Byambatsogt

texts.en:
Mr.Byambatsogt is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family live in their own house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar. His two eldest children go to University and the youngest one attends a kindergarten. His wife is unemployed at the moment and has been actively looking for a job for the last few months. 

Byambatsogt has been running a taxi business, using his family car, since 2005. He also raises pigs. He has 8 pigs at the moment and he is planning to expand his farming business. Recently he found a quite suitable place for selling motor engine oils and he negotiated to rent a kiosk there. His wife is going run the engine oil and cooling liquids retail kiosk. The loan Byambatsogt is taking will be used to stock up engine oil and cooling liquid to sell to customers and, at the same time, will give his wife a chance to earn money.

loans.use: to stock up enough engine oil and cooling liquid and to sell these items to customers. This will also give his wife a chance to earn money.

loans.name: Phelesiah

texts.en:
Phelesiah is a 33-year-old businesswoman, mother and wife to Charles who is also a businessman. They have three children, aged between seven and ten years old, and reside in the Kwisero area of the larger Kakamega County.

She sells grains, mostly maize, because of its high demand in this part of Kenya. She has been doing this business for the last 12 years and is able to make a monthly income of KES. 9,500. She has been awarded a second loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD which she will use to buy five bags of maize for resale.

She intends to use the profit to invest back into her business and also pay back her loan without default. Her dream is to open a grain shop as opposed to her current business location, which is an open air stall.

loans.use: to buy five bags of grain.

loans.name: Barbra's Group

texts.en:
Barbra is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is currently in school. Barbra has a small retail shop business, which she has run for three years. She also has a second business running a clinic.
To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Barbra hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house.
Barbra is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as maize flour, for resale.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao, age 55, is a rice farmer. Her husband, Khan, age 56, is a construction worker. He assists his wife in the farming business when he is free. They have been married since 1978 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. One child is a construction worker, and the other two children are garment workers. They live in a village on National Road Number 2, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Pao is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

Photo: Pao and her husband

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea tiene 50 años de edad, ella es casada con el señor Juan y con quien procreo seis  hijos cinco ya están fuera de su responsabilidad y uno aún está con ellos Esteban de dieciseis años de edad.

    Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mantas para después bordarlas, con esta actividad lleva treinta y tres años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido sus propios ingresos para sostener  en bien a su familia.

      Lo que motivo a esta actividad fue su propio gusto ya que en la localidad donde ella vive las personas se dedican a bordar mantas lo que es la tradición ahí, ella desde muy pequeña se dedica a ello y esta muy contenta porque con ello a sacado a delante a  pequeña familia.

    Lo que más desea es  seguir trabajando con su actividad hasta que dios le preste vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea, 50, and her husband, Juan, have six children, four of whom are grown and independent.  Their youngest child, Esteban is sixteen years old.  

Andrea will use her loan to buy supplies for her embroidery business.  She has operated the business for thirty-three years and says that she is pleased with it because it provides her with an independent income that she has used for the good of her family.

Andrea was well suited to an embroidery busienss because there's a long tradition of embroidering textiles in this part of Mexico.  She's embroidered textiles since she was a young girl and she's pleased she can make a living from it because she can help support her little family.  

What she most wants is to be able to continue her work for the rest of her life.

loans.use: to buy thread and other supplies for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Les Colombes 1, 2 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Jacquelyne est la coordonatrice de son groupe Colombes. Elle n’est pas mariée elle a  d’enfant. Jacquelyne habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti 

Jacquelyne a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années.  Avant de commencer ce commerce, elle  etait a l’ecole

ELLE voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du tennis. JACQUELYNE espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Les autres membres Colombes ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et des vetements uses.

Jacquelyne dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Elle dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmantation du bussiness.
texts.en:
Jacquelyne is the organizer of her group, Colombes. She is not married and does not have children. Jacquelyne lives in the town of Ouanaminthe in Haiti.

Jacquelyne has been managing her business for the past six years. Before launching this business, she was at school.

She would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of tennis shoes. Jacquelyne hopes that this loan will help her grow her business.

The other members of group Colombes need loans for such ventures as selling coal, rice, and second-hand clothes.

Jacquelyne says that her main challenge is the lack of regular customers. She says that her main objective is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Mr. Gantulga is 35 years old and he lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He works as a driver in a company and doesn't earn enough to live on. In this year, his daughter will enter the kindergarten and his son goes to secondary school. 

Gantulga wants to start a new business of clothing sales at a shopping center called Sky Plaza, because he thinks that it will be more beneficial to his life and it must increase his monthly earnings. 

Therefore, at first, he needs to purchase and bring the commodities from China markets to sell to expand his current business assets. The loan he is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing the clothing goods to start his new clothes business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing goods to start his new clothes business.

loans.name: Maruja Carrillo

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso D. Juli”, ubicado en el distrito D. Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, tiene 38 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.  Cuenta con educación secundaria.
DesD. hace siete años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue por  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. artículos artesanales, compró bayetas y lanas.  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta D. vacunos y ovinos.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1200.00 nuevo soles, comprará un cordero, lanas, bayetas para la fabricación D. sus tejidos y bordados para combinar su mercadería y venderlos en chulluni-Puno.
Su sueño es tener un carro para su uso personal y traslado D. su mercadería.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, las charlas, las orientaciones y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Maruja’s a member of the “Mujeres al Progreso D. Juli” (Juli Women to Progress) communal bank located in Juli District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department.  She’s 38 years old, married and has five children.  She finished secondary school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last seven years.  Her initial loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her crafts business; she bought flannel and wool.  She also works selling cattle and sheep.

She will use this new, 1200 new sol, loan to buy a lamb, wool and flannel to do her weaving and embroidery and combine her merchandise and sell it in Chulluni-Puno.  Her dream is to own a car for her personal use and to transport her merchandise.  What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings, the talks, the training and the savings.

loans.use: to buy a lamb, wool and flannel.

loans.name: 3.9.83 Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thơm operates a food stall selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Thơm is 26 years old and she is married with no children.
Thơm is the group leader of the 3.9.83 Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Thơm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Thơm has been involved in this business for two years.
The main hardship that Thơm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thơm hopes to buy land of her own. She hopes that her business will do well and her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Saidy Yamileth

texts.es:
la sra. Saidy Yamileth tiene 37 años de edad, esta soltera y tiene 2 hijos, Saidy se dedica ala venta de frutas como ser: mangos, sandias, ciruelas, lichas, bananos. su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar en donde transitan muchas personas, mismas que le compran todos los dias, las frutas es un alimento que se vende muy bien por saludable y sabroso.
La señora Saidy Yamileth dice sentirse muy bien, sus ventas se estan incrementando y su negocio esta creciendo, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de frutas y asi tener mas surtido para sus clientes.
El sueño de Saydi es darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Saidy Yamileth is 37 years old. She is single and has 2 children. Sandy sells fruit such as: mangos, watermelons, plums, rambutans, and bananas. Her business is located in an area where there are a lot of people. They buy from her every day. Fruit is a food that sells very well because it is healthy and tasty.  

Saidy Yamileth says that she feels very good. Her sales are increasing and her business is growing. She will use the loan to buy fruit and have stock for her customers.   

Saidy's dream is to give her children a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, rambutans, bananas, nances, mangos and plums.

loans.name: Rhina Doris

texts.es:
Rhina,  vive con su esposo y  dos  hijos, ella se dedica a vender ropa: cubrecamas, sabanas, short, faldas, pantalones, blusas, para damas caballeros y niños, el negocio lo tiene en su casa, dos días por semana sale a vender a los hogares de sus clientes, hace varios años se dedica a este oficio.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio, y comprar más ropa: pantalones, camisas, blusas y de esa forma incrementara sus ganancias porque tendrá más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
El sueño de Rhina es tener una mejor calidad de vida y que sus hijos sigan estudiando, y que en el futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rhina lives with her husband and two children. She sells clothing: comforters, bed sheets, shorts, skirts, pants, and blouses for ladies, gentlemen and children. She has her business in her house and two days out of the weeks she sets out to sell in her customer's houses. She has had her business for several years.

She requires the loan to purchase more merchandise to add inventory to her business through the purchase of more clothing: pants, shirts, and blouses. This will increase her profits because she will have a wider variety of items to offer her clients.

Rhina's dream is to have a better quality of life and to keep her children in school so that they will have a career in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as pants, shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucy Jacqueline tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos a los cuales ha criado sola a base de mucho trabajo.
Ella forma parte del grupo “Fortaleza” formado por 7 integrantes los cuales residen en el distrito de Carabayllo.
La Sra. Lucy Jacqueline se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado, inició hace dos años vendiendo solo ceviche y poco a poco fue aumentando los platos de comida para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad.
Con su trabajo ha logrado darles estudios a sus hijos, brindarles las necesidades básicas en su hogar.
Con el préstamo recibido alquilará un local en una zona comercial para instalar un restaurante con la mira de más adelante lograr tener un local propio para desarrollar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucy Jacqueline is 42 years old, single, and has four children who she has raised through lots of work.
She is part of the Fortaleza group, which consists of seven members who live in the district of Carabayllo.
Lucy Jacqueline sells food at the market. She started two years ago just selling ceviche, and has slowly added other dishes to offer her customers a greater variety.
Through her work, she has managed to educate her children and offer them basic necessities at home.
Lucy Jacqueline will use the loan to rent space in a commercial area to open a restaurant, while looking ahead to managing to have her own space where she can develop her business.

loans.use: To rent space for a restaurant.

loans.name: Fabienne

texts.en: Fabienne is 35 years old; she has 4 children aged between 3 and 11. She is married to a businessman who helps her in her business. She owns a restaurant and has requested the loan to buy more ingredients, to make food for her customers. With the profits, she plans to save and pay school fees for her children. She would like to be a distributor for the customers who work far from her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to cook food at her restaurant.

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina is a 38-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 14 and 21, all of them in school. She has operated a business selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan for four years.

Natalina has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will helps her build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 35 years old and lives in Purok2 Carangan, Ozamiz City. She is married and has 1 child. Gilda has a carenderia and boarding house business and earns approximately PHP 30,000.00 each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan of PHP 50000 to purchase materials for her boarding house renovation. 

Gilda has been a member of PMPC for 2 months. In the future, Gilda hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her boarding house renovation.

loans.name: Laura Piedad

texts.es:
Laura Piedad es casada tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 6, 3 años de edad y 15 días de nacido en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Laura se dedica a la agricultura crianza de animales, siembra de maíz, habas, trigo, cebada tiene casa propia los terrenos en los que siembra son de familiares.
Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y pagar a las `personas que le ayudan.
Con la ayuda  podrá mejorar la producción.
El sueño es poder hacer una casa para que viva. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval y San Pedro.
Con la ayuda del crédito anteriuor pudo mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia, los ingresos han mejorado
texts.en:
Laura Piedad is married and has 3 children.  She lives with her husband and children ages 6, 3 and a 15 day-old newborn in the Guaranda Province of Bolívar.  

She is a member of the group VRC VENTANAL which can be found in the community of Guantuncoto, in Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda Parish, at a distance of 30 minutes from the loan office.  The group members work in various activities, including agriculture, cattle, raising small animals like pigs, chicken and sheep, and working in sales and construction.

Laura works in agriculture raising animals, planting corn, beans, wheat, and barley.  She owns her own home and the land that she plants is owned by family.  She buys and sells in Guaranda.  She is asking for a loan in order to plant corn, to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the people that help her.  With their help she can improve her production.

Her dream is to be able to build her own home.  The challenges that she faces include plagues and illnesses in the crops and livestock.  In her free time she enjoys the festivities of carnival and San Pedro.

With the help of her previous loan she was able to improve the quality of life of her family, and her income has improved.

loans.use: to plant corn, to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the people that help her.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 39-year-old man from Western Kenya and is married to Grace. They have six children who depend on them.

Wycliffe makes bricks for construction purposes. He has been doing this business for the last 11 years and makes a monthly profit of KES 20,000. He is taking his fourth loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the loan to buy more soil for bricks and to buy water for preparing the soil.

He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees and home upkeep and will plow back the remaining income into the business.

loans.use: to buy more soil for brick making and to buy water for soil preparation.

loans.name: Mireille Noudéhouénou

texts.fr: Mireille, responsable du groupe de deux personnes,vit maritalement avec deux enfants dont une domestique. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de produits congelés, lapins, ailerons et divers dans une boutique  de sa localité. Pour se ravitailler, elle se rend dans les poissonneries de la place. Dans le but de répondre aux préoccupations de sa clientèle, elle fait donc recours au financement de Finadev. Le bénéfice engendré lui permettra de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de contribuer en partie aux charges du foyer.
texts.en: Mireille, the head of a two-person group, lives with her husband and two children, one of whom lives at home. She sells frozen products, rabbits, fins, and miscellaneous items in a local shop. To stock up, she goes to local fish markets. To satisfy the needs of her clientele, she is seeking financial help from Finadev. The funds will allow her to reinforce her business and to contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of fish, 4 boxes of fins, and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Elizabeth Sara

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 69 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de nazca, Ica, Perú. Nazca es una ciudad cuyos pobladores son muy generosos y hospitalarios, tiene un legado en cuanto a cultura, como peruanos estamos muy orgullosos de esta ciudad ya que alberga las líneas de nazca, estas han sido dibujadas en un extenso campo y eran utilizadas por la cultura Nazca para la agricultura ya que eran una especie de calendario en donde ellos podían saber cuando era la época de lluvia, debido a estas majestuosas líneas esta ciudad alberga cada año infinidad de turistas, asimismo el Peru es muy conocido por su exquisita gastronomía, pero el platillo que le agrada mas a Elizabeth es el riquísimo “Aji de Gallina”, ella nos comenta que comeria ese platillo todos los días sin cansarse; Elizabeth estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria, pero ella hubiera querido estudiar en la universidad administración, debido a que sus padres no tenían los suficientes medios económicos y ella tuvo que trabajar desde pequeña para apoyar en casa. Tiene 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 12, 20, 22 el menor cursa el primer año de secundaria y los mayores estudian en la universidad, Elizabeth lucha mucho por sacar adelnate a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera y con dedicación los apoya mucho, ya que ella quiere que sean mejores que ella y que se sientan orgullosos de tener una profesión, asi como también que no pasen las penurias que ella vivio desde pequeña.

Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, anteriormente ella vendía sus productos solo en su triciclo pero ahorro y ahora tiene unas mesas para que los clientes tomen asiento, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias, puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día y pueden ganar hasta S/. 100, en un día muy bueno puede ganar S/.250, con lo que le ayuda en los gastos adicionales del hogar o los gastos adicionales de estudios de sus hijos. Ella cree que le va bien en su negocio por su dedicación y porque atiende muy bien a los clientes para que siempre vuelvan a comprar sus productos.

Actualmente está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio y con ello obtener mayores ingresos  para mejorar su calidad de vida y tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer, asi como también seguir ahorrando para cumplir sus mas grandes sueños:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos” y “Terminar la construcción de su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 69, lives in the city of Nazca, Ica, Perú.  The inhabitants of Nazca are very generous and hospitable people.  This city has a cultural heritage that we, as Peruvians, are very proud of because this is where the Nazca lines are found. They were drawn in a big field and were used by the Nasca culture for farming. They were a type of calendar where the people could figure out when the rainy season would be. These majestic lines attract a great number of tourists. 

Peru is well-known for its exquisite food, but the dish that Elizabeth likes the most is “Aji de Gallina” (chile chicken).  She tells us that she could eat this dish every day without tiring of it.  Elizabeth attended school up to the fifth year of high school.  However, she would have liked to have studied administration at the university.  Because her parents did not have sufficient financial resources, she had to work since she was little in order to help at home.

She has three children, ages 12, 20, and 22.  The youngest is in the first year of high school, and the older ones attend the university.  Elizabeth struggles a great deal in order to get her children ahead because she is a single mother.  She supports them with great devotion because she wants them to be better than she is.  She wants them to be proud to have a profession and not to have to experience the hardships she lived through since she was little.

Elizabeth sells sweets, soft drinks, and beer.  She used to only sell her products from her tricycle.  But, she saved and now has tables where her customers can sit.  She works around ten hours a day.  She can take care of 30 customers in a day, and she is able to earn up to 100 soles a day; on a very good day she can earn 250 soles.  This helps her with the additional household expenses or her children’s additional educational expenses.  She believes it is going well for her in her business because of her dedication.  She takes very good care of her customers so that they always return to buy her products.

She is now very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the support they have given her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business.  With the merchandise she will get greater income in order to improve her quality of life.  She will also have a greater variety of products to sell.  She will also continue saving in order to fulfill her biggest dreams: To give her children a profession and to build her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (sweets and soft drinks).

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia con 69 años, de estado civil viuda,vive en casa propia,junto a sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Lambayeque,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida al paso como ceviche, tallarin, papa rellena,etc, con una experiencia en el rubro desde más de 8 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales menores y otros gastos. De esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos.

Julia es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, cuenta con experiencia crediticia.

loans.use: para la compra de animales menores y otros gastos.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en: Sevda M. – E. is 45 years old. She is married and her husband has his own construction business. During her whole life Sevda has worked in the field of trade so in 2001 she decides to start her own trade business. She opens a stall on which she sells clothes and socks. She is running her business alone and has no help of anybody. Now she wants to open another stall and to supply it with clothes and needs $ 2 000.

loans.use: To open and supply another stall

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Only a year ago Jessica was working as a teacher, but due to the low wages and inadequate conditions she was forced to find a new source of income. With her savings she was able to purchase two washing machines, which she used to provide laundry services to local community members. In the short time she has been working she has already acquired several machines and she is growing rapidly. She has set up a room in her home where people can come in and rent the machines for a fee. She is seeking a loan so that she may invest in a drying machine, now that she has plenty of washers. She is 31 years old and is married. She only has 1 daughter who is 6 six years old. Her husband works as chauffeur and truck driver, and on his days off he helps his wife at the business. Their goal is to save enough money to buy a truck for her husband to make deliveries on his own.

loans.use: Buy a dryer

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced with two children. She runs a small business selling shoes and leather goods at the central market in Melitopol. She has been in this business for 11 years. Presently her monthly revenue is $900, and her net profit amounts to $370 a month. Her good reputation and customer-friendly service have a very positive impact on her business.

Lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped promote the growth of Irina’s business. She hasn’t had a single late payment on any loan. Available funding has enabled Irina to increase her business income, allowing her to improve the quality of her family’s life.

Irina is requesting a loan for $400 to purchase an assortment of bags in bulk to sell in her kiosk. She is planning to buy luggage items, handbags, satchels, and purses that are in high demand during this season of vacations. Eventually, Irina would like to use some of her profits to meet a few specific needs for her family. Her responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize Irina as a consistent and serious entrepreneur capable of loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase on stock

loans.name: Diana Martha

texts.es:
Diana has a 17-year-old daughter. She started her business selling linens and cosmetics two years ago to pay for her daughter's schooling. At that time, her husband left the home without providing them with any assistance. But Diana is a resourceful woman and she began to offer her products on a payment-plan basis, which has allowed her to increase her clientele considerably. Her daughter now helps out with the business.

To continue to grow, Diana now needs a loan of $250 for the purpose of acquiring merchandise, thus offering a better level of service to her customers. She is willing to repay the loan in 3 months. Today you can help those that are most in need. Diana and her daughter very much appreciate your support and the opportunity that you provide them to better themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Diana tiene una hija de 17 años de edad, ella han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de lencería y cosméticos hace dos años, en ese momento debía pagar la colegiatura de su escuela y su esposo las acababa de abandonar sin pasarles ningún tipo de ayuda, pero Diana es una mujer emprendedora y comenzó a ofrecer sus productos con facilidades de pagos, por lo que sus clientes se han incrementado considerablemente y ahora también recibe la ayuda de su hija en el negocio.

Para poder continuar creciendo ahora Diana necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía y de esta manera poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, ella está dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Diana y su hija agradecen mucho el apoyo y la oportunidad de mejorar que les brindas

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina is married: her husband is self-employed and carries out residential maintenance work. She has here children, of whom two are still studying and the oldest is now working. Her younger son was born with cardiovascular problems and the income that they used to earn was neither sufficient to meet family expenses nor to pay for her son’s treatment. It was because of this that Marcelina saw the necessity of working and decided to start her own business: in this way she started selling soft drinks and snacks among her neighbours. Little by little the business has grown and she is now able to help her husband with the cost of her little boy’s treatments and interventions: because of this she wants to continue with her business and to move forward with her children.

Marcelina is asking for a loan of US $475 in order to buy merchandise for her business and thus to be able to continue her business’ growth and provide much needed help with the family’s expenses. She is offering to repay the loan in six months and she and her family thank you very much for the help that you are offering them to be able to better themselves.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Marcelina está casada y su esposo trabaja por su cuenta haciendo mantenimiento de residencias, tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos estudian aún y el mayor trabaja como obrero, su hijo menor nació con problemas cardiovasculares y los ingresos que percibían no les alcanzaba para los gastos familiares ni para el tratamiento de su hijo, fue por ello que se vio en la necesidad de trabajar y decidió poner su propio negocio, fue así como empezó vendiendo refrescos, frituras y golosinas entre sus vecinos, y poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio a podido poder ayudar a su esposo para costear las intervenciones de su pequeño y sus tratamientos, por esto ella desea continuar con su negocio y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Marcelina solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y así poder continuar creciendo con sus negocios y ayudar a la economía familiar que tanto lo necesitan, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y tanto ella como su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: Merchandise purchase

loans.name: Heyda

texts.es:
Heyda has three children, two of whom are in primary school and her eldest daughter is studying accounting in a prestigious high school in the city. They all live with with her husband, a fish trader in Bellavista market.

Her entrepeneur adventure started with an ice cream and ice store in her house. With her savings and the assessment and help provided by her loving husband, she increased her product offering and expanded the shop. Within three months (and after a lot of hard work) she had to increase the surface of her living room to help her sell with greater ease and security.

As the business has grown, she feels that she needs to increase the products she offers her clients and to improve her family´s standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Heyda, tiene tres hijos, dos estudian en el centro educativo primario nacional y la hija mayor está estudiando contabilidad en un instituto de prestigio de la ciudad. Vive con su esposo quién se dedica a la compra y venta de pescados en el mercado Bellavista.Su travesía comercial empezó cuando decidió vender helados y hielo en su casa y de ahí con unos ahorros y el importante asesoramiento y ayuda de su querido esposo, empezó a incrementar sus productos y acondicionó un espacio en casa exclusivamente para este fin. Con el transcurso de los meses y la constancia de su trabajo empezó a ver los frutos ampliando la salita de su casa para poder vender con mayor comodidad y seguridad. Debido al rápido crecimiento de su pequeño negocio se encuentra en la necesidad de comprar más productos para atender a sus clientes y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase stock to increase sales

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar is a 30 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children in south Lebanon in the Nabatieh region. Sahar is helping her husband, who is the army, support the family. Sahar processes food that she sells afterwards: vinegar, pickles, etc. She needs a loan of $300 to supply herself with the needed provisions for her business.

loans.use: Sahar would like to supply her processed food business with the needed provisions.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en: I am Abida A. D., and I am married and a mother of three. I live with my family in a small town called Borewala in Pakistan. My husband is a rickshaw driver and at present, he drives someone else's rickshaw on rent. Therefore, acquiring a loan to buy our own rickshaw will increase our income. I embroider and stitch clothes on order. My husband and I also tried our luck in the big city of Lahore, but could not find employment there and came back to our town. Now, if our income increases, I plan to construct an additional room in my house.  I have a few other members in my loan group and I want all of these women to get loans for their businesses so that they can bring about positive changes in their lives. These members are: Kishwer P., who is a widow and a mother of one son, and trades sheep and goats, needs a loan to buy a few more goats for her business; Shamim A. needs a loan to buy a new stitching machine for her stitching business; Nasim A. plans to invest this loan in her husband's business of supplying candies and toffees to various shops in the city; Zarina B., who needs money to start a fruit business; and Rukkiah A., who needs a loan to buy her husband a donkey cart.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Jenifer K. is 23 years old. She is married and has one child, who is a year old. She has two other dependents, who are her stepchildren. In 2000, Jenifer established a cocoa business. Jenifer has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase stock in bulk.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase stock in bulk

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
