The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new goods for selling

loans.name: Mwanzo Group

texts.en:
Obedi H. is 33 years old. He is married with three children; only one is a school-going child. Obedi runs a fruit and vegetable business and is also a carpenter. He works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm.

This will be Obedi's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, after repaying his first loan successfully. Obedi is planning to use his current loan to expand his current business into a food store.

Obedi will share this loan with other members of "Mwanzo" group, fifteen in total. The members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan. 

In the photo, Obedi is the only man in the first row in white shirt.

loans.use: To increase working capital for his fruit and vegetable business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material, fabrics, buttons, and thread.

loans.name: José Nelson

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años de edad, reside en Sensembra departamento de Morazán, está viviendo con su esposa y cuatro hijas: Zulma de 9 años, Rosaura de 8, Griselda de 5 y Yesenia de 2 años de edad, su familia depende económicamente de sus ingresos, él está dedicado a la granja de gallinas ponedoras y pollos de engorde, aprendió este negocio junto a su esposa, tiene como ventaja principal el buen numero de clientes y sus dificultades es la constante variación en los precios del concentrado.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de concentrados y adquirir más gallinas ponedoras, esto le ayudara en primer lugar a contar con lo necesario para alimentarlos, en segundo aumentar la granja, logrando mayor capacidad para producir y vender a los clientes.
Su objetivo como comerciante es que su negocio sea fuerte, que sus hijas logren aprenderlo y de esta manera este vivo por largo plazo.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and lives in Sensembra, located in the Department of Morazán, with his wife and four daughters: Zulma (9), Rosaura (8), Griselda (5) and Yesenia (2). His family financially depends on his income and he works raising both laying hens and chickens for fattening. He learned this business together with his wife. The primary advantage is the high number of customers and the difficulty is the constant change in the prices of feed.

He currently needs a loan for the purchase of feed and to obtain more laying hens. This will help him to have the necessary materials to feed them and to expand the farm, thus having a higher production and sales capacity.

His goal as a merchant is for his business to be strong and for his children to learn the trade so that it continues in the long term.

loans.use: to buy feed and more laying hens.

loans.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es: Maria tiene 36 años D. edad. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos menores hijos. ResiD. en el distrito D. Cayaltí, en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Se encuentra ubicada a más D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque. Maria gana la vida brindando el servicio D. tipeado e internet. Tiene más D. 10 años D. experiencia en el negocio. Solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos como papel, toner, tinta etc para su negocio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Es muy conocida en la zona por tener buenas referencias personales. Agradece a los prestamistas D. Kiva por su ayuda en el mantenimiento D. su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two young children. They resiD. in the District of Cayaltí, a community that is dedicated to traD., agriculture, and livestock breeding. This area is located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Maria earns her living by providing typing and Internet services. She has more than ten years of experience in this business. Maria needs to buy more supplies such as paper, toner, ink, and other items for her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Maria is well-known in her area and has good personal references. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their assistance in maintaining her business.

loans.use: To purchase paper, toner, ink, and other supplies.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Азизова Зухро проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Её муж работает бухгалтером в колхозе. Сама она занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает детскую одежду и обувь. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для покупки детской и женской летней обуви, то есть для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Zuhro A. lives in Shahrinav. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband works as a bookkeeper on a collective farm. She works trading in the market. She sells children's clothes and footwear. She has been doing this work for eight years.  She is taking out a loan to buy seasonal goods such as women’s and children’s summer footwear.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's summer footwear

loans.name: Futuro Para Un Bienestar (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar está formado por 11 socias y un socio quienes son personas responsables y ambles que luchan en sus trabajos  para mejorar la economía de sus hogares y en busca de un mejor futuro. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene muchos lugares turísticos para visitar y una deliciosa gastronomía. Ciudad que en 1999 fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad.

La Señora María Carmita S. vive por el sector de San Pedro del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo   estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es maestro en la construcción, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña María se dedica a la lavar ropa ajena, esta actividad  la realiza hace un año y también realiza limpiezas de casas.
 
Nuestra socia se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con este negocio.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Por esta ocasión nos acompañan en la foto unos niños que son hijos de las socias.
texts.en:
The Futuro Para un Bienestar [Future for Wellbeing] community bank is made up of 11 women and one man who are responsible and friendly people who fight in their jobs to improve their household finances and seek a better future. They live in different places in the city of Cuenca. This city has a lot of tourist attractions to visit and a delicious cuisine. 

María Carmita S. lives in the area of San Pedro del Cebollar in the city of  Cuenca. She is 38 years old, married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 4. Her oldest son goes to a neighborhood school. Her husband is a construction worker. They don't own their own home, and they rent.  
 
María takes in laundry. She has been doing this activity for a year and she also cleans houses.
 
Maria is on her fourth loan in the community bank. She was invited to join by her sister. She will invest the money from the loan in buying chickens to start a business. 

Her dream is to have her own house.

On this occasion, children of the members accompany us in the photo.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Phann

texts.en:
Mrs. Phann is shown in the photo. She is a resident of Siem Reap Province. Selling porridge is her daily activity to earn money and feed her children. Besides this business, she sells various items in front of her house, to villagers and other travelers, earning approximately US$3 a day for these activities.

To share responsibility with Mrs. Phann, her husband works as a car taxi driver. At present, the couple lives with three single children, two of whom are employed in various job to earn an income, while the other seven are married and live in their own houses. Mrs. Phann is requesting a loan to buying a new motorbike for her employed children, so they can reduce the costs of their work commute.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike for her children to ride to work.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vit  avec son mari, sa coépouse et  leurs enfants  dans le quartier Sogomougou  de la ville de Koutiala.  
Du à des problèmes de famille, Mariam n’as pas pu  continuer les études,  raison pour laquelle elle s’est tôt intéressée au commerce auprès de sa maman, depuis le bas.  Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, finalement elle opta pour l’achat vente de  l’arachide depuis maintenant  20 ans.  
Afin d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et d’élargir son activité, Mariam  a fait recours  à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 7 ans.   Elle a pris 13 prêts dans l’association (prêt solidaire) tous remboursés correctement  et elle est à son premier prêt individuel. Avec ce financement, elle compte acheter, 10 sacs d’arachides  auprès des stockeurs  de céréales de Koutiala  et effectue sa vente au grand marché à une clientèle composée  de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et très généralement en détail.  Avec ce financement, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariam is 54 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She lives with her husband, her co-wife, and their children in the Sogomougou district of Koutiala City.  Due to family problems, Mariam could not continue with her schooling, which is why she soon became interested  in commerce at an early age, along side her mom. After having run several revenue-generating businesses, she opted in the end to buy and sell peanuts and has been doing so for twenty years now. 

In order to increase her working capital and to expand her business, Mariam turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso seven years ago. She took out thirteen loans with the association (solidarity loans) that were all properly repaid. She is now on her first individual loan. With this financing, she intends to buy 10 sacks of peanuts from grain stockers of Koutiala and to make her sales at the main market. Her  customer base is composed of women and men. Sales are made in cash and generally at the retail level. 

She plans on a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that she envisions using for repaying the interest on the Soro loan and improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years old and married to Josphat. The couple is blessed with three children, ages six, 14 and 16. For the past nine years, Cecilia has run a photocopier, stationery, and M-Pesa (cell phone-based payment system) business. She earns a monthly income of about 26,850 KES to take care of her family.

Cecilia is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to purchase more stationery and repair her photocopier machine. This will be her second loan from KADET. Cecilia will use her anticipated profit to open another branch in Kitengela.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to establish a wholesale stationery store in Kitengela and open another M-Pesa outlet.

loans.use: to purchase stationery and repair photocopy machine

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en:
Firangiz is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. Her husband is a construction worker. Since she was very young, Firangiz worked on a small farm, and now, along with her husband, she works cultivating fruits and vegetables. When their crop comes in, they transport it to the central bazaar in Agsu city to sell. This activity has helped to pay for the expenses of her family and increase her profit. 

Today she needs a loan to prepare her land for the upcoming season.  She requests 1,000 AZN. Firangiz wants to thank everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells banku and secondhand socks at Watreso near Abura in the Central Region of Ghana. Ama has been through junior high school. She is married and has two children. Her business is eight years old. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of her home. Her loan will be used to buy additional socks to re-sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy additional socks to re-sell.

loans.name: Lila Guisela

texts.es:
Lila de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hija en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Oyotun que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.   Esta zona se dedica al comercio al por mayor y menor, pero también  al turismo.

Lila desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (chanchos, patos y cuyes), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y alfalfa para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y mejoramiento de su casa, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Lila es una mujer que con esfuerzo y trabajo saca a su familia adelante junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Lila, 37, lives with her husband and daughter in their own home, which has running water and electricity.  It is located in the district of Oyotun which belongs to the province of Chiclayo.  This area is active in wholesale and retail trade and tourism.

For several years Lila has been raising and selling farm animals such as pigs, ducks and guinea pigs.  Her farmyard is behind the house and is large and   purpose-built.  She gives the animals balanced feed and alfalfa so they develop optimally and can be sold at the different markets in the area.  This provides a good income for household expenses.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and make home improvements.  With the earnings from animal sales she will pay back the loan and improve her lifestyle.  Lila is a woman who works hard with her husband so her family can get ahead.

loans.use: To buy more animals and make home improvements.

loans.name: Bonita

texts.en:
Bonita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Bonita has a shop that sells beverages, snacks & candies. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy candies & snacks for resale. 

Bonita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bonita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy candies & snacks for resale

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Santa María està integrado por dos socias, Rosa Etelvina y Betulia Etelvina, ambas son familiares. Las dos socias viven en la Colonia Santa María en Juticalpa, Olancho. Antes habia otra socia pero se atrasaba en el pago de sus cuotas. 

Sra. Rosa Etelvina tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene 7 hijos. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace mucho tiempo. Empezó su negocio con una chiclera pero la ganancia era poca y decidió cambiar de negocio a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Invertirá el préstamo en materia prima como maíz y leña para aumentar su producción de tortillas y sus ganancias. Con las ganancias podrá mejorar la alimentación y educación de su familia. La Sra. Rosa Etelvina sueña con poder ampliar su casa y hacerle unas mejoras porque está bastante deteriorada. Ha sido un buen cliente de FAMA y siempre ha pagado puntualmente. Agradece la confianza y el apoyo brindado por FAMA, ya que a traves de los préstamos ha superado momentos difíciles. 

Sra. Betulia Etelvina tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda y tiene un hijo. Con su hijo tiene un negocio de reparación y servicio de computadoras. También se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y la venta de agua purificada. Con el préstamo de 3,000 Lempiras comprará componentes de computadoras, ropa de segunda mano y agua purificada. Con el apoyo del préstamo su negocio será más amplio y sus ganancias aumentarán. El sueño de Sra. Betulia Etelvina es que su hijo siga su educación en la universidad.
texts.en: hdhf

loans.use: Comprar maiz y leña

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 39 years old. She sells wall decorations to locals in the village where she lives with her family and four children. She usually earns P500 for each item sold. She had to generate income to provide sustenance for her family. Her eldest child had to stop going to college due to insufficient funds. She had to work and help assist her parents to provide income for the family. Instead of sending them all to school, one of them had to make a sacrifice. Lolita felt guilty about their situation. 

She is now asking for a loan of P8,000 to have additional capital to buy wall decorations and paintings to sell in the village to make extra profits.

In the future, Lolita would like to strengthen her decoration sales to help lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy wall decorations and paintings to sell in the village

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Sugey

texts.es:
La señora Maria Sugey tiene más de seis años con su negocio de venta de productos para el hogar por medio de catálogos.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar mas productos que son (accesorios para el baño, cocina, vajillas y productos naturales para el cuerpo) no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión que le desea realizar a su negocio. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor Gabriel con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fabrica se en cargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos. 
Desea que su negocio tenga más inversión y así poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa y poder darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María Sugey has had her catalogue based home items sales business for over six years.  She’s asking for a loan to buy more products (bath accessories, kitchenware, crockery, natural body products) because she does not have the necessary capital for this investment that she wants to make in her business.  

She plans to use profits obtained from sales to repay the loan since her husband, Gabriel, uses the salary he earns working in a factory to cover household expenses and their two children’s school costs.  She wants her business to have more investment to help her husband with household expenses and to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Betty Consuelo

texts.es:
Betty D. 56 años, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposo e hijo, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito D. Chepén que pertenece al departamento D. la Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Betty es la venta D. carne D. pollo en el interior del mercado central D. Chepen, su negocio lo tiene desD. hace varios años, atiendes D. muy temprano hasta la una D. la tarD. cuenta con su propia clientela por la calidad del producto que venD., con los ingresos D. sus ventas podrá cubrir sus necesidades D. su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más carne D. pollo para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad D. sus clientes, al aumentar sus ventas podrá pagar su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su hijo, brindándole mejores comodidades.
texts.en:
Betty, 56, lives in her own house which has all basic utilities with her husband and son in an urban part of Chepén District that belongs to La Libertad Department.  This zone is noted for farming, animal husbandry and tourism.

Betty sells chicken meat insiD. the Chepén central market.  She’s had the business for several years.  She works from very early in the morning until one in the afternoon.  She has her own established clientele thanks to the quality of the product she sells.  Income from her sales allows her to cover family needs.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan to buy more chicken meat to continue meeting customer demand.  Increasing sales will make it possible for her to repay the loan she was granted and to improve her son’s quality of life providing more comforts for him.

loans.use: to buy more chicken meat.

loans.name: Geremias

texts.es:
Don Geremías, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su hijo, un hermano y sus sobrinos, en total son cinco personas.

Él con su empeño y esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a su familia, ya que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en la tierra, cultivando: maicillo, fríjol y maíz. A la edad de 15 años se hizo cargo de su familia, asumiendo el papel de jefe de hogar, puesto que, no contó con el apoyo de su papá. Entonces él tenía que proveer todo lo necesario para su familia, abandonando sus estudios para dedicarse por completo al trabajo.

Don Geremías, se traslada a comprar los fertilizantes, para esto debe contratar los servicios de un vehiculo, por que donde él vive no hay transporte publico. Sale desde muy temprano de su casa, al regreso a su hogar, lleva los fertilizantes en carreta hasta donde tiene los cultivos, a una distancia de un kilómetro y medio.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra: de fertilizantes y abono, para el mantenimiento de la cosecha. Con el propósito de sacar una buena cosecha y que le permita tener mejores ingresos para su familia. Él tiene el deseo de comprar animales bovinos lecheros, esto le generara otra fuente de ingresos y satisfacción a su familia.
texts.en: Geremías is 48 years old and lives with his son, a brother, and two nephews—a total of five people. Through his commitment and hard work, his family has persevered. When he was very young he began to work the land, planting sorghum, beans and corn. At the age of 15, he took over his family, assuming the role of head of household since he couldn’t rely on the support of his father. He then had to provide all the necessities for his family, giving up his studies to work full time. Geremías travels to buy fertilizer, and to do this he has to hire a car because there is no public transport where he lives. He leaves his house very early until the return home, and he takes the fertilizers in a wagon to his crops, a distance of one and half kilometers. This loan will be invest in the purchase of fertilizers and manure for crop maintenance in order to get a good harvest which will allow his to have more income for his family. He would like to buy dairy cows which would give him another form of income and satisfaction for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Nahason

texts.en: Nahason is a married man who is 31 years old. For the last three years, he has been running an electronics shop, where he sells radios and televisions to support his family. He also does farming to supplement his income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a water pump for irrigation. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: 030708-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhuận operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Nhuận is 38 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of an eight-member group, the 030708-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Nhuận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhuận has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nhuận has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nhuận faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nhuận hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Illuminada

texts.en:
Illuminada is married with three children. Illuminada is 29 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Illuminada has a spices retail business to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase different spices to sell/retail.

Illuminada has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Illuminada hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to sell

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Cristina Abigail

texts.es:
Cristina Abigail tiene 19 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo, suegros y el hijo de 8 meses de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.

Cristina se dedica a la Agricultura, crianza de animales. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para poder invertir en el arreglo de la casa.
El dinero del crédito lo utilizara muy bien. El sueño es tener un terreno. Lo9s desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es la sequedad del tiempo o mucho invierno.
En el tiempo libre le gusta las festividades del carnaval y el año nuevo.

cON LA AYUDA DEL CREDITO ANTERIOR pudo mejorar el estilo de vida y compro semillas, abonos agrícolas.los ingresos han mejorado, se ha cultivado productos de calidad, la relación con la familia ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Cristina Abigail, 19, is married and has one child.  She lives with her husband, her in-laws and her 8-month old son in Ecuador's Bolivar province. She is a member of the VENTANAL community bank in Guantuncoto, a town about 30 minutes from our office.  The people of the town operate businesses that include: farming, ranching, livestock-rearing (pigs, chickens, sheep), retailing and construction.  

Cristina makes a living from farming and livestock-rearing.  She buys and sells what she needs in Guaranda.  She is applying for a loan to make repairs to her house.  The money from the loan will be put to good use.  Cristina's goal is to own a place of her own.  She faces challenges such as drought and cold.  

In her free time, Cristina likes to go to Carnaval and New Year's festivals.

With the help of past loans, Cristina was able to improve her standard of living and buy seeds, fertilizer, etc.  Her income has increase, the quality of her crops has improved and her relations with her family are better.

loans.use: to pay for personal housing expenses.

loans.name: Kimiti

texts.en:
Kimiti is 24 and single. For the past year, he has operated a retail shop and earns a monthly income of 2,000 KES. 

Kimiti is requesting his first loan with KADET to buy sugar, rice, and flour to sell. In the future, he hopes to start a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and flour

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Unidas por el Progreso” es un grupo conformado por 06 socios, la cual lleva 04 meses trabajando con el Programa- Prosperidad, siendo Betzabet la que preside el grupo, ella tiene 34 años de edad, es separada y tiene 02 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando al menor de ellos ya que está en etapa escolar. Hace  más de 04 años  que Betzabet se dedica a la venta de anticuchos, la cual los ofrece a las afueras de su hogar, gracias a su arduo trabajo a podido mejorar su calidad de vida pues hace 01 años instalo en su domicilio una tienda la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Betzabet es una mujer trabajadora que tiene como anhelo terminar de construir su vivienda. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para invertir en su tienda comprando abarrates como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos y aceite y de esta manera llegar a fidelizar a sus clientes. La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Unidas por el Progreso” agradecen el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
The community bank "Mujeres Unidas por el Progreso" [Women United for Progress], is a group made up of six members who have worked with the Prosperity Program for four months.  

Betzabet is the leader of the group.  She is 34 years old, separated, and has two children.  She currently supports her younger child, who is school aged.  For more than four years, Betzabet has worked selling kebabs.  She sells them outside her house.  Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to improve her quality of life, and one year ago, she started a store in her home that sells staple products.  Betzabet is a hardworking woman whose goal is to finish building her home.  

She is asking for this loan to invest in her store by purchasing groceries such as rice, milk, pasta, and oil so that she can build a loyal customer base.  

The community bank "Mujeres Unidas por el Progreso" is very thankful for the loan being provided.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, pasta, and oil.

loans.name: Bertha Veronica

texts.es:
La señora  Bertha Verónica es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado desde hace 2 años. Ella está casada con don Juan quien se dedica a la construcción en especial a poner cielo Razo.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pantalones, blusas y calzado en general.
texts.en:
Bertha Verónica is a woman who is very hardworking and enterprising woman. She has been working in the business of selling clothing and shoes for 2 years. She is married to Juan, who works in construction, specifically in installing ceilings. 

She will use the loan to buy pants, blouses, and a variety of shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise, especially pants, blouses, and a variety of shoes

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Sabella is a married and a shopkeeper at Angurai her rural village. With the loan of $225 she plans to buy cereals from the neighboring country of Uganda for resale at her shop. She hopes in future to qualify for a bigger loan to enable her start a posho mill to serve her local community. PEMCI is proud to be associated with the work that Sabella is doing. 
`

loans.use: To stock her shop

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence N. is 45 years of age with seven  children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells cakes, snacks and fruits for the public. She requests a loan of $800 for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more snacks and fruits for sale

loans.name: Liliana

texts.en:
Liliana is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a bricklayer and the income he receives is very low. In order to improve the living conditions of her family, two years ago Liliana decided to start her own business selling groceries. She started out with few products, but little by little she has been adding more and her customers have increased. It has not been easy for Lili to be in charge of her business and her home at the same time, but her love for her children is her motivation every day.

In order to keep growing, she needs a loan in the amount of $925, which she will use to buy merchandise, with which she will offer better service to her clients and a greater variety of products. She will pay back the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. Be an important part of the life of this family by contributing to the growth of this business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Liliana es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes deseos de superación, es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es albañil y el ingreso que recibe es muy bajo, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, Liliana decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, hace dos años inició con pocos productos, pero poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor y sus clientes se han incrementado. No ha sido fácil para Lili hacerse cargo de su negocio y de su hogar al mismo tiempo, pero el amor hacia sus hijos es lo que la motiva todos los días.

Para continuar creciendo, ella necesita de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, con la que brindará un mejor servicio a sus clientes y una mayor variedad de productos, ella se compromete a regresas esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Dania Iveth

texts.es:
Hello, I run a small Grocery Store in my house and I need to buy more products to stock my store and give my clients better service. I use the income from my store to pay for my studies and to help my parents with monthly expenses. I worked hard to start this business one year ago, and now my goal is to restock my store.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Hola, Yo tengo un pequeño negocio de una pequeña pulperia (Grrocery Store) en mi casa, ahora necesito comprar mas producto para poder surtirla y dar una mejor atencison a mis clientes. Con este negocio me pago mis estudios y ayudo a mis padres en gastos mensuales. Este negocio lo empese hace un año con mucho esfuerzo, pero ahora tengo una meta que es surtir mi pulperia

loans.use: To purchase toilet paper, cookies, soft drinks, sugar, rice, dish and body soap, etc.

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.es:
Hello my name is Rita Maria. I am a businesswoman with a small used clothing business, called sale of American Clothes "C.." I have many years of dedication to this type of activity, the one that gives me earnings to contribute for the expenses of my family and other commercial transactions with suppliers. Thanks to the wages I pursue from this business I can cover the expenses of the education of my children and and they help me in their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Rita Maria, soy comerciante cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, llamado venta de Ropa Americana "C.", tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a los ingresos que persigo de este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos de educación de mis hijos y ellos me colaboran en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: A parcel of jackets, doubles, childrens shirts - Un fardo de chumpa, cameras, blusas y de niño

loans.name: Mehriban

texts.en: Mehriban A. is a mother of four children. This 58-year-old woman is a widow. She lives in the Salyan region, in Yenikand village.  She has been in the farming business for 20 years. Now she is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land and fertilizer

loans.name: Sout

texts.en: Mrs. Sout S. E., age 25, is a traditional musician, earning around $5 each day. Her husband works driving a trailer attached to a motor-bike to transport passengers, making about $4 per day. They have one child who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order seek an additional income source by purchasing pigs to breed and sell. She also plans to fix her husband’s broken trailer so he can better operate his business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to breed and sell for additional income.

loans.name: Fatuma's Tuimarike Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, 36, is married and has 8 children (ages 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, 10, 7, and 3). She runs a business selling snack foods, which she began in 2002. She works daily from 7 am to 10 pm and makes a monthly profit of about $105 from this business.

Fatuma hopes to take out a loan to buy more food stock in order to increase her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup who have businesses dealing in clothing and food sales.

loans.use: To buy food stock

loans.name: Collins

texts.en: Collins M. is 26 years old, single and lives in Benin City. He has been a LAPO client for 2 years, and solicits a loan of $850 to enable him to buy more cosmetics and weaves for sale. He has been in business since 2006.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and weaves for sale

loans.name: Pannha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pannha N. and her husband have been married for eight years. They have one little daughter. The family lives in Mekong River’s Island about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Pannha started weaving silk when she was young. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to middlemen in her village. Her husband, Vanna Yoen, has been repairing wooden houses for three years. He travels from place to place for his business.

Mrs. Pannha is requesting a loan for the sixth time in the amount of $800 for purchasing a motorbike for her husband go to work.

loans.use: For purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Qatun Llaqta Group

texts.es:
The Qatun Llaqta Communal Bank means “Great People” in quechua. It’s young, as it was started a year ago. It currently has three cycles and 16 partners. The partners of this Communal Bank are from a variety of communities in the Socos state, where the population is employed in agriculture, especially growing corn and raising animals.

The partners note that the Communal Bank has taught them to be punctual and responsible, and to save.

The partners are engaged in a variety of businesses including selling food, vegetables, grains, firewood, raising small animals and embroidering blankets (these are used to carry supplies and children).

Each partner has a different story. Adela, for example, helps her husband sell firewood and embroiders beautiful blankets which she sells in the markets.

The partners need to borrow different amounts, including 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, and 900 soles, for a total loan of 8,700 soles to the Communal Bank.

These loans will buy rice, sugar, carrots, squash, onions, thread, cord, wheat, beans, eucalyptus trees, guinea pigs, and chickens.

The partners dream of seeing their businesses grow and their children receive a better education than they did.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Qatun Llaqta que significa “Pueblo GranD.” en quechua, es un banco joven que se inició hace 1 año. Actualmente tiene 3 ciclos y 16 socias. Las socias D. este Banco Comunal son D. diferentes comunidades del Distrito D. Socos, donD. la población se dedica a la agricultura en especial D. maíz y crianza D. animales.

Las socias mencionan que en el Banco Comunal las socias aprendieron a ser puntuales, responsables y a ahorrar.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, verduras, cereales, leña, crianza D. animales menores y bordado D. mantas (que son utilizadas para cargar bultos y sus hijos)

Cada socia tiene una historia diferente como es el caso D. Adela que junto a su esposo venden leña y además Adela hace bellos bordados en mantas que luego venD. en las ferias.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,700 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra arroz, azúcar, zanahoria, zapallo, cebolla, hilos, maíz, trigo, haba, árboles D. eucalipto, cuy y gallina.

Los sueños D. las socias es que sus negocios crezcan y que sus hijos sean mejores que ellas con una educación.

loans.use: These loans will buy rice, sugar, carrots, squash, onions, thread, cord, wheat, beans, eucalyptus trees, guinea pigs, and chickens.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Investment of First Loan:

Jorge could buy all the necessary agricultural supplies to attend to the demand of his clients. That is to say he was able to buy everything in time, finishing his crop as expected and marketing all his product.

Development of Business:

The 4 blocks that he possesses have permitted him to have sufficient land to cultivate not only rice but also related products, as for example corn. He more than 5 years of experience in agriculture, which vouches for the quality and quantity of his products.

Personal information:

Jorge is 22 years old. He is Single. He does not have children. His dwelling is of mixed construction; cane and wood. One of his aspirations is to be able to buy more hectares of land and to have the best production of the sector.

Use of Second Loan:

With this new loan he will buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to take advantage of the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of his location is that it is in the high part of this coastal sector.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Inversión de Primer Préstamo:

Jorge pudo comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Es decir que compro todo a tiempo, terminando su cosecha como el esperaba y comercializando todo su producto.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Las 4 cuadras que posee, le han permitido tener terreno suficiente para cultivar no solo arroz sino productos afines como por ejemplo el maíz. Mas de 5 años de experiencia avalan la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

Información Personal :

Jorge tiene 22 años. Es Soltero. No tiene hijos. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta caña y madera. Una de sus aspiraciones es superarse para comprar más hectáreas de tierra y tener la mejor producción del sector.

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, equipo menor, alquiler de maquinarias, contratación de mano de obra, y otros insumos necesarios para aprovechar la época invernal, y ahorrar el riego. La ventaja del sector es que esta en la parte alta de este sector costero.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to take advantage of the winter season.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia Visesio, 43, is married with 2 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the Flea Market business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has a previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 440 Tala (~183 USD).  SPBD loans are Telesia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She's a mother of two children. Her husband is also unemployed like her, but working out on his taro plantation

loans.use: Purchase cabbages and cucumber seed, also for fertilizers and pots for planting.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Mrs. Tuy L. grows crops on her farmland behind her house, and makes about $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Kim Kang, is a fisherman. They live in Boeung Chum Village, Siem Reap Province. Because of the crops' high price in the market, she needs to expand her crop business to get more profit. Now she is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase fertilizer to use for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use for her crops

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria lives on Julián Apaza Street in the Río Seco area of the city of El Alto [suburb of La Paz] with her husband and children. Her husband is a public employee.

She owns a shop where she makes photocopies and sells paper and writing utensils.

Victoria plans to use the loan to purchase merchandise (notebooks, pencils, etc.) for sale in her store. This is her second loan from IMPRO, which performed an assessment qualifying her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Victoria, en la calle Julián Apaza de la zona de Río Seco en la ciudad de El Alto vive junto a su esposo que es empleado público y sus hijos.

Posee una tienda donde realiza trabajo de fotocopias y venta de artículos de librería.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería (cuadernos, lápices, etc.) para su posterior venta en su tienda. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (notebooks, pencils, pens, paper, etc.) for bookstore

loans.name: Momajon

texts.ru:
Сафарова Момаджон  является одной из женщин, у кого большой ассортимент детской одежды. Она   1969 года рождения, разведена, у нее 3 детей. Занимается продажей  одежды от новорожденных до школьного возраста на рынке «Панджшер» города Душанбе. Предпринимательскую деятельность начала в 2003 году. Момаджон старается с каждым годом увеличивать наименование товара. Свой товар она привозит с рынка «Корвон» и иногда закупает у поставщиков из Китая. 
Ассортимент продаваемых ею товаров она хочет пополнить разновидностями детских обуви. В разгар сезона продажи осенней обуви  хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа сезонных товаров.
texts.en:
Momajon S. is one of the women who has a large assortment of children’s clothing for sale. She was born in 1969, is divorced and has 3 children. She sells children’s clothing in sizes ranging from newborn to school aged at the “Pandzhsher” market in Dushanbe. Momajon started her business in 2003. She tries to increase the variety of her products every year. Momajon purchases her products at the “Korvon” market and sometimes purchases products from Chinese suppliers.

Momajon would like to increase her product assortment with a selection of children’s shoes as this is the height of the season for autumn footwear. Momajon would like to participate in Kiva and to take out a loan of 4100 somoni ($1200) for the purchase of new products to sell.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene I. is 47 years old and is married, with four children.  She has been in the clothing and accessory business for a long time and the demand for her clothes, shoes and bags is high.  She needs a loan of $700 to purchase more merchandise to sell.

Magdalene is a hardworking woman and she hopes to lift her family above poverty.  She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Klery

texts.es: Sherly es natural de la provincia de Azángaro, convive con su pareja, Valerio de 36 años, el cual es enfermero y tienen una hija Ariane de 1 añito. Se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (papas fritas con sachichas) desde hace más de un año para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Cuida a su pequeña por las mañanas y por las tardes al promediarse las 5 o 6 de la noche sale a vender sus salchipapas, quedándose hasta muy tarde, ya que tiene que terminar todo lo preparado. Lo mas difícil es tener que trabajar y estar pendiente de su hija, que ya está en una etapa muy inquieta, pero lo bueno de esta actividad es que le permite ganar dinero extra al que gana su pareja para la manutención de la pequeña Ariane. Con el dinero que pide comprará más ingredientes para producir más cantidad de salchipapas, y en el futuro poner un pequeño restaurante.
texts.en:
Sherly is from the province of Azángaro, lives together with her partner, Valerio, who is 36 years old and is a nurse and they have a daughter Ariane who is one year of age. She has worked selling salchipapas (french fries with sausages) for more than a year to be able to help with household expenses. She cares for her small daughter in the mornings and in the afternoon until an average of 5 to 6 in the evening she goes out to sell her salchipapas, staying until very late as she has to finish everything that has been prepared. The most difficult thing is to have to work and take care of her daughter as she is at a very active age, but the good thing about this activity is that it allows her to earn extra money in addition to what her partner earns to take care of little Ariane. With the money that she is requesting she will buy more ingredients to produce a greater quantity of salchipapas and in the future start a small restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients and materials to make salchipapas.

loans.name: Gerardo German

texts.es: El señor Gerardo M. P. fue criado en la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, en la panadería de sus padres, como ellos ya son ancianos pensaban dejarlo a cargo de la panadería para que continúe con la tradición familiar; pero el demostró poco interés por hacerse cargo del negocio familiar, ya que  desde muy pequeño que le gusta arreglar las radios viejas, televisores, etc. Es por ello que se da cuenta de que su vocación es arreglar aparatos eléctricos. Con el paso de los años empieza trabajar como ayudante en un pequeño taller de la zona Norte de la ciudad, desde entonces ha ahorrado de a poco para adquirir un pequeño local en alquiler con el esfuerzo propio y sin el apoyo familiar. Hoy con 46 años de edad y con una experiencia de de 23 años en el rubro, solicita el préstamo para adecuar su taller a las necesidades de su oficio, al mismo tiempo necesita de capital para equipar su pequeño taller. Trabaja día a día pensando en ampliar su taller.
texts.en:
Gerardo M. P. grew up in La Paz, Bolivia in the bread shop of his parents. Now that his parents are old, they are thinking about leaving the bread shop to him so that he can carry on the family tradition. However, he has demonstrated little interest to take on this task because he has liked to fix radios, televisions, etc. since he was very young. Because of this, he realized that his career should be in fixing electronics. For many years, he worked as an assistant in a small rented workshop in the North zone of the city. Since then, he has saved little by little to establish a shop on his own without family support. With an age 46 years and 23 years of local experience, he requests this loan to adapt his shop to the necesities of the job. At the same time, he needs capital to equip his small workshop. Each day that he works, he thinks about growing his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip his workshop

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta D. is 52 years old and married with ten children. She tills a small parcel of land, which she inherited from her father. Her life is in farming and she loves growing crops, especially rice. Vicenta believes that rice is an important commodity, and will always be a good business opportunity. Her husband, who is also a farmer, is her partner in sending all their children to school and in meeting the family needs.

Vicenta needs a loan of $125 to purchase sacks of certified seed and fertilizers. She also plans to open a store where she can sell her farm produce, and increase her profits to support her family.

CEVI always seeks what is best for its clients. Through credit assistance, training, and the insurance coverage they offer to entrepreneurs like Vicenta, CEVI benefits the lives of the people in the community.

loans.use: To purchase certified seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zarinakhon

texts.en:
Zarinakhon E. is 23 years old. She is married and has one child. Zarinakhon has a tailoring business at her home. Her business is sewing traditional women's dresses. Her workmanship is very good and being young, she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business.

Zarinakhon has had this business for 3 years and this is her second loan from IMON International. With her loan, Zarinakhon will buy more material for sewing dresses. She smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses, and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing materials for sewing women's dresses

loans.name: Hectro Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Héctor labora para una reconocida empresa a nivel mundial de refrescos cuenta con varios años de antigüedad, el esta solicitando este crédito para el enjarre interior de su vivienda ya que le quiere proporcionar a su familia un hogar mas cómodo y agradable.
texts.en:
Héctor works for an established, well-known global beverage company. He is requesting a loan to purchase plaster for the interior walls of his house because he wants to provide his family with a more comfortable and pleasant home.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior remodel (plaster for the interior walls)

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El Sr. Andrès tiene 56 años, es soltero y presta servicio de tractor para excavaciones de piedras de canteros , flete para el transporte de ladrillos de las hornerìas del interior del paìs hasta los depositos de materiales de Asunciòn. Tambièn presta servicios a los viveros para el transporte de las plantas. El credito será de ayuda para poder completar el monto que necesita para adquirir un nuevo tractor y de esta forma ampliar su area de cobertura y otorgar empleo a otras personas en la conduccion de los vehiculos.
texts.en:
Mr. Andrés is 56 years old and single. He works in construction as a tractor-operator during excavations of rock which are baked and transported to Asunción. Andres also operates a tractor in a nursery, helping to transport plants. He is requesting a loan to help him purchase a new tractor, which will help him increase his coverage and service more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a tractor

loans.name: Edwin Patrick

texts.es: El sr. Patrick trabaja desde muy pequeño en el rubro de la platería, conjuntamente con su hermano y su papá que es el que le enseñó el oficio. Su taller es en la misma casa, y su trabajo es completamente manual, le dan distintas formas a la lámina de plata alpaca, como máscaras, arcángeles, y realizan también trabajos como cofres, soperas, cetros. El crédito será invertido en la compra de láminas de plata alpaca y plata 900, ya que tienen pedidos de cofres y arcángeles.
texts.en:
Patrick has worked as a silversmith from a young age, along with his brother and father who taught him the craft. His workshop is in his own house, and the work is entirely manual. They shape silver into a variety of shapes such masks and archangels, and also make items such as jewelry boxes, soup tureens, and scepters. The loan would be invested into purchasing sheets of alpaca and silver 900, as they have orders for jewelry boxes and archangels.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of sheets of silver.

loans.name: Enazar

texts.ru: Эназар мужчина 35 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена работает в сельской школе учительницей. Сам Эназар полностью занимается бизнесом животноводства.Он покупает скот и откормив его , продаёт его на рынке через несколько месяцев. Он сам работает сварщиком на заказ. С чего имеет доход на жизнь. Эназар   хорошо разбирается в породистых скотах. У него очень крупные , откормленные бараны. Которые он продаёт мясникам для убоя и продажи мяса. Для увеличения  скота Эназар решил взять кредит.
texts.en:
Enazar is a 35-year-old man, and married with four children. His wife works as a teacher at the agricultural school. Enazar himself works full-time raising livestock. He purchases cattle, fattens them and sells them at the market in several months' time. He also works part-time as a welder, which brings in income for living expenses. Enazar has a good understanding of purebred cattle. He has very large, fat sheep, which he sells to butchers to slaughter for the meat. Enazar decided to take out a loan to increase the size of his flock.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Benardetha

texts.en:
Bernadetha S. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur and married businesswoman. She runs a poultry-keeping business in the Yombo Makangarawe ward of Dar es Salaam. She keeps both broilers and laying chickens in poultry cages. Broilers take only three months to sell while layers take six months to get the first lay out, thus they are more expensive to keep than broilers but generate a lot of income and are less expensive once they start laying eggs.

She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to expand the business by constructing more poultry cages and buying more chicks.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Koem Y. is 30 years old and lives in Pursat Province where she owns and runs a pigpen next to her home. The pigs can be sold to the slaughterhouse within three months after she begins to raise them. She can make several sales each year. Besides raising pigs, she also cultivates rice crop.

Her husband, Pheak, is also 30 and works as a domestic building worker. Currently, the family is facing a difficulty with transportation. They have always paid a lot of money to take taxis. Because of this problem, Koem Y. has decided to seek a loan to purchase a motorbike for family's riding needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for the family's transportation needs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria R. has a sari-sari store business. She is a 54-year-old mother of seven children. She started her business using her own capital of PHP 3,000. The income that she earns from the store helps her pay the household expenses. She is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI to buy additional merchandise and to enroll her children in school. The loan will help in growing her business and paying her children’s tuition fees.

CEVI is reaching out to people and helping them grow and sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides loans, trainings and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise and pay her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Hak T., 29, is married and lives with her husband and three young children in Phnom Penh. She is a professional tailor, making about US$ 2 each day. Her husband is a mechanic who makes around US$ 7 each day.

Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. In light of the struggling economy, she is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to purchase cloth to expand her business. She sees an opportunity to increase her income and believes their standard of living will improve.

loans.use: To purchase cloth for her business

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es: Leoncia tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 3 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años y diariamente, junto con su esposo, recorren las calles de su ciudad para ofrecer el servicio de transporte público. El minibus que poseen es propio y está inscrito a una línea de transportes con todos los documentos en regla, lo cual favorece su libre circulación. Leoncia se encarga de cobrar a los pasajeros y su esposo es el conductor, esta actividad es familiar, porque hasta su pequeño hijo los acompaña en el recorrido. Sus días de descanso sólo se dan cuando tienen que hacer el mantenimiento técnico de su vehículo o cuando hay capacitación de chóferes, a donde su esposo asiste obligatoriamente. Todos estos años de trabajo han sido muy ventajosos para su familia, porque esta actividad no solo es su sustento económico, sino también unificador de sus relaciones. Por ello, sus planes a futuro son de adquirir una nueva movilidad para incrementar sus ganancias. Esta es la sexta vez que Leoncia tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es reconocida en su banco comunal por su perseverancia y actitud de emprendimiento, por su parte, se compromete a seguir trabajando por el bienestar del grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado para el pago del mantenimiento técnico, pintura y renovación de los asientos de su minibus.
texts.en:
Leoncia is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 year old son in their own home. For 8 years, they have traveled through the city streets every day operating their public transport service. They own their own minibus and keep their registration documents in order so that they can operate their travel route with minimal restrictions. Leoncia is responsible for collecting payments from passengers while her husband is in charge of driving. This is a family business because their son has accompanied them ever since he was a baby. Their days off only occur when maintenance is performed on their vehicle or if drivers undergo training, in which her husband’s attendance is mandatory. All these years of work have been very profitable for her family because this business is not only their livelihood but it has also strengthened their relationship. Their future plans include acquiring a new vehicle to increase their profits.

This is Leoncia’s sixth loan with MFP. She is recognized by her communal bank group for her perseverance and entrepreneurial attitude. For her part, she promises to continue working for the welfare of the group. Her loan will be used to pay for maintenance, paint and replacement of the seats of her minibus.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her minibus

loans.name: Dobaly

texts.fr: Dobaly DIATTA est une femme mariée de 49 ans, mère de 2 enfants. Elle achète du savon local et des balaies pour les revendre en détail. Elle souhaiterait renforcer son activité de commerce et mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Dobaly DIATTA, age 49, is married and the mother of 2 children. She buys local soap and brooms, and retail them. She would like to bolster her business to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail local soap and brooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of hair products as well as service the facilities.

loans.name: Sheren Gul Group

texts.en: Sheren Gul is a group composed of three members. Each member wants a loan to expand her family’s business, so they are requesting 30,000 AFN as a group. Sheren Gul wants a loan to support her husband’s general store. Bibi Sheren wants a loan for her husband’s small restaurant, while Anas Gul wants a loan for her carpet weaving business. They are very happy with this Afghani loan process.

loans.use: To expand 3 businesses: a general store, a restaurant & a carpet weaving enterprise

loans.name: Señor De Laguanas Group

texts.es:
Señor de Laguanas es un grupo numero de 16 integrantes, se agruparon hace poco y desean estar mucho tiempo juntas. La mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a negocios de producción como el tejido de mantas y chompas, confección de polleras (faldas para mujeres), elaboración de matracas. Ellas desean ampliar su negocio comprando materia prima como tela y lana, otras se dedican a la comercialización de verduras y por último dos socias se dedican a la atenciónde cabinas telefónicas.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para mejorar o ampliar sus negocios, comprando mercadería y materia prima.
texts.en:
“Señor de Laguanas” [“Our lord of Laguanas”] is a group composed of 16 members; they came together recently and they hope to remain together for a long time. The majority of group member have businesses in the production of knitted sheets and jackets, making ‘polleras’ (traditional women’s underskirts), and making rattles; they hope to expand their businesses by purchased basic materials such as cloth and wool. Other group members have businesses in the sale of vegetables, and the last two members provide phone booth services.

They all need this loan to improve and expand their businesses by purchasing merchandise and basic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and basic materials.

loans.name: Cora Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Cora del Socorro S. de 49 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo de 17 años de edad, que estudia, trabaja como conserje en un colegio americano desde hace 24 años, reside en el bario Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, una de sus deseos es poder ayudar a su hijo a que sea un hombre honrado y preparado ante esta sociedad, ya que ha muchos esfuerzos ha sobresalido a delante para lograr tener su propia vivienda ya que es lo mas caro de lograr para muchos hermanos Nicaragüense por que todo esta caro y solo mediante el financiamiento podremos comenzar hacer posibles las metas. Este es el onceavo crédito en Afodenic el cual comprara zinc, perlines y otros para poner el techo a la sala y una parte a los cuartos. Espera seguir en su empleo, a si como poder tener mejores prestaciones sociales.
texts.en:
Cora del Socorro Sequeiro is a 49 year old single mother. She has a 17 year old son who goes to school. She has worked as a janitor in the American School for 24 years. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. One of her wishes is to be able to help her son become an honorable man who is prepared for this world. She has put forth much effort and has been able to get ahead. She has her own house, which is very hard for many Nicaraguans to do because everything is expensive. Loans are the only way we can begin to reach our goals. This is her eleventh loan with Afodinic. She will buy zinc sheets, beams, and other things to be able to put a roof on the living room and a part of the rooms. She hopes to continue with her work in order to have better benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc sheets and beams to put a roof on the living room and a part of the rooms

loans.name: Mrs. Kai Chhean Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 15 people who live in the village of Dong in the province of Takeo. Each group member plans to use the loan for individual business purposes.

Mrs. Kai C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Leom Sareourn, are farmers. Although they work hard, they still earn less income than is needed to support their family. In order to improve the living conditions of the family, Mrs. Kai C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a sugar cane juice box to start a new business.

Mrs. Kai C. is 40 years old and is the mother of five children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a sugar cane juice box to start a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia sells frozen foods like chicken and fish in a cold store and also runs a grocery shop in the local market near where she lives. She is 48 years old and a married woman with six children. Three of her children are currently in school. She started her business 15 years ago. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in bulk to supply her customers. She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With this loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fish and chicken and grocery goods to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. She dreams of being the number one supplier of frozen food in her community.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken and mutton, etc.

loans.name: Praxides Baraza

texts.en: Pradixes Baraza E. sells used clothes including shirts, T-shirts and trousers to repeat and walk-in customers from a stall in a market near Aga Khan hospital.  She has been in this business for four years, and her business challenge is the rainy season as her stall is the open air.  She is using the proceeds of KES 20,000 loan to buy bales of used shirts, T-shirts and trousers.  In the future, she wants to expand into a boutique, enroll her children  in a good school so that all have the best in their life.  Pradixes is married to a driver and  has three daughters.   She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: To buy 3 bales of shirts and 1 bale of trousers.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en: Paulo M. runs two kinds of businesses: selling farm produce and fish-selling. At the age of 29 years, he is married and blessed with 3 children. Both businesses are doing well, he says, and his main plan is to expand both by half again next year. Paulo needs a loan of Kshs.30,000 to restock his fish and channel some to his farm and cattle feed.

loans.use: Restock fish

loans.name: Okuambo Ocokoru Baifa Group

texts.en:
Baifa O. is loan group representative. She is thirty-one years of age and married with six children of which four are going to school. She deals in the business of selling Irish potatoes and she has been in this business for over four years. 

Baifa is using the loan to purchase bags of Irish potatoes from the local villages for resale in the Arua town market. The loan will improving her business as she is now stocking supplies of Irish potatoes which will increase her profits. She is a hardworking business woman whose future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase bags of Irish potatoes from local villages to resell in the Arua town market.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 11 años se dedica a las labores agrícolas y ganaderas. Tiene en su establo con vacas, toros y ovejas; además siembra maíz, papa y alfalfa, la que le sirve para alimentar a sus animales. Para Silvia, sus mejores ingresos económicos se los brinda la venta de alfalfa, por lo que ha intensificado su producción. Ella corta todas las mañanas este pasto para alimentar a sus animales y posteriormente distribuirlo a sus clientes. Y por la rentabilidad de este negocio está planeando adquirir más extensiones de terreno para sembrar alfalfa.

Este es su 9no crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, donde viene participado activamente. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará sacos de abono para sembrar más alfalfa, y también un becerro para criarlo y luego venderlo.
texts.en:
Silvia, 37, lives with her husband and two children in her own home. For the last 11 years she has been a farmer and has raised cattle. The has cows, bulls and sheep and she grows corn, potato and alfalfa, which serves as feed for her animals. For Silvia, her best earner is alfalfa sales, so she has increased its production. She harvests this grass daily to feed her animals and then distribute to her customers. Because of the high profitability of this business, she is planning to acquire more land to grow alfalfa. This is her 9th loan with MFP and she is happy to be part of a communal bank where she is an active participant. The funds requested now will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer to plant more alfalfa as well as to buy a calf to raise for subsequent sale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is a thirty eight years old woman. She is married with two children who are in school. She is a food vendor. She prepares rice and tomato sauce with fish and sell to her community on one of the principal street of her town. Leticia’s lack of significant business progress is influenced by inadequate working capital.  She is constantly disturbed by price hikes since she is not able to buy food ingredients in bulk. She needs the loan to enable her inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and improve her meal quality.  She would be buying food ingredients like bags of rice, vegetable oil, spices and firewood in bulk. She is expecting to increase her profit to support her family’s finances.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Emiliano, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestro socio está ubicado en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 33 años de edad él es  conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 6 años, nuestro socio es artesano y transportista, el socio trabaja con la venta de artesanía, nuestro socio a su vez trabaja como transportista, el brinda servicio en la ruta Pisac Calca, nuestro socio ahora que las inundaciones afectaron el distrito de Coya en Pisac, se ven afectado porque disminuyo el turismo y las artesanías no se venden igualmente el transporte ahora está bajo las personas no circulan por estos lares a causa de que muchos de ellos cerraron sus pequeñas tiendas destinadas al turismo. Nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para mejorar su taller de artesanía, para cuando la temporada empiece. 

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member is Emiliano, he belongs to the “CAPAC QOYA” communal bank, and he lives in the district of Coya- Pisac, 50 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Our member is 33 years old and he lives with his partner and has a six-year-old son. Emiliano is an artisan and a salaried worker in the transportation sector in the Pisac Calca route. Our member has been affected by the flooding in the district of Coya in Pisac, since tourism has decreased and the handicrafts are not sold and transportation has decreased since people don’t frequent the area as much and many have closed their small stores dedicated to tourism. Our member needs the loan to make improvements to his workshop for when the new season starts.

Our member is happy for the opportunity given to him and is committed to meet the payments of his quotas in the time set.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member needs the loan to make improvements to his workshop.

loans.name: Sandra Jovanna

texts.es:
La señora SANDRA JOVANNA A. O. tiene 24 años, vive en el distrito DE  MOCHE, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. La socia presenta estudios hasta 3ero  de Secundaria, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella. Sandra  se dedica por las mañanas a la venta ambulatoria  de mates filtrantes como: manzanillas, anís, te, menta, coca, etc. y en las tardes se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida como salchipapa, salchipollo, tallarines, arroz chaufa, etc. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró mates filtrantes como: anís, manzanilla, menta, mate de coca, etc. y ahora con su próximo crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de mates filtrantes y de vajilla para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is 24 years old and lives in the De Moche district in the Trujillo province, in the La Libertad department of Peru. She is a member of the San Borja communal bank and has a junior high school education. She is married and has a three year-old son who depends on her for support. In the morning Sandra sells herbal teas, such as chamomile, anis, mint, coca, etc. In the evenings she prepares and sells food, such as sausages, salchipollo (chicken sausage and potatoes), pasta dishes, and chicken and rice dishes. She used the money from her first loan of 300 PEN to buy teas. She will use the money from this loan to buy more herbal teas to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Teas for resale

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora C. is a proud member of ASHI in Mambog center of Rizal Southwest Branch (RSWB). During her membership in ASHI, her performance has been noted to be good in repayment and in attendance in center meetings. She joined ASHI to secure supplementary working funds for her sewing business.

Rhodora hopes to expand her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 17,000 pesos to pay for assorted cotton fabric, and other supplies. She requests this loan through ASHI so that she can support the expansion of her sewing business and be able to meet the growing demands of her customers.

With working capital, Rhodora’s business will continue to grow and she will be able to give satisfactory service to her customers.
