Through the support of ASHI and Kiva, she hopes to witness herself and her family soon changing their quality of living and moving away from under the umbrella of poverty.

Having this loan will allow Rhodora to finally achieve her dreams in life: to have a growing business, to fund the education of her two children, to build a concrete and durable home, and to have a happy family as well.

Rhodora is married to Jeffrey and they are blessed of two minor-aged children. Despite the many challenges in her life, she never gave up fighting against poverty.

loans.use: To pay for assorted of cotton fabrics and other supplies

loans.name: Norma Teofila

texts.es: Norma vende postres como: mazamorra de maíz, arroz con leche y otros dulces en la vía publica al lado de una tienda por donde ella reside, empezó este negocio hace muchos años para solventar los gastos de su familia, además vende comida como: pollo frito cuando lo solicitan sus clientes, su objetivo lograr la  apertura de una tienda y vender por las noches salchipapas y hamburguesas, todo esto le traerá mejores ganancias. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  productos que le hacen falta para la preparación de la comida que vende.
texts.en:
Norma sells desserts such as corn pudding, arroz con leche (a rice dessert) and other sweets on a public road at the side of a store near her home. She started this business many years ago to pay for family expenses. In addition, she sells food such as fried chicken when requested by her customers. Her goal is to open a store where she can sell salchipapas (a meal including sausage and fried potatoes) and hamburgers in the evenings. This would bring her better earnings. She will use this loan to buy products that she needs to prepare the food that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food-selling business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 45-year-old entrepreneur who operates his business in Nairobi, Kenya. He sells shoes retail at a very busy market. He sells his products to area residents and other people who visit the market. He has been in this business for four years. 

Moses is a married man and he is father to three children, ages 7 to 19. He is requesting a first loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of shoes for sale. Moses' loan is guaranteed by the members of his group. He hopes to grow both financially and socially and have a well stocked shoe shop. He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt new business skills that are very helpful in his business. He describes himself as very aggressive and focused.

loans.use: To add stock of shoes

loans.name: Mrs. Savy Khun  Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who make up a village bank loan group live in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. Mrs. Savy K. was selected by all the members as the village bank president. The members will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Savy K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow crops to sell to support her family. Now her problem is that her field is ready to grow but she does not have enough money to support it. So to improve production, she is asking for a loan to grow bananas this year. Her husband, Mr. They Hun, is a construction worker. She is a mother of six children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To grow bananas

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
This loan group consists of four people who live in Chan Lork Village in Kandal Province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose, but all will use it to improve their businesses. 

Mr. Vannak N. has been selected by the other members to be the group leader. He is twenty years old. He is a construction worker and his wife, Mrs. Pharey Yos, is a seamstress in garment factory. His work place is far away from his house, so, to improve the condition of his family, Mr. Vannak N. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorbike for transportation. The couple supports a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Lady Diana

texts.es: La solicitante es madre soltera, vive en la casa de su padre, quien viaja constantemente ya que es chofer. Se dedica a la venta de cervezas y pisco desde hace 2 años, aparte vende productos de belleza de manera indirecta. Esporadicamente vende comida o piqueos para sus clientes que consumen licor. Solicita el credito para compra de mesas, sillas, vitrina y capital de trabajo
texts.en:
Diana is a single mother, who lives at home with his father, he travels constantly because he is a driver. She works selling beer and pisco since she was 2 years old, she also sells beauty products directly. From time to time she also sells food and snacks to the clients that buy beer. She is requesting the loan to buy tables, chairs and working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and working capital

loans.name: Matanat

texts.ru:
Matanat mat 2 detey. Ona jivet v qorode Baku. Ona nachala etot bizness 5 let nazad koqda posle toqo kak umer yeyo muj. Za pervuyu summu kotoruyu videlilo yey Kiva ona ochen blaqodarna chto oni pomoqli yey. 

No teper ona nujdayetya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji.V etom maqazine malo novix tovarov ona xochet razvit svoy maqazin. Na budusheye ona xotelabi chtobi yeyo docheri kototim 10 i 16 let postupili v universiteti ,potomuchto po yeyo slovam ved nikto neznayet chto sluchitsya zavtro pust u nix budet kakaya nibud professiya.
texts.en:
Matanat is a mother of 2 children. She lives in the city of Baku. She started this business 5 years ago after the death of her husband. She is grateful that the first loan she obtained from Kiva helped her. However, she now needs 2000 AZN in order to buy products for resale. This store has a small number of new products, and Matanat wants to expand her store. In the future, she wants her daughters, who are 10 and 16 years old, to go to a universities because, according to her own words, since no one knows what would happen tomorrow, they should have an education.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Ariosto Alcivar

texts.en:
Ariosto Alcivar V. P. is 35 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 3 children, aged 5, 12 and 14, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Ariosto is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Ariosto works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn, wheat, potatoes, tomatoes, beans and peas. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries and tomatoes sell weekly, and other crops once a year.

Ariosto is asking for this loan to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers for his crops. He hopes this credit will help him produce more to be able to repay . He also would like to be able to work in the business of selling animals.  His dream is to enable his children to study and provide them with a better life. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest.

He likes to play indoor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina D. is currently in the business of selling bread, cooking oil and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Regina is 35 years old and is married to a builder. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina J. is 35 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children who all go to school. Sabina is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal and some firewood to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business by stocking bamboo and grass for house building.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal and some firewood

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha A. is from the village of Owaon. She is 35 years old. Editha is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for house materials. Editha is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used for house completion. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Editha from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for house completion

loans.name: Moses Ochieng

texts.en:
Moses Ochieng O. is 43 years old and he supports five members of his family. His spouse is Redempta, who is a business woman and generates an income of about Ksh10,000. Moses is a tailor and he has been doing this business for the last ten years in a busy street in Narok Town.

He learned about KADET from market awareness done by staff within Narok Town. This will be his sixth loan with KADET and he has been paying the subsequent loans on time with no default. He is planning to spend the monies on buying more materials to add to his current stock. From the anticipated profit from the expanded business he anticipates being able to open up another shop in a different street within Narok town. 

His hope and dream is that he will own a house where he can operate his business and educate his children to a higher level. He is a hard working and business oriented man.

loans.use: To buy more materials to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz;  La socia tiene 32 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia  trabaja criando gallinas y chanchos para la venta, la socia los engorda y los vende. Ella trabaja haciendo esto desde hace 4 años y compra animales para el engorde y venta final pasada la madurez. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de tres chanchos y aves de corral.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luz belongs to the Sr. de Tantamarca village bank; the bank is located in the Chicon district in the Urubamba province of the state of Cusco, Peru.

Luz is 32 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has 3 children.  She works raising chickens and pigs to sell.  She raises them, fattens them up and sells them.  She has worked in this field for 4 years; she buys the animals, fattens them up and sells them once they are ready.  She is seeking this loan to buy 3 pigs and some chickens.

She is grateful for the loan she will receive and at the same time, promises to be punctual in repaying it.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 pigs and some chickens

loans.name: Lea  Abigail

texts.es: La Sra. Lea Abigail M. E.  ella es Trabajadora activa del Instituto  público San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Maestra de educación Secundaria tiene  Veinte años de trabajar para el ministerio de educación es casada actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dieciseis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lea Abigail M. E. is employed as a Secondary School Teacher at a public school in San Rafael del Sur.  She has been employed by the Ministry of Education for 20 years.  She’s married and has a school age son.

She has had 16 CEPRODEL loans that have all been used to buy building materials and supplies to make home improvements.  Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for her in that she has been able to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: For cement, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
CLARA LUZ T. C.
La señora clara pertenece al banco comunal El Paraíso. Distrito de manatay,   provincia de coronel portillo departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 67 años de edad, mujer sola que esta sobresaliendo en estos tiempos tan difíciles. Madre de 10 hijos ya con familia cada uno de ellos.
La señora clara viene trabajando con manuela ramos hace 12 años, el mismo tiempo que Tiene su negocio de venta de golosinas, el cual le ha servido como sustento todo este tiempo y lo va haciendo crecer con los préstamos que obtiene de Manuela Ramos cada ciclo.
Con el ultimo préstamo de  s/. 1500 soles que Manuela Ramos le otorgo  va surtir mas su negocio,  comprara  3 cajitas de frugos,  2 cajas de néctar,  una caja de galleta soda, una de vainilla , 5 cajas de gaseosa oro,  3 cajas de cola real, 1 caja de vasos descartables, una bolsa de halls  , 1 bolsa de caramelo de limón, una caja de lentejitas, 2 bolsas de chupetines, una caja de frunas,  2 tiras de maní confitado.
La señora clara está muy agradecida por los préstamo que manuela Ramos le da cada ciclo la forma que ella tiene de agradecerle es siendo puntual con sus pagos de cada mes.
texts.en:
Clara Luz T. C.
Clara belongs to the 'El Paraíso' (Paradise) community bank in Manatay, in Coronel Portillo province, in Ucayali department.  She is 67 years old.  She is a single woman who is doing well in these difficult times.  She is mother to 10 children, each of whom already has a family of their own.

Clara has been working with Manuela Ramos for 12 years, the same amount of time that she has had her business selling sweets.  The business has been a support for her all this time and she has been making it grow with the loans she obtains from Manuela Ramos.

She will use her latest loan from Manuela Ramos for 1,500 soles to better stock her store.  She will buy 3 small crates of Frugos yogurt, 2 crates of nectar, one box of soda (saltine) crackers, one of vanilla, 5 crates of Oro brand soda, 3 crates of Cola Real, 1 box of disposable cups, one bag of Halls, a bag of lemon drops, a box of Lentejitas (an M&M style candy), 2 bags of lollipops, a box of Frunas (Starburst style candies) and 2 boxes of Maní Confitado (a brand of sweetened peanuts).

Clara is very grateful for the loans which Manuela Ramos give her each cycle.  Her shows her gratitude by being punctual with her payments every month.

loans.use: Purchase of Frugos yogurt and soda

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, married with four children, all of whom are still living with her, resides in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the east of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. Ana's community, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from a constant shortage of running water and electricity. As well as Dominicans, Haitian immigrants make up a large proportion of Ana's community.

Ana is a former member of the 'Nueva Esperanza' ('New Hope') 'solidarity bank' (group of borrowers). Because she now requires a larger amount, Ana is requesting an individual loan to buy additional stock for her two-year-old clothing business. She would also like to put a small portion of the loan into a savings account set up with Esperanza International, Kiva's field partner in the Dominican Republic and Haiti.

Ana is very excited about taking out another loan so that she can continue to grow her business. She says that previous loans have made it easier to support her children, and she hopes that will continue with this loan and future ones. Ana says she most enjoys spending time with her children and looking after her house.

loans.use: To invest in stock for her clothing business

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a resident of a city named Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari city is famous for its agricultural industry. She is 37 years old, a talented lady, and she owns & operates her embroidery business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She mainly receives orders from her neighboring areas and earns good income by completing them on time.

Her husband's name is M. R., and he is involved in a poultry business. He supplies chickens to different butcher shops, plus chicken and eggs to different grocery shops, to earn good income. He has been in this business for many years. He has a good name in his region due to his good, quality services.

Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy chicks and chicken feed to further expand his poultry business. Kosar is hopeful that this investment will make a good impact on her husband’s business and help him increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed for her husband's poultry business

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy Y. is a 34-year-old woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. She is married with six children, all of whom are single. Two of her children work in different jobs and they share their salary with her every month. Tuy Y. owns a few farms that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on them. She is currently raising a peanut crop and she estimates that she will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. Her husband helps her to grow crops. Tuy Y. just rented her neighbor's farmland to use for more peanut crops, but she has not yet planted crops on it. Tuy Y. is applying for a loan to pay for the rental of the new land and to hire a machine to plow it. The remainder of the loan will be used for hiring labor to clean grasses in and around her farmland.

loans.use: To help raise peanut crops.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tel les pagnes wax avec la présidente du groupe, Sali B.. 
SALI B.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 35 pagnes wax .
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO et à Bamako .
Les pagnes  wax sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE et à HAMDALLAYE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000 FCFA utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The five members of the SABOUGNOUMA group are married and, on average, are 40 years old and have 3 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in HAMDALLAYE, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali. 

They are on their sixth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans have been repaid properly. 

This group of women sells various items such as "wax pagnes" (colorful traditional fabric) with the group’s president, Sali B.. 

Sali B. intends to buy 35 wax pagnes with her loan. She gets her supplies at the big market in SIKASSO and in Bamako. The wax pagnes are sold for cash at the market in MEDINE, at HAMDALLAYE in Sikasso and within the family to a customer base composed of men and women. 

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 CFA francs that will be used to cover the family’s daily expenses. She aspires to increase her revenue in order to satisfy her customer base.

loans.use: To buy wax pagnes

loans.name: Anne Atabo

texts.en:
Anne Atabo E. is 37 years old and married to Albert Ekidor, who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children ages 8, 10 and 15. They live in Lodwar, Kenya.

Anne operates a food kiosk and she has been in this business for the past three years earning an income of KES 8,000 per month. She was introduced to Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, by a friend and she is applying for her second loan of KES 30,000. With this loan she plans to buy hotel utensils and food stuffs in order to provide a better quality service for her clients.

Anne hopes to operate a big hotel in Lodwar town, and in the future to extend the same services to the city center.

loans.use: To buy hotel utensils and food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Octavio Antonio

texts.es: Octavio tiene 51 años ella se dedica a brindar el servicio carpintería, dio inicio a su negocio hace 29 años, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido de gran provecho para él. La mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan diferentes productos, ya que el siempre esta dedicándose a su trabajo para ofrecer lo mejor de su negocio. El comenzó desde muy joven pues tenía una familia que mantener y como padre responsable inicio este negocio. Este crédito es para la compra pega, clavos, maque, herramientas entre otros.
texts.en:
Octavio is 51 years old and works as a carpenter.  He set up this business 29 years ago.  This is not the first time that he has taken a loan.  They have been very useful to him.  Octavio's customers request different products from him.  He is always working hard in order to provide the best work he can.  He started working at a very young age since he had a family to support and, as a responsible father, he set up this business.

Octavio will use this loan to buy adhesive, nails, lacquer, tools, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Stephan

texts.en:
Stephan M. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Stephan has a welding workshop, which he has had for three years.         

To help expand his business, Stephan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase welding materials for making beds and metallic doors for sale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stephan hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Stephan hopes to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase welding materials for making beds and metallic doors

loans.name: Akou Rose

texts.fr: Dame Rose est âgée de 43  ans et mère  de  2  enfants.   Elle habite  quartier  Awatamé à Adidogomé.  Pour améliorer  les conditions  de vie de ses  enfants,  elle  fait la  vente  de pagnes.  Elle  achète  les pagnes  en gros  et  redistribue en détail  au grand  marché de  Lomé.  Elle a commencé son activité en 2009.  Pour faire face  à la demande  sans cesse  croissante,  elle  sollicite  un prêt.
texts.en: Ms. Rose is 43 years old, and the mother of two children. She lives in the Awatamé district in Adidogomé. To improve the living conditions for her children, she sells pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She buys pagne cloth wholesale and redistributes it retail at the main market of Lomé. She started her business in 2009. To cope with the ever-growing demand, she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: Buying traditional fabrics

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
Julia Beatriz  C. C. tiene 52 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Julia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de corral. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar la educación a los hijos para que sean profesionales.

Le gusta que los créditos hayan servido para comprar lo necesario y que sigan apoyando de esta manera.
texts.en:
Julia Beatriz C. C. is 52 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Calzado Solidario” gather in the precinct of Calzado in the canton of San Miguel, which is located thirty minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. This Communal Bank consists of twelve members who grow short cycle crops such as corn, potatoes, and beans, as well as raise poultry and cattle.

Julia is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes, beans, and raises poultry. She buys her supplies at the market in San Miguel each week and then sells at the fair in San Miguel on Thursdays.

Julia is requesting a loan to buy seeds for planting crops and feed for her animals. The support from this loan will help her financially so that she can acquire what she needs. Her challenges are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. She dreams of providing her children with an education so that they can become professionals.

Julia likes the fact that the loans have helped her buy necessities and continue supporting her in this manner.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for planting and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
El señor Alejo es originario y vecino de la localidad de Francisco Serrato perteneciente al Estado de Michoacán, esta población con unos paisajes hermosos lleno de pinos, donde su principal actividad económica es la artesanía de ocochal, y la compra y venta de animales. Don Alejo cuenta con 43 años de edad comenta que él no estudio porque sus papás no tenían los recursos para mandarlo a la escuela, por eso desde muy pequeño empezó a trabajar para poder ayudar con los gastos de su casa, cuando se caso tuvo que emigrar por varios años a la ciudad de México a la central de abastos como cargador, dice que es un trabajo muy pesado por eso se tuvo que regresar a su pueblo y empezó a invertir en el negocio de compra, cría y venta de borregos, caballos y vacas y así estar más al pendiente de su familia, el empezó con su negocio hace 10 años, él vende sus animales en el mercado de abastos en zitacuaro, y a veces los vende en su misma localidad. Don Alejo pidió a Fundación Realidad su préstamo invertir en borregos para criarlos y después venderlos. Su necesidad es sacar adelante a sus 10 hijos aunque no todos viven con él,  pero los que viven con él estudian y tiene que darles para la escuela y sus pasajes. 
Don Alejo vive en unión libre con la señora María Juana que se dedica a la  hechura de servilletas, y al hogar. Su meta en especial es comprarse una camioneta grande para vender sus animales en otros lugares. Dice que con las ganancias que le queden de la venta de los animales invertirá y comprara mas borregos y les comprara alimento, vacunas y desparacitantes para que crezcan bonitos y venderlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Alejo is a native and resident of the Francisco Serrato area, which belongs to the State of Michoacán. It has beautiful scenery filled with pines and their main businesses are crafts made from ocochal and the purchase and sale of animals.

Alejo is 43 years old and he comments that he did not go to school because his parents could not afford to send him there. As a result, he began to work when he was very young in order to help with household expenses. When he got married, he had to move to Mexico City for several years to work as a loader at the wholesale food market. He says that it was very hard work, which is why he had to return to his town where he began investing in the business of buying, raising and selling sheep, horses and cows and thus be more aware of his family. He started this business ten years ago and he sells his animals at the market in Zitacuaro and sometimes in his own town.

Alejo requested a loan from Fundación Realidad to invest in sheep to raise and then sell. He needs to get his ten children ahead in life, although not all of them live with him. However, those that do live with him study and he has to provide them with money for school and their transportation fees.

Alejo has a common-law marriage with María Juana who works making napkins and works at home. His goal is to buy a large truck to sell his animals in other places. He says that he will invest his earnings from the animal sales and he will buy more sheep, feed, vaccines and antiparasitics so that they grow well and he can sell them at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy sheep to sell

loans.name: Nancy Judith

texts.es: Nancy tiene 26  años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de padres  con su hija pequeña. Reside en una zona urbana en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz cerca de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el norte de Perú. Su comunidad es pequeña y está en vías de crecimiento. Se dedica a la venta de comida como hamburguesas, anticuchos, brochetas y pancitas. Ejerce esta actividad por las noches desde hace más de 2 años. Su punto de venta es en su vivienda. Con su préstamo, Nancy comprará otro carrito sanguchero, una especie de carreta que viene equipada con todas las herramientas para cocinar su comida. Esto la ayudará a ampliar su negocio y por consiguiente mejorará sus ingresos. Su mayor anhelo para su negocio es un día construir un restaurante donde venda todo tipo de comida. Nancy goza de muy buenas referencias personales y laborales manifestadas por vecinos y amigos.
texts.en: Nancy is 26 years old and she is single. She lives at home with her parents and her little girl.  She lives in an urban region of the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, near the city of Chiclayo in the northern part of Peru. Her community is small but it is starting to develop. She sells prepared foods such as hamburgers, kebabs, brochettes, and stew. For the past two years she has opened for business in the evenings. She makes her sales from her house. With her loan, Nancy will purchase a sandwich cart, a type of food stand that is equipped with all kinds of cooking tools to prepare her foods. This will help her expand her business, and in turn, this will increase her income. Her greatest dream is to build a restaurant one day from where she would sell all types of foods. Nancy has many good personal and work-related references set forth by neighbors and friends.

loans.use: to purchase a food cart to prepare foods that she sells

loans.name: Talie

texts.en:
Talie, a 37-year-old single man living in Chtoura, owns a grocery shop where he has been selling food products, cleaning products and toys since 2007. He enjoys a good reputation for the quality and price of his products and is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua to buy new ones in order to keep meeting his customers’ needs.

Talie works hard on achieving customer satisfaction and hopes to open a new branch in the future. He also aspires to having a small family for whom he’ll be able to provide happiness and a healthy living.

loans.use: to buy new products.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal San José, vive en la comunidad de Inga Pirca que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta  Parroquia es de clima frió, sus bellos paisajes reflejan la belleza natural del sector y desde el centro de la parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy trabajadora, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 57 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 31, 28, 26 y 24 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados e independientes, su último hijo trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en su hogar, tambien cría y vende animales como chanchos, ganado y borregos a los que los vende en su propia comunidad. Trabaja en la agricultura pero lo que siembra es solo para su consumo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 12 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y en su alimento.

Su meta es tener mas ganado para la crianza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is a member of the communal bank "San Jose". She lives in the community of Inga Pirca, belonging to the Santa Ana sector. This is known to be a cold climate sector and it is known for the beautiful scenery of natural beauty and from the downtown of the sector a large part of the city of Cuenca can be admired. The population is very hard working and they maintain their culture and their traditions.

Maria is 57 years old, married, and she has 4 children, aged 31, 28, 26, and 24. Her first three children are married and independent. Her youngest child works and he contributes financially. Her husband works in the field of construction and with their combined effort they have managed to build a house of their own.

Maria takes care of the household chores and she also raises and sells livestock, including pigs, cattle, and sheep. She sells them in her own community. She works in agriculture but what she cultivates is for their consumption.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and livestock feed.

loans.name: Muniran's Group

texts.en:
Muniran is 55 years old, married and has a son. She was not able to provide an education to her son due to financial constraints. He is an embroidery expert now and helps his father in his decorative embroidery business.
Muniran is a housewife who stays at home to take care of her household tasks. She is still very active and completes her daily tasks efficiently. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her son’s embroidery business because he wants to start a business independently. With the loan, he will buy colored thread, patterns and cloth to make embroidered dresses to meet customer demand and earn more profits. Muniran is confident that an investment will help him start a profitable business.
Muniran is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and has never missed any meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Muniran.

loans.use: to buy colored thread, patterns and cloth for her son's embroidery business.

loans.name: Yasha

texts.en: Yasha is engaged in an agricultural business. He keeps livestock and has agro machinery. Agriculture is the family’s main source of income, but it is not enough to cover the Yasha family’s daily costs. With the requested loan he plans to increase livestock, develop agriculture further, and increase income. Yasha is desperate to improve the living conditions of his family. He lives together with his wife and son.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: Izakahle Group

texts.en:
Happiness is 47 years old, married with 5 children who are between ages 14 and 32. One of her children attends school. She earns income from the government’s child support grant. She also receives income from her husband who works for Capacity Company in Richard's Bay.

In the photo above, she is raising up her hand, wearing a white shirt. She’s been in business for the past 2 years and sells perfumes, snacks and clothes from her home.

Happiness requested this loan through WDB and KIVA to buy perfumes, snacks and clothes for resale. She says that the main challenge to her business is customers that buy on credit and fail to pay on time. In five years time she would like to have her own space in town to work properly.

She appreciates WDB and Kiva for helping her with this loan which has low interest.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, snacks and clothes.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a young woman living in the Jabalia Refugee Camp in the Gaza Strip. Reem is married and a mother of one son. 

She took out a loan from FATEN in order to expand her grocery store and to add frozen meat and vegetables to the items she sells in the store. She especially wants to do this since her grocery store is located in a privileged location of the Jabalia Refugee Camp. This loan will help Reem attract more clients and have a better income. 

Reem is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed in her place. 

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. 

FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. 

As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending information at http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy more goods and frozen foods for her grocery store

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura, tiene la edad de 32 años, está casada, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de las semillas y insumos para las hortalizas. Ella quiere sembrar estos productos para el autoconsumo y la venta a nivel de la localidad. Ella quiere dejar de tener que comprar estos alimentos un comercios para así lograr quitar un gasto de su hogar al ella poderlas producir. Con las ganancias ella tiene como meta ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y así poder tener un nivel de vida mejor y sin preocupaciones. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Laura is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her two children and her husband, who are her top priority.

With the loan, she intends to buy seeds and supplies for growing vegetables. She wants to grow these items for personal use and to sell in the town. Laura wants to stop having to buy these foods so she can get rid of a household expense since she will be able to produce the foods herself. Her goal for her earnings is to help her husband with household expenses so they can have a better, worry-free lifestyle.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has never had loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales:  corn, chicken, oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 51 years old, and she lives with her husband and her five children.Two of them are already married and two are working abroad. Her youngest is in the secondary level of education, while her husband is responsible for cultivating their rice farm. She has been engaged in vending vegetables and a hog raising business for two years.She glad because she earns about P3,000 monthly doing this kind of business. She uses her income in paying their electric bill, allowances for the children and for their daily needs.

Josefina would like to put up small stall in front of her house so that she will no longer offer her vegetables on a house to house basis. She is hoping that she can increase the profit she generates from the business she manages. To make her dreams fulfilled she is requesting a loan amounting to P5,000 to purchase vegetables such as squash, eggplant,  string beans and feed for the pigs. This amount could really help her a lot, most especially in attaining her dreams in life and business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as squash, eggplant,  string beans and feed for the pigs to be raised

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Perlita has a shop that makes and sells hot dogs and home-made sausage like chorizzo and longganisa. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausage.  Perlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Perlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingrdients needed for making home-made sausage

loans.name: Sreynin

texts.en:
Sreynin is a garment worker. Her husband, Sophal, is a wood deliveryman. He buys wood and then delivers it to customers who have businesses that require wooden materials. 

The couple lives along National Road No. 5, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two young children, a son and a daughter.

Sreynin is applying for a loan of $1,000 to help her brother to buy a motorbike and trailer to carry wood for sale.

loans.use: To help her brother to buy motorbike and trailer to carry wood for sale.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Monalisa buys and peddles clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON.

Monalisa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Monalisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando, de 40 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, esta casado con Teodosia de 38 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 03 hijos. Juntos habitan en su propia casa, ubicada en el distrito de Samugari. Los continuos días de trabajo que tiene Armando en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva un gran conocedor de la agricultura, sus plantas de cacao, yuca y plátano, están bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de ellos en los distintos centros de acopio de su ciudad. Tiene 20 años realizando ésta actividad y cuando debe cosechar y sacar la maleza de sus plantas, es su familia quien más la apoya en estas labores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar plátano, pues es un fruto que le genera más ingresos y cada cosecha lo realiza mensualmente, sin embargo lo más difícil es transportarlos de la chacra hasta la comunidad caminando dutante una hora. Con el tiempo espera comprar su propia moto para transportar sus frutos. Este será su primer crédito y esta muy contento de  saber que tendrá el apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su proyecto planeado. Con el crédito solicitado comprará mas plantas de plátano ya que cuenta con espacios suficientes para cultivar.
texts.en:
Armando, 40, is a cheerful, hardworking man.  He’s married to Teodosia, 38, and they have three children.  They live together in their own house located in Samugari District.

Armando’s continuous days of work in the fields have made him a very knowledgeable farmer.  His cocoa bean, manioc and banana plants are well cared for and he always gets good sale prices for them in the city’s various gathering centers.  He’s been in this line of work for 20 years and when he has to do weeding or harvesting his family members are his greatest helpers.  What he most enjoys about his work is farming bananas because it’s the fruit that generates the highest profits and harvesting occurs monthly.  However, what’s difficult is transporting them from his field to the community, a walk that takes an hour.  In time, he hopes to buy his own motorcycle to transport the fruit.

This will be his first loan and he’s very happy to know that he will have support from all of you because he’ll feel secure that he'll make progress with his planned project that way.  He will use the requested funds to buy more banana plants because he has enough space available for them to grow.

loans.use: to buy banana plants.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; La socia tiene 23 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene 2 hijos; La socia  se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ella tiene terrenos agrícolas en los cuales siembra y cosecha maíz blanco, la socia vende su producción y también se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores al socia cría gallinas y cuyes, ella desea en esta ocasión invertir su préstamo en la compra de animales menores como cuyes en un numero de 50 y gallinas 10 para la cría y la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de gallinas y de cuyes.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank “Imasumac II.” The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. 

The borrower is Marina. She is 23 years old and single; she has two children. Marina mainly works in agriculture. She has farmland where she plants and harvests white corn. She sells her product, and she also breeds small animals, hens and guinea pigs. She would like to invest her loan into the purchase of small animals like 50 guinea pigs and 10 hens to breed and sell. Marina asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of hens and guinea pigs. 

Marina is thankful for the loan and promises to comply with the terms of the agreement according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy hens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Carmen vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Carmen es la venta de golosinas al por mayor. Ella reparte sus productos a diferentes tiendas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Carmen requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo golosinas, galletas, chocolates y otras cosas más. 

Carmen agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “San José de Urubamba” which is located in the city of Urubamba. The members of this Communal Bank conduct their meetings every 30 days in the city of Urubamba in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Carmen lives in the city of Urubamba, which is where she conducts her business activities. Her main business is selling sweets in bulk. She delivers her products to different stores. Carmen has been in this business for several years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy more merchandise such as candy, cookies, chocolates, and other products.

Carmen appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy candy, cookies, chocolates, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 49-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one child. He has owned a small garage in his town since 1985, where he provides car painting services. His wife has worked in a local pharmacy since 1990 in order to augment the family’s income. Today, he is asking to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., to buy painting products and materials so that he can better serve his customers.  In the future, he plans to open a bigger garage.

loans.use: To buy painting products and materials so that he can better serve his customers

loans.name: Nasinani Group

texts.en:
Thomas is the facilitator of the Nasinani group. Thomas and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Thomas takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Thomas had a very good maize yield harvesting nine bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Thomas was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Thomas and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Thomas will educate his children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Nasinani group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Thomas is pictured with his group members and the field officer is at the far left.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Abdurashit

texts.ru: Абдурашит житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Abdurashit lives in Tursun-zoda. He is 36 years old, married, and has four children. He provides a taxi service. He has a wealth of experience in this field. He is taking out a loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Daniel Alexander

texts.es:
Daniel Alexander tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con el papá y la mamá  en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Daniel se dedica a la agricultura deseando obtener un mejor producto. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para obtener una mejor agricultura, compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá tener un mejor estilo de vida. Los desafíos que se le ha presentado es la falta de dinero para comprar los insumos y abonos. En el tiempo libre le gusta las festividades del carnaval y semana santa.


Con la ayuda del crédito anterior pudo comprar semillas, abonos agrícolas. La relación familiar ha mejorado con el producto cosechado que se pudo vender a un buen precio que es favorable para el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Daniel Alexander, 19, is single and has no children.  He lives with his mother and father in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.

He is a member of the “Ventanal” communal bank which is formed in the community of Guantuncoto in Julio Moreno Canton, Guaranda, 30 minutes away from the office.  The residents of this community carry out a variety of activities like: farming, cattle raising, animal husbandry (pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce and construction.

Daniel is a farmer wanting to obtain a better product.  His purchases and sales take place in Guaranda.  He requests the loan to improve his crops.  He will buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and urea.

With help from the loan he will be able to have a better standard of living.  The challenge he’s faced has been the lack of money to buy supplies and manure.  In his spare time he enjoys the festivities of Carnival and Holy Week.

With help from the previous loan he was able to buy seeds and farming manure.  His family relationship has improved because he was able to sell his harvested goods for a good price which benefitted the family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and urea.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 34-year-old, widowed mother of three children.

For six years, she has operated a clothing sales business, from which she earns a monthly income of approximately 10,000 KES. She is now applying for her fourth loan through KADET, this time in the amount of 80,000 KES. She explains that she promptly and successfully repaid her previous loans. She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the loan proceeds to buy new clothes for re-sale purposes and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Akuavi Françoise

texts.fr: Agée de 41 ans, Françoise est mariée et mère de  quatre enfants. Elle a une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des liqueurs, boissons en cannette et des céréales. Elle a sollicité un financement auprès de Finadev en vue d'accroître son stock et de maximiser son profit pour le bonheur de la famille.
texts.en: Françoise is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She owns a store in which she sells liquor, canned drinks, and cereals. She is seeking a loan with Finadev with the goal of increasing her stock and maximizing her profit for her family's happiness.

loans.use: To buy fifty 5-kg bags of rice, 20 boxes of drinks, 20 bottles of gin, and other items.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.es: Patrocina, de 44 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su conviviente German de 56 años y sus 2 querido hijas Janeth de 19 y Nelly de 15 años de edad, quienes son el impulso de todos sus esfuerzos. Patrocinia, con el apoyo y el entusiasmo que le brindaron su familia decidió poner su restaurante en el Distrito de Kimbiri ya que le ayudaron a organizar y tener una persona que le ayude con los mandados y la atención a los clientes. Por la buena sazón que tiene logró tener sus pensionistas fijos; viene trabajando 05 años en este negocio. Para ella su restaurante es el sueño cumplido de tener el negocio propio; porque depende de ella que su puesto surja hacia delante y ver que su negocio tenga buena concurrencia. Se siente muy emociona a pesar que siempre termina bien cansada, pero ella siempre dice que todo sacrificio tiene una buena remuneración. Con el tiempo desea tener su propio local y que sea más amplio para que así pueda hacer los arreglos necesarios para que sus clientes tengan un buen habitad donde puedan sentirse y alimentarse a gusto. Este es el crédito numero 19  con MFP, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por que recibe toda las facilidades, es muy puntual en e l pago de su cuota. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que es muy solidaria. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, adquirirá más víveres para brindar mejor alimentación  a sus consumidores.
texts.en: Patrocina, who is 44 years old, is a very cheerful and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with German, her live-in partner who is 56 years old, and her two beloved daughters.  Janeth is 19 years old, and Nelly is 15 years old.  Her daughters are the motivation for all of her efforts.  Patrocinia, with her family's support and enthusiasm, decided to open her restaurant in the District of Kimbiri since they helped her to get organized and find a person that helps her with the errands and attending to customers.  Because of the good seasoning that she has, she has obtained regular customers.  She has been working for 5 years in this business.  For her, it is a dream come true to have her own restaurant.  This is because it is her duty to make sure that her job continues to develop and to see to it that her business has good attendance.  She feels very excited in spite of always ending up very tired.  She always says that all the sacrifice has a good outcome.  In time, she wants to have her own business location that is larger so that she can make the necessary arrangements for her customers to have a good location where they can feel and dine at ease.  This is her 19th loan with MFP.  She is very grateful to the institution because she receives all the support.  She is very punctual in the payment of her dues.  In her communal bank, she is a very beloved member since she is very supportive.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy more supplies to make her food better for her customers.

loans.use: to buy products like meat, beans, and vegetables for food preparation.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a thirty-four-year-old hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a retail shop business and also a farming business. He started these businesses to earn a living. His main challenge is high rate of defaulters and price fluctuations though he hopes to increase his profits. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land to increase the acreage of his farm.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to increase the acreage of his farm.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica sells clothes, school supplies and various items for the home from a store she established in her parents’ house. When she was only 4 years old, Jessica began selling small items in the streets around her house and in the Bahia, a market in the center of Guayaquil. At the age of 16, starting with only $1 worth of merchandise, she began to save up and was finally able to open the storefront 7 years ago.

With a loan she hopes to be able to buy more merchandise and take advantage of the increase in demand around the Christmas season. If she does well, her goal is to add new products to the business and buy display cases that better show off what she has to sell. Jessica is 28 years old and unmarried. She lives with her family and says that they’ve managed to keep going because they all work together and share the same goals of improving their business and their home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: With a loan she hopes to be able to buy more merchandise and take advantage of the increase in demand around the Christmas season.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 38 year old woman with five children who specializes in sale of provisions and foodstuffs to the public. This is a business she started 2 years ago. She requests a $500 loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. runs a small store in a tiny coastal village. This store helps provide for her husband Cornelio and her two young daughters Emily (4) and Melissa (3). Most of the people in Maria's village do not have a way to get into the main town to buy the staples of life such as flour, diapers, or filtered water, so her small stand is a great asset to her community. Maria's store sells a little bit of everything from rice to razors. With this loan, Maria will be able to better stock her store adding items such as condensed milk, spices, and sweets to her inventory.

NOTE: This $900 loan will fund Maria's business plus four others in her community. She and four additional entrepreneurs have formed a solidarity group, part of a Bank of Hope they call "Llamada de Amor" that received business training from Esperanza and will be responsible for paying back this loan together as they develop their respective businesses. This group-lending methodology fosters accountability among the members because they all must pay in full and on time.

loans.use: Purchase cartons of milk, bulk inventory of rice and sugar, diapers, feminine projects and shaving supplies.

loans.name: Tuvalu

texts.en:
Tuvalu is a middle-aged woman of thirty-four with five children, who works hard for her family's living. Her household consists of her husband, the five children and herself. With his support, everything is easy as their five children attend school. For a business, Tuvalu does baking. She believes, baking is a talent from God. In addition to that, it provides for daily necessities.

Tuvalu received a previous loan from S.P.B.D and she used it to buy materials needed and promote her business. Her praises and thanks go to S.P.B.D for approving her loan because many things would’ve been impossible without it.

loans.use: further develop micro-business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married and her husband is a chauffeur. They have 3 children. She decided to start her own business because her older daughter was ill and she could not cover the costs of her medication and their living expenses. At the time, she had no job and was unable to obtain one due to the scarcity of jobs available. It has been more than a year and a half that Yolanda has had her own business, initially selling clothes and later on, added quilts, with which she was able to improve their family's income after pooling hers with her husband's salary. Currently, she has a dependable customer base, who in turn, recommend her to their friends. She is proud of her business.

Yolanda seeks a loan for $475 to buy more merchandise and fashionable clothes to increase her business's inventory and grow her business. She will repay the loan in 3 months. She and her family are grateful for your support that allows her to keep her business continuing.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda esta casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer, ellos tienen 3 hijos, ella decidió poner su negocio por que la mayor de sus hijas se enfermo y no podían solventar los gastos de la casa y médicos, y como ella no tenía empleo y no podía conseguir debido a lo escasos que son los empleos entonces decidió poner su propio negocio hace mas de año y medio empezando con la venta de ropa y luego adicionó edredones, con lo que ya empezó a tener mejores ingresos para así poder colaborar con los gastos a su esposo, ella actualmente ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes, quienes a su vez la recomiendan entre sus amistades y ella esta orgullosa de sus ventas.

Yolanda solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para poder comprar mercadería para su negocio y así tener un mayor surtido y ropa de temporada para sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo brindado para continuar con su negocio y poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman I. is a 37-year-old widower who has one child. He lives in the Salyan region, in Khaladj village. He has 8 years of experience in farming, and needs a loan of $1200 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 23 years old. He lives in the south of Lebanon, in the Saida region. Mohamad owns a grocery shop from which he provides for his family, his wife and child. In order to have two income sources, Mohamad also sells coal. He needs $1000 to buy merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.use: Mohamad would like to buy merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en: Elham is a 37-year-old mother of 3. She lives with her family in Aley. She helps to support her family by creating embroidery work on an instrument called "A. nol." This is the fist time Elham is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua, because she needs to buy materiA. for her business.

loans.use: To buy material for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. is a mother of 9 children, 49 years old and married. She sells cooked food and drinks; she learned this business for 3 months and started hers in 2005. She solicits a loan of $525 to buy more food items and drinks to sell. She is thanking Kiva in advance for the loan.

loans.use: To buy food items and more drinks for sale

loans.name: Mukuba North E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Justine N.. She is currently in the business of selling rice and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Justine is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is an engineer for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 11 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Justine makes approximately UGX 4000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land. Justine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Justine is joined in her small group by Rashid A., Annet B. ,Salima B. and Fatuma K.. Rashida A. has a business in clothes and shoe sales and wants to add more capital. Salima B. is currently operating a business selling tomatoes and wants a loan to purchase in bulk. Fatuma K. operates a business in charcoal sales and wants to expand and become a wholesale seller. Annet B. is a tailor and wants to purchase a sewing machine with the loan.

loans.use: To add in rice business and expand it

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao Y. and her husband married in 1985. They have six children: one son and five daughters. Three of their daughters work in a garment factory, the son is a construction worker, and other two children are in school. The family live in an old house about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sreymao and her husband work in a brick kiln in the village. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to repair her house.

loans.use: For repairing the house

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Art figures are made from bronze, stome or wood. This business needs persistent, as shown by Siti B.. Siti has been in this Art Figure sales for 4 years, and she is grateful that until now her business is still there. The consumers who buy Siti's art figures are from Jakarta, and almost every month order art figures in large quantities. Because of good quality some were even exported. Siti likes to increase her business capaital. She hopes this loan could be used to add business capital. The obtained profit from her sales is enough to meet household needs, together with husband Adol Kadir who is in sales profession too.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Patung arca identik dengan perunggu, batu dan kayu. Usaha ini perlu ketekunan seperti yang dilakukan oleh Siti B.. Sudah 4 tahun Siti menekuni usaha jual arca dan Siti sangat bersyukur karena sampai saat ini usahanya masih bertahan. Konsumen yang biasanya mengambil arca Siti berasal dari Jakarta dan hampir tiap bulan memesan arca dalam jumlah yang besar. Karena kualitasnya bagus, biasanya arca ini bahkan ada yang di ekspor. Karena usaha ini dirasa memiliki prospek, Siti sangat ingin menambah modal usaha. Diharapkan, dari pinjaman kali ini bisa dijadikan tambahan modal usaha. Keuntungan yang didapat dari hasil usahanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya bersama suaminya Adol Kadir yang berprofesi sebagai pedagang.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Pua

texts.en: Pua L., 43, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the fish business. She sells to the villagers and the general public 3 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 550 Tala (~229 USD).  SPBD loans are Pua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will also help her with her many family obligations. Her husband does the fishing duty.

loans.use: To help with business upgrading, house repair, and her children's education

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Mr. Han M., 24, is a young farmer; he also sells wood that he chops from the forest. He sells the wood around the area and makes about $3 per day. He lives with his brother in Beung Veal Village, Pursat Province. He wants to expand his business to increase his income, so he is asking for a loan to purchase two buffalos to use for his business. The loan will allow him to improve his income and living conditions. In the future he will take another loan to purchase a grinding machine.

loans.use: To purchase two buffalos to use for his business

loans.name: El Aguila Group

texts.es:
Hello, we are the AGUILA group and we are situated in the village of Redonda. We have known each other for a very long time and have always worked together. Our activities are: Maria M.: I am a trader and have a small general store at my home. I have one son who is in 6th grade at school.
Albertina D.: she is also a trader and counts on a small general store located at her house. She is an elderly lady and her children are all married, but she one granddaughter who she helps with her studies. 
Amilcar S.: the activity of Don Amilcar is trade – he has a general store situated at the centre of the community.
Carina Naira: she is a trader and has a traveling sales business selling clothes and cosmetics which she also distributes by special order and has been doing this for a number of years.
The rest of us have worked hard to get ahead in our businesses and with our families, and thanks to the support we are requesting, we will be able to meet our familial obligations and as such improve our quality of life. Thank you. 

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.



hola nosotros somo el grupo el AGUILA, estamos ubicados en la aldeda Redonda, tenemos mucho tiempo de conocernos y siempre hemos trabajado juntos.
nuestras actividades son:
Maria M.: soy comerciante cuanto con una pequeña pulperia ubiocada en mi casa de habitacion tengo un hijo que esta cursando el 6to grado.

Albertina D.: ella es comerciante tambien cuenta con una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, ella es de la tercera edad, Sus hijos todos estan casados, solo tiene una nieta a la que ayuda en sus estudios.

Amilcar S.: la actividad de don amilcar es el comercio, el cuenta con una pulperia que esta ubicada en el centro de nuestra comunidad.

Carina Naira: ella es comerciante, cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, cosmeticos, las que distribuye de manera ambulante y por encargo, ella tiene varios años de ejercer esta actividad.

nosotros hemos trabajado fuerte para salir adelante con nuestros negocios y nuestra famila, y gracias al apoyo que estamos solicitando podremos atender nuestras obligaciones con nuestras familias y asi mejorar nuestra calidad de vida.
gracias

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for general stores and clothes sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase second-hand furniture and household goods, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Davri

texts.ru: Муродова Даври жительница района Вахдат. Возраст  45 лет,замужем , имеет  3 детей.Образование среднее.Клиентка из  дома торгует продуктами питания.Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи.Так как муж клиентки временно не работает. На кредит клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Davri M. lives in Vakhdat region. She is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. She is a high school graduate. Davri has a home-based food retail business, which is her family’s only income. Davri’s husband is currently unemployed. Davri would like to obtain a loan in order to increase the assortment of goods she sells. She plans to repay the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Rosas Blancas” pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace mas de tres años cumpliendo con seis  ciclos de crédito, esta se encuentra en la zona de Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 15 socias que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto al trabajo del centro. 
Además de dedicarse al comercio, podemos afirmar que la artesanía es la actividad principal de este grupo, produciendo así, tejidos de aguayo, (tejido nativo hilado a mano) que los comercializan en la feria 16 de julios de la ciudad de El Alto y también a pedido a la tiendas artesanales de la ciudad de La Paz; otra singular actividad es la fabricación de miniaturas; desde pequeños productos de consumo hasta billetitos de distintos valores, estos son comercializados en ferias especiales, como también los venden a pedido. Necesitan de mayor capital para ampliar sus talleres y comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima de esta manera sus ganancias serian mayores, para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The “Rosas Blancas” [White Roses] Association has been part of the Pro-Mujer family for more than three years, fulfilling six credit cycles. The association is located in the Villa Exaltación zone of the city of El Alto. Right now there are 15 active members who have demonstrated themselves to be organized in working as a group.

In addition to selling products, we can see that craftwork is the principal activity of this group, producing 'aguayo' weavings (woven using a handspun natural fiber) that they sell in the 16 de Julio craft market in the city of El Alto, and also by order to craft stores in La Paz. Another special activity is the making miniature replicas, from very small consumer products to “billetitos” [miniature money] of various denominations. These products are sold in special craft fairs and also sold by order. The association needs more capital to expand their workshops and purchase a larger quantity of raw material. In this way their earnings will be greater as will be the economic stability of their households.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need increased capital to expand their workshops and purchase a larger quantity of raw materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Huancavelica Nº 457, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 59 años D. edad, es madre D. 6 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja en la Municipalidad D. Coronel Portillo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. comida. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio D. alquiler D. habitaciones, brindando hospicio a todas las personas que lo necesitan. Este negocio le brinda grandes ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará un ciento D. madera, 6 latas D. pintura, clavos, todo para la infraestructura D. sus habitaciones. 

Gracias a Manuela Ramos, su negocio ha crecido. Agradece a Dios por todas las cosas buenas que le han pasado en la vida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the "La Positiva" community bank, located at Jr. Huancavelica Nº 457, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, in the Ucayali department. She is a 59 year old mother of 6 grown children. She is married to her husband who works for the city of Coronel Portillo. With the first loan of 300 soles which she received from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in food sales. She has been working with the community bank for 5 years. Currently she has a business renting rooms, giving lodging to all who require it. This business gives her plenty of profit to pay her loan on time. With this 1,500 sol loan, which she will repay in 5 month, she will purchase 100 soles of wood, 6 cans of paint, nails, and everything needed for the infrastructure of the rooms. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, her business has grown. She thanks God for all of the good things that have happened to her in her life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, paint, nails, etc.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny Sokunthea is 30 years old and lives in Kandal Province. She has been a fish seller since 2000. Everyday she gets up in early morning and goes to the fish wholesale market to purchase supplies of fish and sell them in the retail marketplace to earn income. She currently earns a profit of approximately $10 per day which she uses to meet the family's food needs. She is married and has three children, all of whom are still young. Her husband, San Soaphorn, 38, is also a fish seller and works with her. As fish sales are the main source of their family income, Sokunthea and Soaphorn decided to request a loan to purchase more fish and increase their sales.

loans.use: To purchase more fishes for resale

loans.name: Sayad Jan Aaqa Group

texts.en:
Sauad Jan S. N. is the group leader of Sayadjan group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive a small loan for his/her business.

Zakara and Sauad Jan S. want to take a loan for purchasing tailoring materials for their businesses. Nadara wants to take a loan for her fruit cart business. And Marzya wants to take a loan for electric equipment for her husband’s shop. They all want to expand their businesses so they can progress, and they are really happy with these loans that can support one to expand her/her business.

They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor people in this country.

loans.use: to expand and enlarge their businesses

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo R. está muy agradecido con todos ustedes por el gran apoyo que recibió en el préstamo anterior. Su negocio ha crecido bastante ya que es la fuente de ingresos de el y su esposa.
