  Está solicitando su cooperación para este nuevo crédito ya que desea invertirle al negocio mercancía de Carnes y lácteos, ya que sus clientes se lo están solicitando que tenga estos productos. Así tendrá más ingresos a su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfredo Rodriguez is really grateful with all of you for the great support you gave him for his previous loan. His business has really grown, as it is his and his wife's source of income. He is asking for your cooperation for this new loan because he wants to invest in the business of meat and diary products, since his customers are asking for these products. This way he will have more revenue for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar Mercancía

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La señora Isabel Cristina habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos, su esposo trabaja  y la apoya con los gastos del hogar, ya que tiene dos hijos a su cargo, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar ya que actualmente vive con su mamá, doña Isabel se dedica al comercio  en la venta de cosmético y otros productos, las ganancias son factibles ya que ha logrado captar clientes vende por encargo y siempre tiene mercadería que vende al contado y al crédito, con esta solicitud va a comprar cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and children. Her husband works and supports her with the household expenses since they have two children to care for. Their future plans are to improve their living conditions at their home since at the present they live with her mom. Dona Isabel sells cosmetics and other products. Her earnings are good because she has been able to get customers and always has merchandise available. She accepts cash and credit. With this application, she will be able to buy more cosmetics to increase her inventory and offer them to her customers.

.La señora Isabel Cristina habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos, su esposo trabaja y la apoya con los gastos del hogar, ya que tiene dos hijos a su cargo, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar ya que actualmente vive con su mamá, doña Isabel se dedica al comercio en la venta de cosmético y otros productos, las ganancias son factibles ya que ha logrado captar clientes vende por encargo y siempre tiene mercadería que vende al contado y al crédito, con esta solicitud va a comprar cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cosmetics products

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro inició el negocio por la necesidad de progresar en un estado que no es el de el y ante las pocas oportunidades que se le presentaron en su momento, fue que decidio emprender su propio negocio en  mayo del 2007. Comenzó vendiendo refrescos y botanas solamente, pero se ha esforzado mucho para mantener su negocio y ahora vende productos de canasta básica, de limpieza, tiene videojuegos y esta pensando en un futuro contar tambien con la venta de  carnes frías o bien una carnicería.


El necesita un prestamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 5 meses para  adquirir  mercancía que le permitirá tener un mayor inventario y tener todo lo necesario para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ramiro started his business because he needed to get by in a state that is not his own, and due to the very limited opportunities he was faced with at that moment, decided to begin his own business in May of 2007. He began selling soft drinks and snacks only, but he struggled hard to keep his business and now sells staple goods, cleaning products, and video games. He is thinking of selling meat, or even having a butcher's shop.

Ramiro needs this loan, which he will pay back in five months, to buy merchandise that will allow him to have a greater inventory and have everything he needs for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to increase his inventory

loans.name: Salif Richard

texts.fr: Monsieur Salif Richard A. est un électricien bobineur qui habite au quartier Mbour 1 de Thiès, une ville à 70km de Dakar. Il est marié et a 45ans et a commencé son métier d’électricien bobineur depuis plus de 20 ans. Il travaille avec des entreprises  et des particuliers, et il a déjà contacté des prêts qu’il a remboursés normalement. Avec ce prêt il veut acheter des matériels pour renforcer ses activités dans son entreprise. Avec ses revenues il entretien sa famille et compte agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Salif Richard A. is an electrician who lives in the Mbour 1 neighborhood in Thiès, a city located 70 kilometers from Dakar. He's 45 years old and married, and he's been an electrician for 20 years. He works with companies and individuals, and already obtained loans that were repaid without problems. With this loan, he wants to buy supplies to bolster his business. With his profits, he provides for his family and intends to expand his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electric supplies

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 24-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Hasan has owned an accessory shop. He has requested a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan. 

Hasan considers himself special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had financial issues. Hasan decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Hasan will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Sayed Aslam Group

texts.en: S. Aslam is the group leader of S. Aslam group. There are three members in this group. They all would like to expand their businesses and need to purchase some necessary materials.  S. Aslam wants to take out a loan for his business of selling oil, Meermen Rona wants to use the funds for her tailoring business, and Ahamd Shah wants the loan for his tire repair business.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni R. sells green vegetables, mangoes, and other items and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Poni is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a peasant. They have three children and they all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop to sell her produce.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is only 22 years old. She is involved in a vending business in their rural village of San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Jay-ar C. who is presently working as a helper to support their daily needs. The couple has a child named Mikyla Jane who is now three years old. 

Michelle sells vegetables in their place and is proposing to Kiva lenders to borrow PHP 6,000 in order to make her business grow and be more beneficial for her family, especially for her child who soon will enter school. She purchases fresh vegetables in their public market then sells them in the village. Michelle also wants to venture into a direct-selling business if she will have enough capital, so that she will have another extra source of income aside from vending.

At present, her family is living in the house of her parents-in-law. This is one of the reasons why she keeps on working hard for them to have their own house someday.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Jeaneth Del Socorro

texts.es: Jeaneth del Socorro S. P. tiene la edad de 30 años. Tiene 1 hijo y depende de ella. Jeaneth se dedica a la venta de joyas. Su negocio inicio hace 7 años en esta actividad. Por lo que sus amigas son sus principales clientes, actualmente ha aumentado sus clientes por lo que tiene más pedidos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pulseras, cadenas, aretes y tobilleras. El deseo de Jeaneth es que nunca le ocurra nada malo ya que muchas veces viaja a lugares muy largos con todos sus productos.
texts.en:
Jeaneth is thirty years old and has one son that is dependent upon her. Jeaneth sells jewelry. She has had this business for seven years. Her friends are her main customers. Her customer base is growing as she has had more requests for her product lately. The financing that she is asking for is for working capital in order to buy bracelets, chains, earrings and ankle bracelets. Jeaneth hopes that nothing bad will happen to her because she travels long distances with all her products.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es:
Las Sras. del grupo "San Marcos"  estan ubicadas en el minucipio de Danli, El Paraiso.  
ellas se conocen muy bien, siempre han trabajado juntas ya que son vecinas el credito que solicitan es de mucha importancia ya que podran adquirir mas materia prima y mercaderia para las ventas en su negocios.
a continuacion se detalla las actividades de cada una de ellas:

la sra. ELSA DEL CARMEN S.: se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de comida, golosinas, refrescos, etc. tiene 10 años de estar laborando en este tipo de actividad comercial y de este negocio saca  ganancias para poder contribuir con los gastos del hogar, ella le ayuda a su esposo a cubrir con los gastos del hogar.

la sra. AMADA GRISELDA L.: se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de comidas, golosinas actividad  
que viene desarrollando desde hace 2 años,  su negocio se encuentra ubicado dentro de la fabrica de tabacos Plasencia donde laboran mas de 1500 obreros, La Sra. L. nos comento que durante este tiempo le ha ido bien pero con ganas de salir adelante, una desventaja que ha tenido es que cuenta con poco capital para poder surtir mas su negocio.

la sra. EVELIN JOHANA T. H.: Su actividad principal es la  elaboracion de venta de comidas y golosinas, gracias a este negocio le permite apoyar a su compañero de hogar con los gastos que se generan en el hogar. ella nos comento que durante todo este tiempe le ha ido muy bien y esto debido a la buena administracion que ella le da a  su negocio y con el credito que esta solicitando le permitira satisfacer la demanda de los clientes.
texts.en:
The women of the San Marcos Group are located in the municipality of Danli, El Paraiso. They know each other very well. They have always worked together since they are neighbors. The credit they are applying for has a lot of importance for them since it will allow them to acquire more basic material and merchandise for the sales in their businesses. Below we specify the activities of each woman:

Elsa is engaged in the preparation and sale of food, sweets, soft drinks, etc. She has 10 years of experience working in this type of commercial activity. From this business she draws profits in order to be able to contribute to household expenses. She helps her husband with the household expenses.

Amada is also engaged in making and selling food and sweets, a business she has been developing for 2 years. Her business is located inside the Plasencia tobacco factory where more than 1500 laborers work. Amada told us that she has done well during this time but, with her desire to move forward, one disadvantage she has had is that she has little of the capital required in order to be able to supply more for her business.

Evelin’s principal activity is the making and sale of foods and sweets. Thanks to this business she is able to support her housemate with the expenses they generate in the household. She has told us that during all this time things have gone very well and that this is due to the good management she gives her business. The credit she is applying for will permit her to satisfy the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tortillas, rice, lard, beans, meat, soft drinks, salt, spices, water, bread, vegetables, chicken, pork, and rice

loans.name: Vumilia

texts.en:
Vumilia is a member of the Amani borrower group In Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 21 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is 3 years aged.

Vumilias started her own fishing business selling dry fish 3 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 60,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Vumilia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more fish.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Vumilia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda U., a native of the peaceful town of Morong, Rizal Province in the Philippines, is a 29-year-old mother of a boy and a girl and happily living with her husband Rodolfo, a 28-year-old farmer.

While her children are still small, Erlinda wants to invest and to look for additional sources of income in preparation for the future needs of her children, especially their school fees. In 2003, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines to have access to capital for her business. For almost ten years already, with her husband as her partner, she has been engaged in fishing as her primary and farming as her secondary business. Her businesses earn sufficient income to sustain the needs of her family.

Now on her ninth loan, she is seeking to borrow 20,000 pesos to pay for the repair of their fishing boat, purchase 30 kilos of fish nets and a 24 volt battery and to pay labor expenses. She believes that her fishing business will grow since fish are in demand in the market. She dreams of sending her children to school, having savings for the future, repairing her house and constructing a fish cage for her fishing business

loans.use: To pay for the repair of fishing boat, assorted 30 kilos of fish nets, 24 volt battery and labor expenses.

loans.name: El Gallito Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Gallito” esta representado por la señora Nidia y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos, comida rápida, licores artesanales y ropa interior. En el anterior ciclo se tuvieron inconvenientes debido a la enfermedad repentina D. uno D. sus integrantes, pero  el trabajo en equipo y las ganas D. seguir trabajando saco a flote a todo el grupo sin mayores percances. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante para obtener mejores ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en la compra D. insumos al por mayor, mercadería acorD. a la época y herramientas para elaborar mas y mejores productos. Las socias van cursando su segundo ciclo dentro D. la institución por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben como administrar los fondos con responsabilidad y honestidad, es por esta razón que la fundación les brinda un tercer apoyo económico para que puedan sacar adelante a sus familias. 
Capital D. Operraciones
texts.en:
The "El Gallito" group is led by Señora Nidia and composed of 12 members who sell cosmetics, fast food, artesenal spirits, and underwear. In their previous business cycle, they had some setbacks due to the sudden illness of a member, but working as a group and the desire to continue working kept everyone afloat without further mishap. As in the entire commercial sector, there exists the competition of supply and demand, but these members know how to forge ahead in order to earn the best incomes to then give to their families so they can have a better quality of life. This loan will be used to diversify the group's product lines and to invest in buying products at wholesale, up-to-date merchandise, and the tools to develop the best products. The members are beginning their second business cycle with the organization therefore they have experience working together in solidarity and know how to administrate their funds responsibly and honestly. Because of these reasons, the foundation grants them a third of their economic support so that they and their families can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Lucia es soltera, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Lucia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Lucia son ampliar su negocio y brindar estabilidad a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz y azúcar.

loans.name: Narciso Pedro

texts.pt:
Narciso Pedro V. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital de Moçambique, tem 30 anos de idade pai de 4 filhos de 3 a 9 anos de idade destes os mais velhos vão à escola. Vive na casa própria em Massaca, distrito de Boane com a sua família e um irmão. Neste momento frequenta o 3º ano de faculdade de ciências pedagógicas na Universidade Pedagógica em Maputo, sua esposa também trabalha como educadora num infantário.

Sempre viveu com os seus pais na cidade de Maputo ate ao seu casamento onde decidiu fixar sua residência em Massaca. Trabalha como docente a mais de 10 anos, foi formado pelo Instituto do Magistério Primário da Matola (IMAP) neste momento aufere um salário de 7.000.00MT por mês. Tem uma empregada domestica e por vezes consegue poupar cerca de 2.000.00MT por mês.

Já pediu empréstimo no Banco comercial BIM no valor de 29.000.00MT para o inicio da sua obra, é através de seus amigos que também são clientes que conheceu a Hluvuku depois de sua analise, preferiu continuar a levantar créditos nesta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00MT com o qual pretende comprar portas, cimento, pedra, areia e outros. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 15.000.00MT, 20.000.00MT e 35.000.00MT todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro gostaria de pedir mais empréstimos para a conclusão da sua residência e adquirir uma viatura, como forma de dar mais conforte e comodidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Narciso Pedro V. was born in the city of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. He is 30 years old and the father of 4 children, ages 3 to 9. The older children attend school. He lives in a home he owns in Massaca, in the Boane district, with his family and a brother. He is in his third year in the teaching program at the Teacher's University in Maputo. His wife also works as a preschool teacher. He lived with his parents in the city of Maputo until he got married, when he decided to move to Massaca. He has worked as a teacher for more than 10 years. He graduated from the Institute of Elementary Education of Matola (IMAP). He currently earns a monthly salary of 7.000.00 MT. He has a maid, and sometimes is able to save around 2.000.00MT per month. Narciso had already requested a loan from the BIM commercial bank for the amount of 29.000.00MT to begin construction on his home. He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are clients and after an analysis, decided to take out loans through Hluvuku. This 25.000.000MT loan is his third with Hluvuku, and will be used to purchase doors, cement, stones, sand, etc. The previous loans were for 15.000.00MT, 20.000.00MT and 35.000.00MT, all for the same purpose. In the future, he would like to take out more loans to complete his home and to purchase a car, as a way to provide more comfort and convenience to his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, stones, etc. )

loans.name: Men

texts.en: The woman in the photograph is Men T., age 38. She lives in the province of Pursat, which is the best territory for farming. Men T. has two young children who attend school and depend on her care. Men T. owns a medium farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on her land. Another source of family income comes from her husband's battery charging business. From this charging service, Men T.'s husband can generate a good income. Men T. is taking out her loan to buy another machine for battery charging in order to satisfy their customer’s needs.

loans.use: To buy a battery charging machine

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 23 years old. She is married but has no children. She is a trader in jeans, clothes, blouse, skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She says her working capital was provided by her husband, but has not been adequate for her business. She has been in business for the last three years now and is not able to purchase high-quality products. Florence believes the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase good quality items in large quantities to scale up sales. For Christmas, she knows adequate funds can boost her stock with variety and hence, increased profit. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, clothes, ladies' wear and slippers to increase her inventory. She would be glad and grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, clothes, ladies' wear and slippers

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia O., a 62-year-old woman who lives in Pasay City. She is married to Fernando, a local community peace-keeping volunteer.

Lucia started a coin-operated video games arcade last year that has proved to be very popular to many customers, especially children, and her days are now very busy. She earns more than PHP 15,000 in monthly profits from her business.  She is using this money to send her child to college.

Leticia considers her membership with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative a heaven-sent blessing, and she mentions this frequently to friends and relatives. She has applied for a loan for PHP 12,000 to renovate her arcade, which was slightly damaged by recent typhoons. She will use the money to buy plywood panels and roofing materials.  

Soon, thanks to her hard work, Leticia expects her child to graduate from college and help the family escape from living in poverty. 

About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to renovate a video arcade center

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana Gladis P. L. de 45 años de edad, reside en Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su compañero de vida y tres hijas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia, es por esto que se esfuerza mucho por mantener su negocio a flote, negocio el cual esta ubicado en el centro de San Salvador, en el cual comercializa productos varios como shampoo, pasta dental, salsa de tomate, especias y otros productos más. Ana Gladis solícita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar más productos, sobre todo aquellos los cuales cuentan con más demanda como granos básicos. Ella espera poder aumentar sus ventas ya que su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle una mayor ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Ana Gladis P. L., age 45, resides in Apopa in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her partner and her 3 children. She is a hardworking woman who is worried about the well being of her family, which is why she works so hard to maintain her business. The business is located in the center of San Salvador and offers various products like shampoo, toothpaste, tomato sauce, spices, and other items. Ana Gladis is requesting a loan because she wishes to buy more products, especially those in high demand like staple grains. She hopes to be able to increase her sales because her greatest wish is to be able to help her husband with the costs of maintaining their home and the children.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple grains.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Eliava Ayikoru Joyce Group

texts.en:
Joyce  A. is a forty-year old enterprising businesswoman. She is married and has five children who go to school. She also cares for one dependent, who is also in school. Joyce lives in the Eliava Village in Arua District.

She has been selling cassava flour for ten years. She is using the loan to purchase bags of cassava flour to sell. Her business is improving and she is earning higher profits. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to build a better house.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Petty Traders Association Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Petty Traders Association' group. As their name suggests, they are small-scale businesspeople in the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 1,600,000 (or SLL 800,000 each) to enable them to boost their businesses.

Jariatu K. is the leader of this group of two. The 37-year-old was born in one of the several villages that make up Sanda, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with 5 children. Two of her children are in primary school and 3 are in secondary school. Jariatu makes and sells soap and has been in this business for 5 years now. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying working materials like oil, caustic soda, powder and so on.

loans.use: Buy working materials like oil, caustic soda, powder and so on

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta N. est une femme de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc villageois depuis 2 ans et a 4 fois de suite été bénéficiaire de prêt. Elle développe un petit commerce de chaussures, de pâte d'arachide, de jus naturel et de friperie. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anta N., 37, is married and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member of her Village Bank for two years and has received 4 consecutive loans. She is working at expanding a little business selling shoes, peanut butter, natural juice, and used clothing. Her goal is to help improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married and has three children. She has received no formal education.  

Mary sells tomatoes, peppers, onions and so on at Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now. Her husband is a farmer.  Mary uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and bills.  

She will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Mary plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida tiene 61 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado muy duro para sobre salir en la vida. Actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos, Karina y Diego, y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

En el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma, se encuentra su puesto donD. venD. cuyes, corderos y cerdos, los cuales están bien alimentados y cuidados, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y sus ingresos económicos son buenos. Paralelamente a esta actividad, se dedica a preparar comida para eventos o fiestas, ya que es muy buen cocinera y tiene una sazón muy exquisita.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, ya que los cría con mucho cariño, lleva 8 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera D. clientes. 
Para el futuro, planea instalar una tienda D. abarrotes, con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el octavo préstamo D. Alida con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará alimento para sus animales menores.
texts.en:
Alida is 61 years old, and she is a woman who has always worked very hard to be outstanding in life. Now she lives in her own house next to her two children, Karina and Diego, and what she most wants is to have a peaceful old age. Her stall is in the largest market of the city of Tarma, where she sells guinea pigs, lambs, and pigs, which have been well fed and cared for. For this reason, she has many customers and her economic income is good. In parallel with this activity, she prepares food for events and parties, since she is a very good cook and uses delicious seasonings. What she likes most about her work is feeding her animals, since she raises them very lovingly. She has been in this business for eight years. She finds that the most difficult part is having to stay at her stall all day waiting for customers. In the future, she plans to set up a grocery story, with which she will be able to improve her economic income. This is Alida's eighth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments punctually and she is ready to do that. In her community bank, she is a very happy and responsible member. With the 1200 PEN that she is applying for now, she will buy food for her young animals.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for her animals

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley N. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been in business for almost three years. She is the married mother of three grown-children. Her husband is a driver in the community while she manages her own variety store to supply additional income for the family.

Shirley would like to receive a loan of 13,000 PHP as working capital for her variety store to fund added groceries for her store. A proud member since 2007 of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines, Shirley has been a dedicated member with regular attendance at weekly center meetings and solid repayments on previous loans.

Shirley’s longterm goals are to build her own home. Also, she hopes the profits from her business will fund continued education for all her grandchildren. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Shirley is determined to achieve a winning business and to build more longterm financial security for herself and her family.

loans.use: To fund the purchase of added groceries for her store

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 70 years old and married with 18 children, ranging in age from 18 to 45. He is currently supporting the schooling of 4 students, including 3 of his grandchildren. He runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where he has been farming for over fifty years.  His main source of income is selling maize, bananas, potatoes, milk and poultry products at the local market. He says that the main challenges to his business are poor prices for his produce and difficulty in accessing quality dairy animals.

Francis requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will enable his grandchildren to have a better life and education. In the future, Francis would like to concentrate on his dairy farming and be a major supplier in his area.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Basilica,  ella tiene 59 años de edad es casada y nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración de su tienda de abarrotes puesta en su propia casa y la implementación de un internet en el distrito de San Sebastián. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio de internet.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Comuzone Communal Bank. Our member lives in the city of Cusco, Huanchac district, Cusco department. Our member is Mrs. Basilica. She is 59 years old and married. Our member alternates between her household activities; running her grocery store, which is in her own house; and setting up an internet business in the San Sebastián district. Our member is requesting the loan to establish her internet business. The member is grateful for and values the support given through this institution, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up her internet business

loans.name: Pok

texts.en: Mrs. Pok O. is 63 years old and is a villager who lives in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming she also sells sugar palm, and makes a small income to support her family. For her sugar palm business, Mrs. Pok O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more sugar palm to expand her business activities. She is a widow with two children, one is a laborer while the other one is a famer and also helps with Mrs. Pok O.'s farming.

loans.use: To buy more sugar palm for resale

loans.name: Kok

texts.en: Mr. Kok P. is 63 years old. He lives in Choes Village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice. To support his farm, Mr. Kok P. decided to request a loan to purchase a harvesting machine to improve his farm production. In addition to being a farmer, Mr. Kok P. also works as a farm laborer.  He earns a little salary which he uses to support his family. Mr. Kok P. is widower with four children; three are seamstresses in the garment factory and one drives a harvesting machine.

loans.use: To purchase a harvesting machine

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, el mayor de 17 años y la menor de 6 años. Elena se inició en el negocio con la ayuda de su esposo, pusieron una tiendita en su casa, su esposo es artesano y junto a sus hijos le ayuda en las ventas, Elena también trabaja como Asistenta en el Hospital de Huamanga.

Elena solicita un préstamo de 1800 soles, dinero que sera invertido en la compra de arroz, harina en sacos al por mayor para su negocio, agradece a FINCA por los prestamos recibidos, pues no solo han sido un apoyo económico, sino que gracias a las capacitaciones a aprendido a como invertir.

El sueño de Elena es tener una tienda mayorista en su casa, ella vive junto al terminal terrestre y piensa que puede ser un gran negocio aprovechando al publico que frecuenta el terminal.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Paloma (The Dove) comunal bank; she is married and has 5 children who range in ages from 17 to 6 years. Elena started out in her business with help from her husband; they set up a small store in their home. Her husband is an artisan and together with their children he helps her with sales. Elena also works as an assistant in Huamanga’s hospital. Elena is asking for an 1800 sol loan to buy sacks of rice and flour at wholesale for her store. She is grateful to FINCA for the loans received because they haven’t been just an economic help but thanks to the training sessions she has learned how to invest. Elena’s dream is to have a wholesale store in her home. She lives next to the land transportation terminal and she feels that this would be a great business because of the large number of people who frequent the terminal.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sacks of rice and flour at wholesele.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: college tuition

loans.name: Raul Napoleon

texts.en:
Raul Napoleon V. M. is 40 years old. He is married and lives with his 6 children, aged from 2 to 19, in the province of Bolivar.

Raul is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Raul works in agriculture. He cultivates blackberries, corn, potatoes and beans. He purchases and sells his products in cities of Guaranda and Montalvo (more than 2 hours away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops every 8 months

Raul is asking for this loan to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers. He thinks the loan is a great help to his work. His dream is to have enough to eat and more credit. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn, that endanger the harvest. He also has health problems in the family.

He likes sports such as playing volleyball and soccer.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Edison Enrique

texts.es:
Edison Enrique C. R., tiene 24 años.  Es soltero  y vive con la mama, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo, Edison.

Edison es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Edison se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz, maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Peña o en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, maíz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es salir adelante en los estudios. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Edison Enrique C. R. is 24 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in the Ventanas province of Los Rios. He has one son, Edison. Edison is a member of the community bank "Valle Alto," which is located in Voluntad de Dios precinct, an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture. This is their second loan with the San José Cooperative. Edison works in agriculture. He plants rice, corn, and beans. He makes his purchases every month in the city of Ventanas and sells his products in the Peña commercial center or in the same location. He is applying for the loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice, corn, and beans. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to advance himself. His dreams are to go further in his studies. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases. He likes to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds for rice, corn, and beans

loans.name: Eloy Rodolfo

texts.en:
Eloy Rodolfo M. C. is 38 years old. He lives in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. He has one child aged 16 years old. Eloy is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Eloy works in agriculture. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther. He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer for his cacao crops. His dream is to buy a plot of land within the next five years. 

He spends his free time doing household chores and taking care of his animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his cacao crops

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her children are currently in school.  Maria has a business running a restaurant, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food to stock, like sugar and rice.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Maria hopes to generate greater profits and pay for her family's food and school fees.  In the future, Maria hopes to own a house and another retail shop.  

Maria is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to expand a business and be responsible.

loans.use: to buy food to stock like sugar and rice

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.pt:
Jorge Alberto T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 5 filhos de 7 a 27 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez 12ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta seus pais enviando algum rancho alimentar. 

Nunca saiu da capital, trabalha como docente numa escola primária ha mais de 27 anos e não possui nenhum empregado. Tem um salario de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum valor na sua conta bancaria, uma vez que sua esposa também faz um negocio para ajudar nas despesas de casa.

Já teve empréstimo no Milenium BIM e pagou com muito sucesso. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas, este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto T. was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 5 children ages 7 to 27.  All attend school.  He completed school through the 12th grade but did not continue due to a lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home wit his family and also supports his parents by sending them food assistance.

He still lives in the capital, and has worked as a teacher in an elementary school for more than 27 years.  He does not have any employees.  He earns a salary of 5.000.00 per month which he uses for household expenses, and he is able to save some in his bank account when his wife also works to help with household expenses. 

He already had a loan with Milenium BIM and paid it with great success.  He learned about Hluvuku through colleagues.  This is his first loan, in the amount of 20.000.00, which he will use to purchase construction materials (iron bars, cement, sand, stones, etc.) to continue building his house.  

He is confident that he will pay off the loan without any problems and request a new loan to begin his own business.

loans.use: purchase construction material (iron bars, cement, sand, stones, etc.)

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es: El señor Fernando Jose C. S., tiene la edad de 40 años, es casado y su esposa labora como domestica en una casa en particular, apoyando a los gastos que se incurren en su hogar, el señor C. trabaja como fontanero para la Empresa Nicaragüense de Agua Potable,  siendo este el ingreso más importante de la familia, ellos tienen 3 hijos que los apoyan en las actividades del hogar, ellos habitan en una humilde casita que se ha deteriorado por el paso de una serie de tormentas que atacaron al país estos últimos meses. Es para su hogar que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan la culminación con las remodelaciones en su vivienda, es para Don Fernando de suma importancia como jefe de familia, la finalización de este proyecto para favorecerlos, con un espacio digno donde morar y desarrollar sus vida para un crecimiento optimo.
texts.en:
Fernando is 40 years old, married, and his wife works as a domestic servant in a private home to help with household expenses.  He works as a plumber for the Nicaraguan Potable Water Enterprise, and his is the most important income for the family.  They have 3 children who help with household activities.  The family lives in a humble little house which has deteriorated with the passage of a series of storms that attacked the country in recent months.

It is for his home that Fernando seeks a loan, to buy construction materials that will allow him to finish remodeling his house.  It is very important for Fernando, as head of the family, to finalize the project on the family's behalf, with a space that is worthy of them and where they can live and develop their lives for optimal growth.

loans.use: TO FINISH CONSTRUCTING HIS HOME
